Reviews.Title: “Great location and newly renovated rooms was a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Menippe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the room with the harbour view with free internet access. The location was great being right next to the Wan Chai Ferry Terminal and there were easy access to food and taxis. Went to the swimming pool and the service was good, served you ice water and had a good swim there as the pool was bigger than the JW Marriott :)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly very good service”
Reviews.Author: DharmaHMC
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to Hong Kong and stayed here for one night and must say I am impressed. From the speedy check-in to the personalized attention from the staff (greeting me by name, taking time to explain directions, recommend restaurants), to the free internet (if you are a Marriott member) to the comfortable clean rooms. For a business hotel this is great. I paid for a convention rate, asked nicely for a possible upgrade and they gave me a corner room that had a view of the bay. The rooms were very modern and clean. I loved that the bed was so comfortable - got a very good nights sleep. It is also in such a prime locations -- attached to the convention center, minutes away from the Wan Chai MTR station. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and Easy access to all parts of HK”
Reviews.Author: Ssleepy
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 4 day stay at this hotel. We chose this hotel since I was attending a conference at the Convention Centre which is attached to the hotel. The ride from the airport was about 30 minutes long on a weekday, mid-afternoon. Cost was about $25 USD. The staff were professional, hospitable and made you feel like you are a valued customer at all times. Check-in and Check-out was smooth and efficient. They gave us an "older room with carpeting" as the front desk clerk termed it. The room is still modern and clean albeit a little smaller than what we are used to by North American standards but was still acceptable. The bathroom amenities were good quality and the water pressure in the shower was fantastic! During conventions the elevators get really busy during peak hours 8-9am when everyone is comin/going to breakfast and getting to convention events. Wireless internet worked without a problem. I suggest signing up for a Marriot Rewards Card, we got free internet because we were members of their rewards program. We tried the lobby lounge for drinks and small bites to eat. The food was good and the price is comparable to other typical hotel dining options, in other words, a little bit on the high side. There is live entertainment in the evenings and the singer is quite good. The buffet breakfast was included in our room rate and the choices and variety are excellent. If you are paying for breakfast it is a little pricey, around $USD 35-40 I think. There are cheaper alternatives at the convention centre, a nice cafe and also a restaurant where you get chinese fare. The MRT and Ferry are easily accessed through covered walkways and about a 5 minute walk at a leisurely pace. The convention centre is about a 3 minute walk through air conditioned lobbies. HK's public transportation is superb and easy to navigate. We had no problem hopping over to the Kowloon side and depending on the time of day it cuts travel time down considerably as compared to taxi. Took about 15 minutes to get to Mong Kok area. I suggest if you are going to use the MRT for any amount of time to get the Octopus Card at the station. You can load up as much HK dollars as you want and can get any unused credit back when you leave. The card is also good at many convenience stores and restaurants, including some at the convention centre. The area directly around the hotel has numerous places to eat from McDonalds to more traditional fare. There are also numerous go-go bars sprinkled among the eateries with girls trying to entice you in for "drinks". Please don't let this deter you from walking around, it is quite safe even at night and no one will bother you if you are not interested. Shopping Mall is really not an option around the hotel, but a quick one-stop ride on the MRT to Causeway station will provide you with the shopping malls that you desire. There is a huge 3 storey electronics centre right by the walking way bridge to the MRT. Tonnes of everything electronic from laptops to cell phone accessories. I would recommend this hotel especially if you are in HK for any convention events. If you want a hotel with more to offer around it's immediate surrounding area than this may not be for you if you are hesitant to use the public transportation system.

Reviews.Title: “If its' in your budget, look no further”
Reviews.Author: Wajjin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days in room with harbour view. From the time i had my first interaction with the personnel at the gate till they bid farewell to me, I was treated like a VIP, though being just one of many who came to attend congress in the convention centre. Have stayed in Astoria in Rome and Sheratons in multiple places, but the friendliness and service was beyond anything I have ever expected before. It maybe that people of Hong Kong are overall friendlier, but if ever I visit HK again, this is the place for me. The lobby, the lifts that take you within seconds to 40th floor, the decor, the freshness of air, the soft thick carpets in the corridors (first time a carpet that feels and smells as new), the michelin restaurant, the view from hotel, the cleanliness of rooms and fresh fruits as good night, i can go on praising, but the space is short. I loved my stay and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull stay - great views and service.”
Reviews.Author: woody1275
Reviews.Content: Well back to Hong Kong for a four day visit enroute to Australia. We used to live in HK and this was a return visit after 12 years! Check in at the hotel was swift and smooth. We stayed an extra night so we had been upgraded to a harbour view room. Room was lovely and clean with a great view. Pool was big and really well presented. Again with good views. Wan Chai is is good place to explore and easy to get to Central (use the tram its cheaper but you do need change) and to Kowloon (Star Ferry about a 2 min walk from hotel and again the cheapest way to cross - the night time crossing is awsome with the lights of HK). From the airport take the train (100HK$ to the IFC terminus in Central and outside there is a free bus that services hotels on HK side) we did not know about this and lugged our cases on the MTR! but did use it on the way out. We did not eat at the hotel as we know HK well and went out with friends. All in all a really good hotel with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: Pasyalero
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the 14th time last April this year. The hotel never disappointed me not even once. Everything in this hotel is excellent. 1. Professional and Friendly Staff 2. Great location easily accessible to anywhere. You are just minutes away from the famous Nathan road by a ferry ride. If you love night life you are a just a leisurely walk away from several bars and night clubs. Fast food and fine dining restaurants are just several steps away as well as the nearest convenience store. You don't even need an umbrella to get there if is raining because of the covered pedestrian bridge adjoined to the hotel. There are also several shopping stores within the hotel premises. They also have a free transfer from the train station to the hotel. 3. Food is excellent that I could not elaborate more. 4. Very convenient rooms with a great view of the harbor and the sea. This is my hotel of choice in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CollierL
Reviews.Content: Stunning views over the harbour that change throughout the day. Staff are excellent and helpful. Rooms not large but everything you need, spotlessly clean. Easy to walk or take a taxi to most places. Star ferry right next to the hotel, plus the convention center of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome View”
Reviews.Author: Nate L
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Renaissance Harbour View hotel in August 2012. My experience was very positive. The check-in and check-out experience were both very fast and the service from the staff was excellent. My room (that was recently remodeled) was simple yet stylish and had everything I needed for a productive business trip. My favorite part about the hotel was the view from my room. I was on the 20th floor facing the harbor and it was one of the most magnificent views I have ever experienced from a hotel. I would strongly recommend a high floor room with a view of the harbor. The hotel is centrally located in Hong Kong and there is quick access to taxis, boats, and the trolley. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family traveling to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific View. TerrifIc Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dachsi-06
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great location. On the harbour front next to the star ferry ideal for trips over to Kowloon. Ideal to get around the sights from here but at the same time enjoy a luxury hotel with great amenities. Superb pool area outside. Would recommend booking a club room as the extras are well worth it. And the view from the club room on the 40th floor is stunning to look out of while eating breakfast, afternoon tea and cakes or evening nibbles and drinks etc. very relaxing. Hong kong is fun and exciting with so much to do and enjoy. Third time here and we shall keep on returning:)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding convenience in HongKong”
Reviews.Author: guldensporen
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, part of the Marriot chain, recently renovated with modern rooms which are pleasant , with a confortable bathroom (only shower) and a work desk. Hotel has some excellent restaurants and a cosy bar with live music. Some of the rooms have view on the Harbour. There's a great open air swimming pool . There is nearby a fitness center you can access through the hotel(but not based in the hotel). Extremely helpfull staff. Consider a limousine pick up from and to the airport to avoid surprises with local taxis. Is next to he convention center.

Reviews.Title: “For a business hotel in Hong Kong, you cannot get better.”
Reviews.Author: IanCarGLA
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Renaissance Harbour View Hong Kong 5 times now - last time in February 2012 on a business trip. It is right beside the convention centre, so gets a ton of business from delegates - but although it is a business hotel by and large, and not a small property, it does, to me, seem to have a nice feel. My room, on the Club floors, overlooking Hong Kong harbour was mesmorising - the Star Ferry running from the Island to Kowloon never ceased to entertain me! The Club lounge staff - some of the best I have had the privilege of meeting and the concierge on the ground floor - so helpful. And if the weather is nice, don't forget to pop out onto the swimming pool and take a drink at the bar. All in all, if you are in HK on business - or even pleasure - would not hesitate to recommend this property. Fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the people!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides incredible views accross Victoria Harbour as it is at the waters edge. If you are fortunate enough to stay on Floors 40/41/42 then you will be looked after by a superb team of people who run the Club Lounge. This hotel offers excellent value for money and is very conveniently located. However, it really is the staff that make the difference. They are unfailing polite and are anxious to "go the extra mile" for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Rather lonesome”
Reviews.Author: busybeesbiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to the HK Exhibition Centre and the Grand Hyatt. on Fodor's recommendation, we went to the lounge for some live jazz music. it was a Saturday night and no band was playing. The view from the lounge did not commend itself. Altogether a rather sad existence.

Reviews.Title: “Good and well located”
Reviews.Author: nnantasy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly staff. Located right at the Wanchai and nearby to office buildings. 7-11 and others food stalls nearby. Free internet access for members, however wifi can be improved. Clean and spacious room. Will surely revisit again.

Reviews.Title: “Views and a super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: martin d
Reviews.Content: Hotel is first class in staff and physcial building and surround. Next to water and beautiful sights from rooms. Lobby and restaurants the best. Just a really wonderful experience. Location is close and you could walk to most all things or to transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel in Wanchai”
Reviews.Author: GGlen78
Reviews.Content: Room is not spacious but was functional and stylishly decorated. Air-con was turned down far too cold for my liking :20 degrees. This is pretty normal in HK I gather. Internet connection worked fine. Breakfast is excellent. Make sure you hang around for the freshly-baked custard tarts that the waitress comes around with every half-hour!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the views or the helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ac_fava
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last five years and am always impressed. It is so well located, overlooking the Star Ferry and a quick (covered) walk to Wanchai or the Conference Centre. This time (July 2012) I had a corner room but the views were just as splendid as in the more expensive harbour view rooms - huge windows (throught which I witnessed a Number 8 typhoon as well as all the harbourside festivities laid on for a visit from the Chinese premier). The room was light and beautifully refurbished in blond wood and glass with a good sized bathroom (no bath however). The double room was fine for me my own but might have been a little small for two as no room for an armchair. As usual, the variety of international foods at the breakfast buffet was a delight and the staff all smiling and helpful. I was particularly grateful to concierge Bernard who looked after me when my ride to the mainland never turned up - he kindly phoned all the right people and sent me off to relax in the lobby till the problem was sorted. So thanks Bernard! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couples beware…stupidest renovation design ever means no privacy in the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: suzn1234
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed here lots, and in the past would have agreed with the generally positive flavour of reviews. However I have just stayed in one of their newly refurbished rooms (they have been renovating for ages, and are still renovating some areas) and their new design (while good in some things) has the worst designed bathroom I have ever seen (and I travel lots). I guess in an attempt to have a more spacious room, there is now no door between what is a combined entry hall/wardrobe and bathroom. Instead, there is a door separating this entry/bathroom from the bedroom. So you enter straight into a wide room which serves as entry hall, wardrobe, shelves, safe etc and bathroom. If there are two people in the room, this means that one can’t enter, exit, or get to the wardrobe without walking in on a person in the shower on the toilet. If you are the sort who likes to lock the bathroom door (e.g. to keep small children out), you can’t, I suppose because this would effectively lock them in the bedroom and so be a fire hazard. I stayed with my partner for a week, and we are fairly relaxed (ie I don’t mind if he walks in on me in the shower, but not on the toilet and vice versa). But it was a real pain never being able to get in and out or get to clothes while giving them privacy e.g. if one of us was out, and you wanted to go the toilet, you have to latch them out of the room to stop them walking in on you. The door between the bathroom and bedroom also has large holes at the base, so there is little separation in the bathroom from the sounds and smells of the bathroom (which was not fun when I was sick all night and making repeated visits to the bathroom. This design might work for a sole occupant (or for what I imagine are the rare couples who don’t mind their partner walking in on them on the toilet and in the shower). Even for singles, when my partner was out I found it off putting to have no door on the bathroom e.g. if you forget to latch the door and are in the shower, hotel staff could easily walk in on you, because you might not hear the bell. I can’t believe that a hotel chain would have proceeded with such a stupid, stupid design, when they could easily have put a door between the entrance hall and the bathroom (as they used to have, and still have in the unrenovated rooms!). I suspect they will have to retrofit them when they realise that most couples will hate this design. Meanwhile, I would suggest couples avoid this hotel, or ask for an older style room with a door on the bathroom! Ps and why do hotels like this spend so much money on everything, but can’t provide a decent hairdryer – giving something which may be fine for men, but takes forever to dry longer female hair!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great View, Very Convenient.....but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: ChrisW70
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott memeber and used my points here. But the rooms are approximately $450-500 per night. Its expensive because (1) its right by the harbor so you get a great view of the harbor; (2) its right next to the convention center, in fact, you can go directly from hotel to the convention center; (3) its very close to city center where all the restaurants and pubs are. We got a harbor view room. Room was very small (I'd say less than half the size of the Venetian Macau which I also reviewed), but it was clean and modern. So if you have more than 2 kids, either get a larger room type, or stay elsewhere. The hotel is probably more catered for business people. From the hotel, upstairs, you can go thru the doors and head to the convention center tunnel, then just go towards the city center. You are now on the bridge and below you, there are many restaurants. There is a McDonald's right at the bridge on second floor. This is all within 5 minutes of walk from hotel. There are stairs or conveyors to do down to the streets, where all the restaurants and pubs are. I recall there were also girly bars on the same street. We took subway to Hong Kong Disney and Ocean Park. Subway is also very close. Take the same bridge towards city streets and go down from there (ask front desk). The subway to Disney was long. After several stops, you get out and walk for a while (inside a transit hall of some kind) then you get on the dedicated Disney subway. Its dedicated because the trains have Disney shaped windows and other things. I think it took about an hour. Ocean Park was much closer. After few stops, you get out and take the Ocean Park bus. Also not far from the ferry landing to Macau. Anyways, hotel is convenient. If it wasnt for the high price, I would give it 5-star. If you are ok with the price, then I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Good value”
Reviews.Author: RobertS975
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in July 2012 (left a day early to beat Typhoon Vicente). All Marriott Rewards members get free internet. My room was comfortable with excellent AC, a definate need at this time of year with temps about 33C (92F) and intolerable humidity with dewpoints above 80F. The AC system had no difficulty keeping the room comfy. I received a decent discount AAA rate. The concierge lounge on the 40-41st floor presented an excellent full breakfast with both Asian and western food. And the evening cocktail hours featured beer and wine gratis along with several food dishes which I would actually substitute for a full dinner now and then. I did also eat in the restaurants in the hotel... great quality, perhaps a small price premium, but nothing too nasty. The hotel is a 10 minute covered walk from the Wen Chai MTR station. There are plenty of 7-11 and Circle K convenience stores on nearby streets and well as some small supermarkets, even a Marks and Spencer. Best way to get to/from the HKG airport is taxi between the hotel and Hong Kong station where there is an airport express train every 15 minutes. Taxi fare not more than 30HKD (less than $5 USD). Hotel pool is on the 11th floor. The pool is warm and only refreshing initially. There is also a poolside grill which does a fairly elaborate buffet for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: rafalution_2009
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Right next to the convention centre and the Star ferry terminal, which gets you to Kowloon avoiding the heavy traffic. Short 7 minute walk to the nearest MTR station. Lots of other amenities, convenience stores and restaurants nearby. Checking in was a bit slow, although the staff was polite and friendly. As with most hotel rooms in HK, the rooms here are not too spacious but adequate and comfortable. Room is clean and the mattress/pillows are comfortable. Try to request for rooms with the view of the harbour. Rates in this hotel are pretty good value in expensive HK. But don't expect a memorable, eventful or inspiring stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: acorntours
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip for 6 nights. My bedroom was a little on the small side but perfectly adequate. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean. Staff were very helpful and courteous. The location is very good, close to the MTR and across the road form the Star Ferry to Kowloon. Eating and drinking in the hotel is expensive but there are lots of bars and restaurants close to the hotel. Get a harbour view room if you can, the view is great. If you can afford it go for a club room and enjoy the "free" drinks, snacks and drinks in the club room on the 41st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: jopex
Reviews.Content: I have been staying this hotel frequently during last 12 months. Location is perfect with easy access also to Kowloon. Room renovation work has been bit disturbing and rooms are quite small but value is good compared to many more expensive hotels. Also service especially at top lounge has been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: rarnett
Reviews.Content: Was here for a few nights in July 2012. Fast, efficient check-in. Very courteous, friendly staff. Rather small rooms but the harbour views make up for it and the Club lounge is fantastic, especially for women travelling solo, and there were several here. Very handy to MTR and Ferry. A great place to stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, courteous staff, clean/comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: BostonianAU
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay, and my experience was very positive. I attended an event at the Convention Centre next door, so the location was very convenient. If you need to travel elsewhere in HK, taxis are readily available, and the MTR Is less than 10 mins walk. Staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. As breakfast was not included in my room rate, I used the room service some of the mornings, and the staff who delivered were very pleasant and friendly (as a non-morning person they helped to start my day off on the right foot). My only complaint was the fitness centre - I am not sure if it is always this way or a temporary arrangement due to renovations, but currently you need to go to the gym at the Hyatt next door (you can walk on the 11th floor roof garden, so you don't need to leave the complex). This gym was too small for 2 hotels worth of people, so when I used it I found it to be very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: portagio
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice rooms and a fantastic executive lounge. Although the prices in HK continue to rise (and this hotel is no exception), they offer consistently good service in a quality atmosphere. Great choice for travelers who are attending shows at the exhibition center.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccandyy
Reviews.Content: Good location. Nice rooms and great views of the harbour. Rooms are spacious and clean. Great service

Reviews.Title: “Steady hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMC1970
Reviews.Content: I may be being a little unfair, but I expected a little more from this hotel, but it was still very good. The staff were uber efficient, food good, general ambience very pleasant and a good all round hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with great access to anywhere”
Reviews.Author: JohanJohanJohan
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is the best if you always go with public transportation (train and ferry), it has cover walkway to wan chai mrt for 10-15 mins. Also a short walk to catch star ferry to ave of stars. Staff service is good, bed very comfortable and space is not too small. Furniture and design is pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Just for Convention Centre, but for Great Access to All of Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: angusboy02
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days and 3 nights at this Marriott Renaissance attached to the HK convention centre. I only was at the convention centre for 2 hours, but enjoyed the surrounding Wan Chai area the best. There are great restaurants, night clubs and shopping. There is even a 3HKD ferry attached where you can get to Kowloon shopping district in just 10 minutes. The hotel was definitely a 5 start with excellent service, great food, and reasonably priced at around $230 per night. I wasn't able to utilise the gym or pool, but it looked clean and respectable. I would definitely stay here again even if I wasn't attending a conference for the experience and quality based on price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Position and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Oz-Amanda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3.5 nights as a stopover on the way to Italy. The hotel is in a handy position in Wan Chai with the Star Ferry wharf across the road, lots of cafes in the area and raised covered walkways between all the main roads and buildings, with the subway close by as well. We found the staff to be reasonably friendly and efficient, but not excessively so. Our harbourview room was on the 28th floor and was quite small with only a sideways view of the famous harbour, but with a nice modern décor and free WiFi to Marriott Rewards members . The room has a laminate wooden floor which is a little hard under foot after long days sightseeing. Also there was no bath for a decent soak – just a large, albeit very good shower. There is no bathroom door so to speak – you walk in from the outside corridor into a wardrobe area on one wall and the open bathroom on the opposite side, with a door between here and the bedroom. There is a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom, but there are closable blinds. The bathroom is small but well fitted out, only negative being there isn’t enough hanging space/rails. The room could actually do with more storage space and larger drawers. Another negative is the mattress - it was rock hard and by far the hardest mattress we’ve ever slept on with no give at all. It did appear to have a mattress topper on it which made little difference. The windows were double glazed, but there was faint noise from outside, and the fridge in the room was quite noisy as well. We had room service breakfast one morning which was on time, but reasonably frugal with only teabags – no real tea. Another morning we had breakfast downstairs in Café Renaissance and even though it has a reasonable choice of menu items, again there was no real tea – just teabags brought in a pot. The cafe has no windows and no atmosphere at all, whereas the lobby lounge is very nice. A third morning we had breakfast at a café in the building opposite which was very enjoyable. The pool area of the hotel is very pleasant, with a decent size swimming pool and gardens around it. There is an outdoor restaurant and bar and it’s a nice place to enjoy a cocktail. The hotel shares the grounds with the Grand Hyatt and they share facilities which are able to be charged back to your room. All in all we had a pleasant stay and the hotel is in a good area with decent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly-by samflyer”
Reviews.Author: samflyer
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience at the Renaissance Hong Kong Harbour View is excellent. The rooms are very modern and clean, some with wood floors. Some have complained about the size of the desk (really?), but has has one (see pics). Carpeted hallways cut down on traffic noise. Great location in the heart of the city on Hong Kong Island in the Wan Chai district. It's very close to the Wan Chai subway stop (2-3 blocks away). Numerous restaurants, bars, shopping malls, etc within a 5 minute walk. Excellent views of Victoria Harbour from nearly any floor. And for the gold and platinum Marriott members, there are the usual Marriott Hotel rewards, but the club level evening cocktails and snacks are not to be missed; incredible views of the city during the setting sun is an incredible experience. Additionally, breakfast is full service at the club level. I cannot comment on the restaurant/bar in the lobby as I did not visit. The good: 1. The fully modern rooms 2. The room views 3. The club level (if you are authorized access to this) The bad 1. The price at nearly $300 USD per night can be steep, however you are in Hong Kong. Good luck finding any quality hotel in Hong Kong of similar price. The Ugly 1. No ugly here.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at its finest”
Reviews.Author: rthibod
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June, 2012 and I have nothing but good things to stay about all aspects of the hotel. The great: The staff at reception! When we checked in we were warmly and professionally greeted by a gentleman named Juergen. He was extremely helpful and made us feel at home. I mentioned to him that I had just asked my fiancé to marry me the night before and he wished us congratulations and gave us a free upgrade on our room. He took the time to ask about our plans in Hong Kong and provided excellent suggestions that we used. Probably the warmest welcome I have ever received at a hotel. Experiences with employees like this are what keep customers and encourage glowing reviews like this one. The women at the club level desk was also excellent! Friendly at all times, and helped us with several issues. She provided us with several power adapters for our laptops free of charge. She even worked the phones trying to hunt down a lost iphone for us. (Amazingly enough she was successful and found out it had been left on an airport shuttle bus!) I wish I had gotten her name so I could acknowledge her help but I missed it. The room! We were on the top floor (42nd) of the hotel, club level, and the view of the harbour was AMAZING. Huge full-length windows in both the bedroom and the adjoining suite. I highly recommend a harbour-view room, and if it is in your price range get a club level room. There are complimentary snacks, coffee, non alcoholic drinks as well as breakfast. The good: The hotel was at a good location next to the ferry dock. Easy to go across the harbour if you want. Also it is very close to the airport train. There is a free shuttle that services several hotels that runs all day (on the half hour I think but not sure exactly) It is a short shuttle ride. A cab from the hotel to the airport train cost us 20 HKD. The Not so good: Things were generally expensive here. This is a 5 star hotel (in Hong Kong no less) so cost may not be a concern for you, but 11$ (Canadian) for a fruit juice in the lobby bar is a little much.. If I come to Hong Kong again, I will definitely stay here and because of the great service I received I will be booking with Marriott again to see if this standard is maintained in all their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cooyal222
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a harbour view room which was very very clean, nicely decorated with incredible electrically controlled blinds which completely shut out the lights of the harbour at bed time. I had requested a high room if possible and was given the 35th floor. I thought 'wow' as this is not far from the very top. The receptionist asked if this was "alright". This is how obliging and helpful the staff are at this hotel. Nothing is too much trouble. As a Marriott member I had free Wifi in the room. If you need to print boarding passes (or anything else) it can be done for a very small fee at the business centre in the hotel. Ordered room service meal which was excellent and large servings. Taxis are easily obtained from the front of the hotel and are very cheap. On returning to airport by shuttle, instead of waiting out the front, the staff ask you to sit in the lounge and call you when it arrives. This is most relaxing and there is free Wifi in the lounge as well. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “worthy!!”
Reviews.Author: beulahdoc
Reviews.Content: what a lovely experience. the staff are unbelievably helpful and courteous. the rooms were typical of a big city hotel in that they are rather small, but they were clean, modern and well designed. do yourself a favor and upgrade to a room overlooking the harbour, what a view. the only downside of the stay was the gym facilities. it was small, old and very hot. not at all representative of the overall experience. i would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “New Renovated rooms are excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kkv1981
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great hotel. The check in staff were lovely, the new rooms are excellent, great size, comfy beds, big bathroom. Hotel is a good location although not as central as i am used too, but for the value this was excellent. Pool is shared with the Hyatt which in my view is the best hotel pool in Hong Kong! The Gym was not great. its shared with a one open to public. Once all rooms are renovated this will be a top 20 hotel in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: rclimbing
Reviews.Content: Recently, stayed at the Renaissance Harbour View from May 21 - 24. As a Marriott Gold member, I was upgraded to a room with a view of Victoria Harbour. We stayed on the 29th floor and it looked like the rooms were recently remodeled. The rooms were pretty small which I guess is typical for Hong Kong. We had two double beds and it was enough room for just the 2 of us. The room was done tastefully and in a more contemporary style. The one thing I did find odd was that a window overlooked the bedroom and the bathroom was not a separate room. Essentially, if you were taking a shower and someone came to the door the other person has to walk through the bathroom to get to the door, there is no wall separating the bathroom from the hallway. Your guest also has to walked through the bathroom to get through to the room. This layout is not practical or functional. The blinds also have to be closed on the window overlooking the bathroom. Otherwise, you have a lack of privacy. The way the bathroom was designed in my opinion does not offer much in the way of privacy. My other gripe about this hotel and the reason why I would not give it 5 stars is the hardness of the beds. For an US hotel chain, I expected the beds to be more soft and less firm especially when travelling overseas. This is part of the reason I booked this hotel knowing it is an American chain and typically the beds are much softer. I found that this was not the case for the Renaissance. The concierge lounge was great offering a great variety of food for breakfast and happy hour. They are strict about the 3 person limit per gold member. For the most part the hotel offers an excellent value, good service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Harbour View Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Siew Choy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Harbour View room in May 2012. What a view! You could see the whole expanse of harbour and all of its daily activities as well as the light show on the harbour each night. All the rooms have been newly renovated and are cosy and modern. The harbour view rooms are a little on the small side but still provide sufficient space, unlike hotel rooms in Japan. Beautiful rainfall shower in the bathroom but there was no tub for soaking. Beds were the usual exquisite Marriott beds. This hotel makes it easy to take care of children. There is a huge playground and a wonderful pool for them to play in as well as 2 cartoon channels on the large flat-screen TV. Location wise it cannot be beat. The Star ferry to Kowloon is next door and it is a 5 minute walk to Wan Chai MTR station. Around the neighbourhood are lots of shops and restaurants. This is a true 5-star hotel and the best I've seen in HK so far.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SunshineCoastLady
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I didn't really enjoy my stay here. The room was quite small and the airconditioning throughout the whole hotel was quite cold and didn't adjust that well in the room. I was going from humid hot weather outside to wearing a jumper in the conference rooms...I did end up getting quite ill with a flu along with a lot of other people there. Don't know if it was the aircon or not...... The staff and service of an exceptionally high standard! I did have high expectations considering the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingProducer
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my best friend, who is Gold in the Marriott Rewards program. She was treated so well - they'd made her a personalized luggage tag which they presented to her upon check-in. They fell all over themselves to give me one too when they found out I, too, had status. Just such lovely people. The tour desk was excellent and helped us find an tour to book to see the sights. Reasonable and informative and pleasant! The Executive Lounge did a very lovely happy hour and a breakfast that gave us the best of both Eastern and Western cuisines. The staff there also were exceedingly helpful in giving us very late checkout with no fuss. The room was nice, if a bit on the small side, but the view was unbeatable. I'd return here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: Mel P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week during a recent business trip to Hong Kong. Every day returning to my room was a joy. The weather that week was rainy, hot and the humidity wen it wasn't raining was close to 98%. A warm shower and a comfortable bed made me feel like a new man. The staff was courteous, professional and most of all - efficient! I had a great view of the harbor, a pleasant breakfast buffet every morning and a restful evening that made going out the next day that much easier. There is a lounge in the lobby with live entertainment most evenings and a comfortable place for good conversation. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lication, New Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Consultbishop
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times on biz trips. Location is very good, facilities are very good and service is decent. Breakfast buffet is excellent. Stayed on 35 th floor, newly renovated rooms. These are well done, only downside is that they are small. That said, this is Hong Kong and space is at a premium. Overall, very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good and central”
Reviews.Author: oxygen11
Reviews.Content: Modern, nice rooms. Great harbour view. Friendly staff. Checked in early, with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for business and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: nroth
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in this hotel primarily on business trip. It is ideally located, off from Central but only 2 MTR stops from Central. By taxi, very close to Central as well (10-15 minutes). The MTR stop is easily accessible by skywalk so very convenient when it is raining. The hotel is also 1 minute walk from star ferry wan chai that takes you to Kowloon in less than 10 minutes. The hotel itself is very good, it has nice pool area with a bar (which is not convenient in HK to have such a large pool). Rooms are spacious and clean and the beds are very comfy. Will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great property!”
Reviews.Author: don15215
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights here as tourists in Hong Kong. The hotel is beautiful, the service terrific and the location fairly handy. Our room had a panoramic view of Victoria Harbour but even if your room doesn't there are rooftop lounges that give you the same (or a better) view. Our room was clean, well appointed and comfortable. We had no complaints about the bed. The room is compact and there is a minimum of storage space but there was plenty of room for us to open our suitcases. The shower had a rainforest shower head plus a regular one which was quite a treat; there was no bathtub which was fine with us. Others have pointed out the the design of the room incorporates a sizeable picture window in the bathroom that overlooks the bedroom and consequently allows light in from the windows to the outside. Even if on a romantic holiday one might ask how romantic is it to watch your partner on the toilet? Their are blinds you can close (and we did) but it really doesn't seal out all the light or the view. It really wasn't a bother to us but obviously others digress from that point of view. The hotel has corridor connections both to the convention center and walkways to the subway system. Our room came with breakfast privileges in a club area on the 42nd floor, the nicest arrangement we've ever experienced. High quality food, wonderful views and great staffing. When we had to check out we missed the breakfast most of all!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Beds”
Reviews.Author: jgdeya
Reviews.Content: Darn these beds are like sleeping on rocks. Nice location and lobby but the double bed garden view rooms are lousy. From your bed you can see the silohuette of the person in the shower. Nice thing if you are with a lover but lousy if you are traveling for business and sharing room with a buddy. Overall one of the worse room I have stayed in many years. Take this from a guy who travels one or twice a month.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to the convention center.”
Reviews.Author: dorothy96734
Reviews.Content: This hotel shares a large pool, playground, and gym with the Hyatt. The rooms are pleasant and well maintained. Be advised that there is a large window between the bathroom facilities and the bedroom. though there is a blind it does not close that well. Storage is lacking. My husband and I had difficulty putting things away a d there was no place to set up a suitcase as a drawer. On the other ha d the staff were wonderful a d very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful scene of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: NanaMoo
Reviews.Content: As everything in Hong Kong this hotel is huge. The rooms are spacious and fully equipped with all necessities. The most beautiful thing is the view of the Harbor from the window. It is so peaceful when you look at the sea and watch the ships moving by. The hotel is connected to the Exhibition center which you can recognize it in one of Jackie Chan movies, Police Story. In this hotel you are close to the traditional shops whether you go by foot or by metro. Also nearby is the ship dock which will take you in a ship to the other part of the city across the sea.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here over 10 times. Its always good.”
Reviews.Author: jetboy_uk
Reviews.Content: I have been to over 20 Hong Kong hotels and this is the one I keep coming back to. I love the location. Being in Wan Chai is great for nightlife and the hotel is right on top of the Wan Chai ferry port that takes you over to Kowloon side by Ocean Plaza (shopping centre like IFC on the island) The rooms are small and I've never had a bath, only showers. Even in a club room its tiny, but this is Hong Kong - Get out and explore! The rooms are clean and modern. Never any complaints here. The lobby lounge looks at Kowloon, its nice to sit here and watch the lights come on as night falls. They have a nice selection and later on a pianist with a singer. The pool is huge. But this resort shares the "pool & gym" facilities with the neighboring hotel. The gym is a good 5 minute walk from the hotel. Its in the other hotel. I don't mind and neither should you. Its a good gym with a great view if your running at night. If your a Marriott loyalty card holder, the WiFi is free. If your not, sign up online now and when you arrive it will be free. If your in the club level, don't expect amazing breakfast in the lounge. Its one of the least impressive I've seen. I always take the train from the airport to Central and a taxi to the hotel. A taxi from the airport directly is 3 times the cost for a single traveller & no faster. If you want to stay in Kowloon and don't mind about the pool facilities, then goto the Shangri-La, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Barged in Room”
Reviews.Author: YuYuanDonguuan
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying people are very nice to me at this hotel. On this last trip they upgraded me to a club suite just for being gold something my platinum status at one of the H competitors never gets me. My major objections are: (1) A staff member opened the door literally one second after he knocked. To be fair I think this part of the Marriott Corp training as I have had it happen as far away as New Jersey I asked him what he wanted and he said he was checking on empty rooms. Odd. (2) Breakfast seating is as tight as a Parisin outdoor cafe and the people doing the seating are rude although the food is good (3) Despite the recent renovation all AC outlets are limited to HK UK style and one adaptor is insufficient these days. How many visitors are really from UK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Central with Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: Ming S
Reviews.Content: Around 10 mins walk to the Central MTR. The room it self is really impressive. I like the bathroom most. And the harbour view at night is really awesome. Room is very clean and tidy. Excellent service. Just a bit noise in the morning around 8-9am, i guess it is because it is located in the middle of the central. And you will find the bus connection centre downstairs to go to mainland of China.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but top quality”
Reviews.Author: nothingbutthebest
Reviews.Content: Located in the same complex as the Hong Kong Convention Centre in Wanchai, this is a first class business hotel, with the largest outdoor swimming pool in Hong Kong on the 11th floor. Widely used by expense account types and airline crews on stopovers. Service is faultless, with good food in the bar, choice of three excellent restaurants, evening piano bar, and 5 minutes from the Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon). Harbour view rooms are best. Only quibble is the price, which is twice what you might expect to pay for a similar hotel just a little bit less centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: vbh812
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the hotel in a renovated room on the 21st floor with a partial harbour view. The check-in was efficient and luggage delivery to the room prompt. Room size was ok by Hong Kong standards and seemed to have been renovated recently. Incredible to see how well the room was designed to cramp in so much into a small space. The harbour view was so good, it induced me to order breakfast to the room rather than go down to the buffet spread; this is something I rarely do. I asked for a 2pm check out and this was taken care of without any fuss. The Wan Chai MTR is 7-8mins away by foot and can be accessed via a network of covered walkways. My only gripe was with the concierge service. They were noncomital when recomendations were asked and when we asked them to make reservations at Aqua and Ozone for the evening they reverted back saying both the places were full. A direct call to the both the bars exactly 2 mins later found us with a 10pm reservation at Aqua and a 11:30pm reservation at Ozone. When we asked for a cab later to head to the bars, we were informed of a min of 1hr waiting as they had a queue outside the hotel due to bad weather. They had no cabs on call and could not suggest a phone number to call either. The hotel limo was priced at 800HKD per hour and would also take an hour to come. We had to walk a short distance and hail our own cab; this wasn't a big issue but added to the issues we had with the concierge "navigator, as they call it" service.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views when the rain permitted!”
Reviews.Author: Himself_again
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the previous reviews, we contacted the hotel in advance of our trip and requested a renovated room on a high floor, ideally with a harbour view. This paid dividends as the room that we were allocated provided us with a breathtaking backdrop and really added to an all round excellent stay. We had access to the Club Lounge which was a lovely bonus - good spread of snacks and beverages and very attentive, friendly staff. The location of the hotel is very good with easy access to the MRT and Star Ferry. Couple of minor gripes (most of which are well documented so apologies for lack of originality) -Hotel Lifts - be patient, not the most efficient Gym - its situated in an adjacent hotel so you are nicely warmed up by the time that you get there Lobby Bar - had a nightcap in there most evenings and found it to be a souless experience. The pool - on our one sunny day, we ventured to the pool and it was full! i.e. not a lot of available sunbeds. Couple of other observations If you get the chance, take a day trip to Macau - great fun!!! we saw an advert on the boat and on the back of this went to see a show at the Hyatt called the House of Dancing Water - most excellent! Went to see the Big Buddha on Lantau Island - fantastic experience made even better with the cable car ride to get there! make sure that its a clear day before you set out to enjoy the views Took a cab to Aberdeen Harbour and enjoyed a Sampan trip piloted by a gentleman who must have been at least 100 years old :-) from there to the Peak where on a clear day, we imagined that it would have been impressive (it wasn't). Cabs are excellent value for money as is the transportation in the city as a whole We ate at the Domani as it was well rated and were not disappointed, it really is worth a visit. We also tried to get into Hutong in Kowloon but didnt have a reservation so were disappointed - we made the mistake of heading down to Shanghai Xaio Nan Guo on the 10th floor of One Peking... what a bad call that was!

Reviews.Title: “I love my stay except the room's bathroom”
Reviews.Author: safircraze
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this property with my mom who tagged along when i was on business trip The property is well maintained, the reception area has magnificent view over d harbour. Room is good size for hk standard with firm bedding, good tv selection. Room service is prompt. Breakfast is great spread. Location is about 7 mins walk from wanchai mtr station, ferry to tsim tsa sui is just across d street, taxi is quite plenty. Now what i hate is d design of d bathroom. As it serves as walkway/entrance, with no door separating the walkway from the bathroom. Soo, what happen if u are in the bathroom area and the door bell rings? You get panic. U MUST finish whatever you are doing promptly. The glass wall separating d bathroom and the bed area also make me dislike d property. The wooden blind cant cover well. My mom still can see me taking a shower. For a muslim travelling with her mom and nit hubby is a headache as i have to maintain a degree of body covering between d same sex. I will ony stay this hotel again if i travel solo or with my hubby and if i wont be needing room service

Reviews.Title: “Tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetlaggad
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here if on business , maybe acceptable if you get an extremely good rate for a vacation visit. Rooms small , elevators slow and crowded , restaurant packed and noisy , but the lunch time buffet is very good with many choices . Bar is part of the lobby and not very inviting. Club lounge not worth the name.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Hong Kong's magnificient skyline”
Reviews.Author: weikeat
Reviews.Content: It is located right beside the convention center, nearby the Golden Bauhinia Square and Star Ferry Terminal. A short walk to the square rewarded me with the beautiful harbour and skyline view. Check in is fast, and staff is generally polite and helpful with request. The room is modern, elegant and comfortable. But as expected in Hong Kong, it is quite small. Wi-Fi in the room can be slow at times, but it is OK for work email and business website surfing. I got one of the high floor, harbour view room, HK skyline and Victoria harbor view is simply magnificent. It is nearby my HK office in causeway bay, and not too far from MTR station. This area could felt a bit deserted at night, mainly offices are around the area. Buffet breakfast is good. One complain would be the location of the gym, it is really far away from the hotel, and can only be accessed through a long walk across dark and winding alleys.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: higgyIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1416 and had harbour views which were amazing, this is a great hotel next to the Star Ferry so its also in a really good location. The pool is amazing and right in a sun trap. Rooms are of a good stardand with all you could need. Food is a little on the expensive side and the business center is a rip off, that siad I'd stay here again. I found the staff at the hotel very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with first class service”
Reviews.Author: Blackspur
Reviews.Content: Hotel is as you would expect of a luxury hotel in Hong Kong. Lovely rooms and views, fantastic staff and great location. Staff could not have been more helpful and were kind enough to help me get my mobile phon returned after I had left it in a taxi. Also offered 2.0pm check out despite the hotel being very busy. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for families”
Reviews.Author: blackacre03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it is across the street from my husband's office in Hong Kong. He had to be here for a week, so we tagged along on his trip. Unfortunately, the hotel is more attuned to business travelers and not families. We had two adults and two children. The room options were two single beds or one king sized bed. We were given a rollaway bed for one of the kids, but the other was in the bed with us. With the rollaway bed in the room, it was very cramped and not really enough room to walk around. The king bed was hard as a rock, very uncomfortable to sleep in. The breakfast buffet was really expensive and not really worth what we paid, at least not for the children. They were only a few US dollars off the price of an adult buffet, so I ended up paying a fortune for my four year old to eat two muffins and a glass of juice. Another problem with kids is there is not bathtub in the room, only a shower. My little ones refuse showers so they went dirty while we were there. One nice amenity for families, though, is a playground and a pretty decent swimming pool. We used the playground one morning and my kids loved it. The rooms have million dollar views, and I really enjoyed watching the activity in the harbour from our room. I would say it is a perfectly fine but nothing to write home about option for business travelers, and it is not well-suited for families.

Reviews.Title: “Love the view...”
Reviews.Author: elenkahu
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel when I was in Hong Kong for a business trip. I had a harbour view room and it is definitely worth a bit of extra money: the view is spectacular. Hotel location is also perfect for both business and pleasure trips. My room was on a newly renovated floor. I did like the new and modern design but i do have to agree that rooms seem to be on a smaller side: it is perfect for one, but might be an issue for two people sharing. Bed was very hard so it takes a couple of nights to get used to it. They did warn me that it might be noisy because of renovation, but i did not hear any noise or even noticed that renivation was ongoing somewhere in the hotel. I had my breakfast in the executive lounge and the food there was plentiful and delicious. It does get a bit crowdy there during the weekend, but o wordk days it is perfectly relaxed and quiet. I also went there for evening cocktails and both the food and drinks were perfect. My only complain is the gym and it is really the only reason I will not be staying at this hotel again. This hotel shares it with Hyatt hotel next door, so it is around 5minutes walk to get there which can be a pain if it rains. Also the gym is extremely tiny, has outdated equipment and unbearably hot (the air conditioning seems to be entirely misssing). It is simply too small for two such big hotels. I honestly hope that Renaissance management is working on getting there own gym as part of current ongoing renovation. If you are not planning to use the gym, then i definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “5 star, lovely hotel, fabulous harbor views”
Reviews.Author: inelew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. This hotel is 5 star rating, and truly is 5 star. The buffet breakfast was the best I've ever eaten. So much variety. Service impeccable, the room although not large it was impeccably clean, and no noise. My only disappointment was the bed, i would prefer a king bed. We were on the 39 th floor, with the most amazing views. The ladies on the front desk gave me some important information on where to shop, very helpful and courteous. We ate dinner here, buffet. Absolutely fabulous. Western Asian and seafoods of all kind.Not to mention the desserts I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms and location!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: The rooms are Complete with amenities and little indulgences. I love the clean and welcoming feel of a modern well lit room. Decor is simple yet elegant and pleasing. Location next to the subway equates to a strategic starting point for both work and play! My first choice for Hk Island.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer5661
Reviews.Content: This my second stay at this hotel which is in a good location to the star ferry, just a 5 min walk away for trips across to the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. I have always stayed in the harbour view rooms as it is great watching all the boats and construction work going on in this very busy harbour. The hotel is well located for trips to causeway bay and central, the peak tram and Stanley markets are all a short taxi or bus ride away, the MTR station is also close by. The rooms are small but not cramped it is Hong Kong after all. I travelled with my daughter and we had no complaints about the size of the room, after all you are there sightseeing,not there to whine about the room size. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbour view!”
Reviews.Author: Lucksa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is best suited for the travelling executives but wife and I stay there for a social visit due to its proximity to Star Ferry and MTR station (5 min walk). It is expensive for a small room (300sq ft) but the amenities are all 5-star. Great and prompt service. We asked for extra ice and bottled drinking water and it was delivered within minutes of our request. Easy check-in and check-out. I would have rated this as excellent (5 stars) but had to settle for 4 because of the high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, extremely hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: CarolPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Business centre staff were very nice. Lobby area was large but very cold. Beds were the hardest I have ever slept in and the pillows were not much better. Small twin room but I had half a harbour view towards the Star Ferry which was very close and handy. Breakfast very good but expensive. Small gift shop in the hotel is handy for business travellers without much time. Would stay here again - except for the rock hard bed.

Reviews.Title: “Room is clean but small.”
Reviews.Author: dlcasan
Reviews.Content: Great location but rooms are too small. Hotel under going renovation...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KBGA
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be wonderful. Traveled to HK on business. As a Platinum Member, I received the upgrade to the Concierge level. For a hotel located in the middle of the business center the prices are very reasonable. Yes, expensive but the location drives that and compared to other business hotels in the area, this one is well priced. The staff were friendly and I experienced no delays at check in or out, although to be fair I arrived very late and left very early. The newly remodeled room was beautifully done. A bit small in size by Western standards but probably large for Asian standards. Comfy bed, Impeccably clean room. The Concierge room was closed during remodeling but the Management made alternative plans for guests to use the breakfast restaurant and lounge for snacks. This is more than I have seen in the US, where when the Concierge room is under construction the guests just do without. The breakfast buffet had something for everyone, from a fruit stand, dumpling and soup kiosk, Western breakfast, cheeze and cold cuts, and cereals. Food was excellent. The hotel is very conveniently located, right next to a central bus station and the ferry to Kowloon and down the street a bit from the subway. Public transportation in HK is excellent and being so close to these options is key if you are here for pleasure. (Buy and Octupus Card at the airport, load it with a couple hundred HKD, and you can get around anywhere quickly and easily.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotels on HK Island....”
Reviews.Author: Snehal88
Reviews.Content: A great location for a business hotel with the HK Exhibition and Conference center connected to one of the hotels exits, smallish rooms and passable service. Great if it saves you travel time and cost, otherwise may be pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great biz/social hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFRLondon
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from a trip to HK where after much searching for a nice reasonably priced hotel. HK is not a place where one find a nice and reasonably priced hotel. The Harbour view hotel is located in the perfect location. Everything is within walking distance. I didn't get the harbour view room but the room was a nice size. The hotel has very recently renovated the room and it was very well laid out. As I was by myself it was perfectly adequate but if you are sharing it could become some what cosy. Although people have commentated about the noise, I didn't hear anything or for that matter see any workers. I had the hotel organise a pickup which was handled very well. Had I known the ease by which the train got into central I would have used the train. The driver was awaiting me and got me into he hotel and I was whisked to my room with no wait and checked in, in the room. I had read about queues on check in but I hadn't come across any of it. I only used the hotel for breakfast and there is a great buffet service which is quite extensive. All in all a nice hotel which is probably more for the business traveller but equally good for the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view.”
Reviews.Author: DaveSalford
Reviews.Content: Expensive hotel, but so are most in Hong Kong, harbour view rooms are spectacular, good position on hk island near ferries to Kowloon, taxis are pretty cheap to get around, but traffic can be terrible. Maintenance work being carried out make sure you are away from noise if in hotel room during day of if you want to sleep late.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hote but only good if you are on business”
Reviews.Author: The_TravellerSg
Reviews.Content: As a stopover from my business trip, I decided to stay in Hong Kong island, a part I have never stayed in for al my visits to Hong Kong. The hotel itself is close to several commercial and government buildings which is perhaps this is more a business hotel than a leisure hotel. Within walking distance to Wan Chai MTR where most of the more lively area is located. Check in was fast and service is adequate. Room wise like all hotels in Hong Kong is small but decent enough. The room does have a good view of the habour which is nice and also the room is well thought out in terms of how they make use of limited space. For me, I like to safe deposit box which is concealed in a drawer but wish it can be bigger for lap top. Within the vicinity is almost nothing for the tourist but as I said the MTR station is less than 15 mins walk away and it is linked to the bridge so it shield you from weather. As a tourist, I would strongly suggest not staying here but in Kowloon instead therefore again a good business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good access to the exhibition centre”
Reviews.Author: sammytina
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as we were attending a trade show, the access is so easy. A short walk to the star Ferry if you want to get across the harbour too. Had a garden view room which had a stunning harbour view reflected into the high rise office windows! see picture

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromNYinDC
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, really nice people at the front desk - very accommodating. The room was a lot smaller than I expected but I think that's because it's Hong Kong. The only thing I didn't like was that there was no communication between the front desk (which is on the 1st floor) and the ground floor transportation for the shuttle so you don't know when the bus is actually coming.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business visits”
Reviews.Author: IanandPaula
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of days here last week as my usual hotel, the Conrad, was fully booked. To be fair, I wasn't disappointed. Location is OK in Wan Chai, but a little adrift from the main central business district, but perfect for the conference centre where I think this hotel probably gets a lot of its trade. The occupants seemed to be dominated by business and conference people. The rooms were on the small side when compared to similar priced and star rated hotels in Hong Kong, but adequate and well decorated. Free wi fi available. Likewise the bathrooms were very small, but again, acceptable. How big does it have to be for a two night business trip? Harbour view rooms are good. Service throughout the hotel was very good. A polite, helpful and efficient front desk on check in and check out. I used the lobby bar on one evening. Nice snacks and good service. The other evening I had room service which was prompt. Breakfast was very good. A great range of hot and cold foods and a really good fruit/juice bar. Service was attentive but not overly so. One minor gripe was that on both mornings the corridor was littered with a number of room service trays that had been left out but not collected from the previous evening. Not a good thing to be almost tripping up over when you're on the way to breakfast. Overall I was very happy with my stay here and would recommend it, particularly for anyone at the conference centre.

Reviews.Title: “Ok. Good location, but beds are stiff as a board and service is mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Balberts99
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here last week and had a very mediocre experience. After spending a week in Thailand and staying at two wonderful yet moderately priced hotels in Bangkok & Phuket, we thought we'd stop over for the weekend in Hong Kong. The hotel is pretty but somewhat dated and the service is ok though not extremely helpful. Our room was a harbor view and the view was fantastic though the room itself was VERY small and it seemed somewhat outdated even though it was supposedly a "renovated" room. Finally, the bed was horrendous. I've stayed in hundreds of Marriott hotels & this was by far the worst bed Ive ever slept in...As stiff as a board. Overall an ok experience though I will probably opt to stay in a different hotel the next time I'm in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Above the Fairground”
Reviews.Author: lucaacca
Reviews.Content: It is not a cheap hotel, but the service is very good. It is positioned above the Convention Centre and so it is perfect if you have to attend a fair, otherwise there are more hotels better located. Nice swimming pool and excellent breakfast. The view, if you get a harbour view, is amazing. Try to get a high floor. You can walk to the MTR, Wanchai station, and so you can move from there very easily. The rooms are not that big, but almost everywhere you get this size. In case you get the executive room, with access to the lounge, you can enjoy a really good happy hour in a lounge with an astonishing view.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guitarguru70
Reviews.Content: Located at Wan Chai, right besides Central Plaza. 5 mins cab ride to Central. Rooms have been refurbished recently. Lower level rooms are still under repairs so ask for higher levels while checking in. Good service standards. Breakfast cafe is strictly OK, the spread is delicious. Good value for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: mark f
Reviews.Content: Great location, great concierage who arranged plenty of drivers at short notice, nice lounge and great views of Kowloon from the 37th floor. Easy check in and out/ A very efficient hotel I shall stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor view at the Executive Floor”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Chien
Reviews.Content: Location is good if you are participating in one of the conferences centers nearby. Otherwise, walking to the MRT will take around 10 min. one-way. Excellent views for breakfast at the Executive Level, you get the entire harbor view. Come back at the evening and you will get to see the night lights of the harbor. Enjoy free drinks and hors d'oeuvres at the Executive Level. Hotel is old as it was build back in the late 80's, but service is always good in Asian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Regular hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: edpi
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Near wanchai and some other busy areas. . It is a regular hotel, nothing fancy but Rather good value for money. Only bad point, the room is small. Try to balance that with a view which can be really nice

Reviews.Title: “More suitable for Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: RRachelSQ
Reviews.Content: We were for a family trip and stayed at Renaissance hotel for 4 nights. If you are on a leisure trip to Hong Kong and wish to try their local delicacies, experience night markets and local culture. I think this hotel is not so suitable as it is in Wan Chai which is a more business district. Having said that, it is really a good hotel in terms of amenities and hospitality but would be perfect for business trips in terms of location. Renaissance is next to many commercial buildings and most importantly next to the convention center. However it is just next to the Wan chai star ferry and about 5-10minutes walk to Wan Chai MTR station. Another good thing is that you can take the H1 shuttle bus from Hong Kong airport express station to and fro the hotel. This service is available for many other hotels in central hong kong too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielSkold
Reviews.Content: Over all a very nice experience. The hotel has a nice, relaxing atmosphere. The breakfast is GREAT! Awesome view from our room on the 34rd floor. Getting the elevator down in the morning can be a hassle though since someone usually wants to get in on EVERY floor. Patience my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Janederm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights December 26-31, 2011. It was pleasant stay. The size od the rooms are pretty small typical of a Hongkong hotel. Check in was very fast. The lobby is very elegant. We were given a harbour view, so our view was very relaxing. Housekeeping was very efficient. Location is convenient and ot very crowded. Tsimshatsui is just a Star ferry away. There are a lot of restaurants around the area. There's a free shuttle from the hotel that takes you to IFC tower, there's an airport check in at IFC tower and it is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Got better”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past, pre-renovation and it was looking bland and tired, but today the hotel is much better, trendy, great renovated rooms, good Corporate Hotel. Great breakfast spread.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Island”
Reviews.Author: Bob-and-Sash
Reviews.Content: An all round excellent hotel with superb facilities and a view to die for, the Star ferry is a short stroll away giving easy access to Central and Tsim Sha Tsui-Kowloon. The restaurants in the hotel were also spot-on and the room service second to none. I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone and next time I visit Hong Kong I'll certainly stay at the Renaisssance. There is some refurbishment going on at the moment but noise is limited to a normal working day and is minimal anyway. It's worth asking for a refurbished room, they're exceptionally well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable option in pricey HK”
Reviews.Author: Mustihaveone
Reviews.Content: This has become my corporate hotel and so I stay here on trips to HK, whereas previously my choice was the W Kowloon which I find excellent. On the advise of a knowledgable colleague I always ask for a renovated room - the hotel is undergoing some refurbishing so they say it can be noisy during the day, but I don't know as i am out for business - and they are quite nice. Comparable to say a Westin or a Sheraton - standard, pleasing lighting, furniture, large flat TV, large shower area (no tub, but I don't care for those) etc. I do not do the buffet breakfast so no comments, and the room service menu is reasonably diverse. Room service is always quick and the service pleasant, also at the front desk. All in all it could be a great, standard business hotel. The two main drawbacks for me are: 1. Location - it is not so much the distance - most commercial buildings and areas are a 10-minute cab ride away - as that it being near the convention center, does not offer the usual HK possibilities of walking down a street full of eateries, bars, shops or even a convenient mall or a 7-eleven if you want to pick up something. You are really out in a little island within the island. 2. Gym - the hotel does not technically have one. You can walk over to an adjacent building in the complex by traversing the roof connecting the two - a 7-8 minute walk - to a private, members only club which lets hotel guests use its facilities. The issue is that this haughty club refused to let me in without my shoes. I do not pack shoes as i do not engage in activities that need them, and not only has this never stopped me, in some hotels I get shoes with fresh insoles. Of course this is a club and entitled to its snobbish rules, but the issue would not exist if the hotel had its own fitness center. #2 could potentially be solved and that would bump it up to a 4, but #1 is what it is, so I doubt I could ever review it higher than this.

Reviews.Title: “Still efficient”
Reviews.Author: tommillerjones
Reviews.Content: Last visit 12 months ago - little has changed, even refurbishment continues with some disturbance during the day - good situation, everything works, good shower - same noisy lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, and best shrimp dim sum ever.”
Reviews.Author: ecrescia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you expect from a 5 star hotel and more. The views are fantastic, the service impecable, and the room service dim sum was simply delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: bhavana_praveen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in dec2009 .It was our first time in HK and we chose a good hotel I can say.....I'm reviewing after 2 years of my stay ,coz we had a great stay and it is centrally located helpful staff, so can definitely visit.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Smartblonde
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hong Kong Harbour View Hotel is almost perfect, but has a few annoying flaws. The most wonderful aspect of the hotel is the staff. They are efficient, professional, gracious, warm and friendly, making you feel truly welcomed and truly sorry to leave. Also wonderful is the location. It’s located directly adjacent to the Convention Center, with the Wan Chai MTR station about a 10-minute walk, using the system of footbridges that surround the area. There is also a large bus station across the street, as well as the Wan Chai Star Ferry. And the view is spectacular – if you can, spring for a high floor overlooking the harbor. We are lucky enough to currently have a high status within the Marriott Points system. Therefore, we have access to the Concierge Level. I must say that the Renaissance’s facility is absolutely the best we’ve ever experienced, including at some of the best Marriotts in Europe and Asia. The staff is friendly, well trained and exceptionally gracious. The breakfast buffet at the café is exceptional (around $25 USD). It has a wide variety of both western and Chinese choices. Special kudos to the manager, Wilson, who makes you feel welcomed and well-served. The front desk, concierge, and bell desk is staffed with extremely nice and knowledgeable staff. One employee, Jeffery, constantly went the “extra mile” to be of service. Now for what’s not so great about this exceptional hotel. First, is the health club. It is located in an adjacent hotel, an annoying distance from the Renaissance. I am not even a very good club – only adequate. The walk is pleasant, across a beautifully landscaped pool and recreation area that includes a large playground for the youngsters, as well as tennis courts. However, the Renaissance is primarily a business hotel, and many business professionals have high expectations regarding fitness centers. Another weak element - the rooms. Some of the rooms are redone, some not. The older rooms are very poorly organized and the beds like rocks (typical Chinese, by the way). The redone rooms are a bit better, but are small and still poorly organized with hard beds (but not as hard). They are happy to put inserts on mattresses, which helps. The rooms also provide very little privacy, with a glass wall separating the bedroom from the bathroom. The most serious problem – and one with no solution – is that the room walls are extremely thin. When a phone rings next door, it sounds like it’s in your room. And even normal conversations carry right through the wall – try a few partying people next to you, especially around 1 AM or so – not pleasant. Except for this one major problem, the Renaissance was a fabulous experience. Be sure to bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JoJoXS
Reviews.Content: Great location and very friendly staff. Free internet for Marriott members. Easy access to Wanchai subway station. Rooms are well maintained and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, connected & customer oriented”
