Reviews.Author: Bengjork
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights last December 16-18. From the airport we were picked up by a complimentary shuttle from the the station and we were dropped off at the hotel. As it was the holidays, the hotel was bustling but the lady at reception was warm, helpful and very accommodating (sorry didn't recall her name). I had used my points for this stay and asked for a sea view room and was accommodated. The room itself was not very big but it has all the comforts that you will need from a day of sight seeing in this city. It was clean, chic, had free quick internet (we had several devices so updating our FB was so easy!) and a nice view of the HongKong skyline. It was quite amusing to watch the lighting decoration from the buildings at night. On our return from our 2nd day of touring, we were surprised to receive a nice note and fruit plate from the Rooms Manager which was very nice gesture. We really felt the warmth of the staff looking after their guests. This hotel is also connected to the convention center as well as the central station so you can really save on cab fare. Before we left, we asked the concierge for directions and tips and he was super helpful (Filipino guy), giving clear instructions and tips on how we could get around the city better. We would have loved to stay longer but we have planned to visit Macau. I do want to say thank you and well done to the hotel and staff at Renaissance!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming in the otherwise cold place”
Reviews.Author: jyoti g
Reviews.Content: Huge Respite from indifferent & the cold city. Contemporary interiors & very comfortable stay. Breakfast buffet was nice with a wide variety though i didnt like the restaurant much HKK doesn't treat Indians very well but still I dont want to be prejudiced towards the hotel. But you get far better hospitality anywhere else that s for sure

Reviews.Title: “Such a Great Place and Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: papajohns
Reviews.Content: We arrived as refugees from Nepal after having a bad experience with a corrupt travel agent. From the minute we walked into the lobby we felt so welcomed. Check-in was quick and they upgraded us to a corner suite with a relaxing view of the garden. I'm a platinum member with Marriott but have never been treated as well in any other Marriott hotel. This was a fantastic place and great value for the points I was using. We had only planned on staying 3 nights but loved it so much we stayed for 5 and would have stayed longer but we had flights onward. Our corner suite was spacious and there were two sparkling clean bathrooms. We couldn't wait to use the showers and thought we had died and gone to heaven. Hong Kong is everything Nepal was not and the attention to detail and customer service everywhere we went was soul soothing. There was a refrigerator, coffee machine and green tea for the making. it was great tea. The concierge lounge was as good as an all-inclusive restaurant. Breakfast and appetizers were served daily and they were the tastiest I have ever had. There was so much variety and the staff there were so gracious and accomodating. They all worked very closely as a team and tried very hard to become familiar with your likes and dislikes. This is by far the best concierge lounge I've encountered in my travels. As far as location, this was perfect for us. We were able to get our laundry done just a few blocks from the hotel. It was such a good deal and back to us in a few hours. The subway was within walking distance and we took advantage of it and went everywhere. Initially we took a taxi to the hotel from the airport but to be honest the airport express was so easy to use we kicked ourselves for not using it initially. Don't be initimidated as we were. The taxi cost 40 dollars and for us it was good value after a long night flight. We travelled from the airport during commuting hours and it didn't take us more than 50 minutes so it was a great option. I am trying to find a way to get back here. Loved Hong Kong and the people. I'm not a shopper but it was so fun walking through. One of the beautiful girls in the concierge lounge recommended a jewellry store and I was able to get a necklace with a charm that describes my time there in Chinese: it translates to 'Happy'. What a great momento.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary feel after renovations..”
Reviews.Author: twinklemelody
Reviews.Content: Such a contemporary design after their renovations. You literally step into the bathroom when you open the door to the room. Room appears more spacious as one wall opf the bathroom is removed. Bathroom separated from sleeping area by a glass wall. Space planning in the room appears quite well thought-out..but the swing door from bathroom to room is in the way of the closet. Overall good value and good service. Good location for those attending exhibitions at Convention Centre next door.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this huge rather new Renaissance Hotel for almost a week. Being a Marriott Gold member we've got a great upgrade to a club floor corner room, felt like a junior suite. That was important as hotel rooms in Hongkong and Kowloon generally are on the small side. Decor is new, functional, not the most precious materials but ok stuff like out of IKEA. Nice wooden floors mean no more worn-out and dirty carpets. Spectacular views over Hongkong harbour but be aware not all rooms have a harbour view. The club facilities are rather good, very large selections of foods and the usual modest selection of drinkable wines. Lounge staff are wonderfully good humored and jovially helpful - just the way we like it. The woman who seems to run the show up there deserves special mention. The hotel is adjacent to the convention center and it very much feels like a huge, totally anonymous convention hotels. Location is very convenient if you plan to go to Kowloon often or use the efficient MRT system. The famous star ferry to Kowloon is just a three minute stroll away and the MRT is literally underneath the building complex. If you want to go to the bustling life of the Wanchai street level and markets that is just a five minute walk away by a very busy system of covered walkways crossing over the busy highway. Stay there if the profile suits you and if you're likely to get an upgrade or are prepared to pay for one of the better rooms, nothing's wrong with the hotel even though it's nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Spcaious”
Reviews.Author: Deepak M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harbour view hotel for business and was pleasure to be there. Room: Are large, neatly arranged with all requirements. tea,coffee making machine was well placed. Bathroom with glass wall can be annoying for some people but otherwise good rooms. Food : At par with any 5 star hotel, has got 3 restaurants serving Chinese, Italian and Continental, I like the chinese one. You can also grab a bite at lobby in evening when live concert are on. Internet: Wifi can be accessed from room, in lobby with same password and is good speed. Location: Close to Wanchai MTR station which connects to Airport Link, bus station is also near to hotel. Close to harbour gives a pleasant view early morning, you can also walk down to feel the fresh air by crossing road. Others : Got large swimming Pool and health center is well equipped. surprisingly small garden can be seen while going to swimming pool. Overall another good property by Marriott who never disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again”
Reviews.Author: barrye09
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Club Floor of the RHV in July and I highly recommend this hotel. The staff are incredibly attentive and efficient; Australian service industries could learn a lot from these people. The accommodation was excellent - spacious and comfortable. I did have some problems with hot water in my room and despite everyone's best efforts to fix it, it wasn't, but thankfully HK was hot so a tepid shower was nothing to complain about. The hotel shares a lot of its facilities with the Hyatt next door (my next hotel review) and they are connected by a walkway on the 11th floor. I would stay here again if only for the great service and manners of the staff - from the receptionists, to the domestic staff and the doormen. They are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Brijesh_Mitra
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel at a great location. I stayed here 2 yr back & quite liked the location. The hotel was going to get renovated last year. I didn't like the rooms so much as the interiors were very old & needed renovation. Not sure how this looks after renovation. You will have to take cab from the hotel to go to most places. I didnt travel by MTR so cannot comment on connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “Restful Room with a Great View”
Reviews.Author: Endurant
Reviews.Content: After my long flight from the US, it was wonderful to stay here. My room was beautifully updated since I last stayed at this hotel. The hotel staff were professional, and helpful in seeing that I successfully departed to my next destination with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralph1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a 50% off Suite deal with access to the executive floor. Room (suite) was absolutely great and large as you might expect from a suite-room, perfect Harbour View. Breakfast and cocktails at the executive floor are wonderful and much choice, as is the view across the harbour. Staff is very friendly. We will surely come back if we return to Hong Kong someday The location was perfect for us, star ferry is next door, Central and Causeway Bay are on walking distance as is the Wan Chai MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business”
Reviews.Author: cabolaki
Reviews.Content: located at Wanchai harbour, as expected from Marriott group, a great hotel, great international buffet breakfast. good for business trip but not recommended to anyone who wish to travel with kids, there are no entertainment for little fella

Reviews.Title: “The best location on HK island”
Reviews.Author: RickinShelby
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Hong Kong for 20 years for business. In this time I stayed at MANY different hotels. However, I have stayed here more often than any others for a good reason -- it is a fine hotel and a terrific location right next door to the Star Ferry. If you are in HK for a convention, this hotel is reasonably priced and a location hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrasWorld
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the the Renaisssance Harbour over New Year for about a week. I have nothing but praise for this hotel and will definitely stay here again. Service was faultless and of a very high standard. Room was good with nice modern design and everything was provided. Wifi quick and had no problems with connection. Pool area very nice for lounging and having a drink. Breakfast was brilliant and one of the best standards I have seen in HK. Overall was a great experience and will be definitely be back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Stay Great Views”
Reviews.Author: ozzietraveler2011
Reviews.Content: Great food can be a little pricey.. close to clubs seen but very safe place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in the end of 2011”
Reviews.Author: Jacques O
Reviews.Content: We prepaid a harbor view junior suite for 3 days, When we arrive the room smelled terible, we changed rooms to a different floor, They are making renovation on the above floors and the noise was unbearable, Then we changed again to a different suite no Harbor vie, also smelling bad, but no noise. For the amount of money we paid and normally the treatment you do receive in Hong Kong it was a total disappointing to stay in these hotel They should have said that the Hotel is in Renovation .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view from the rooms...”
Reviews.Author: LoveNature2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 yrs ago, longer t han we wanted to, because our tour got suddenly cancelled and I got sick, too. (boo). It's a good location. We stayed on points so we didn't have to pay, which was nice. We had access to the business lounge, allowing us to have breakfast there, snacks, computer/internet usage which helped alot.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: eparty69
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in Dec. 2011 for four nights using reward points. I had a room on the 34th floor with a view towards IFC, some harbour and hill view. The room was small in size but fine for a short stay. I did not use the hotel spa, gym or restaurants so cannot comment on these. The hotel is covered by the hotel shuttle from the Hong Kong Central Station. One the way back to the airport, I used a cab to the Central station and it was super fast. The hotel is 5 min walk to the metro and across from star ferry. The lobby is very pleasant in the evening with ambient lights that change colors periodically and on some evenings you can also listen to live jazz. I had a cocktail however it was not very tasty. The hotel is very busy so sometimes it may take a bit of time to talk to a concierge. All in all good hotel with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great views on the harbour and very convenient position to visit HK”
Reviews.Author: Alessandra_G73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located immediately on the harbour, and offers beautiful views on Tsim Sha Tsui. When I was looking for a hotel in HK firstly I looked for the Tsim Sha Tsui area but, being that I was going to leave on December 30th, most of the hotels on rhe harbour in that area seemed to be already booked or too expensive. Once arrived there, I discovered that the New Remaissance has a very good position because is far from the crowd of Tsim Sha Tsui but very well connected with it through the ferry which is just beside the hotel (it takes 10 minutes to cross the harbour and it is a pleasant way to move); it is also very well connected with the rest of the town because the Wan Chai MTR station (the subway) is just a 5 minutes walking distance. You can choose to use the covered passages which pass over the roads or walk in the area, which is really not as bad as I thought! Everything considered, if you'd like to visit the town it is probably better to stay on this part of the harbour because many attractions are on this side and you can also take a ferry from central (just 2 MTR stops away from Wan chai) to go to Macao or to the other Hong Kong islands. The rooms of the hotels are very good (do not expect very large rooms because every room in HK is quite small, but that considered at the Renaissace you have quite space). I would recommend to spend a little more and ask for an harbour view room, it's great to see the harbour from the ceiling-to-floor window! The room style is essential but provides everything you need, and everything is new and clean. Finally, at the Café renaissance you will enjoy a huge and delicious buffet for breakfast (really huge!).

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Zoe R
Reviews.Content: My first time in Hong Kong, so picked this hotel based on trip advisor. Rooms are really nice but a tad small...would of liked bigger. Staff are wonderful so far I'm loving the hotel however I have stayed in better 4-5 Star Accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location but noisy and service is poor”
Reviews.Author: Exracer2007
Reviews.Content: Noisy rooms - poor sound insulation and constantly disturbed during the day by work in other rooms. The 'Gym' is actually in the hotel next door ! (the Hyatt). Breakfast is not great. Difficult to reserve a table in the Hotel Restaurants even for hotel guest. No Spa and the swimming pool is unheated so not useable in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, easy city hotel”
Reviews.Author: J0hnners
Reviews.Content: I loved the small yet zen-like rooms, and I did have the proper harbour view. Location is pretty good, though perhaps not as good as central for the swanky life. All in all a great business hotel that is not stratospherically priced!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: Shopping, dinning, the big bus tour, all within minutes of this hotel. The service was spectacular, the rooms are well above average and have great beds, the food in the lobby bar was delicious and the breakfast buffet had any dish you could imagine. The hotel faces the harbor and my room had a spectacular view. I'd say you can't go wrong with this hotel in Hong Kong!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, in spite of what the price tag may say”
Reviews.Author: Joni C
Reviews.Content: $500+ USD per night for a suite. Seemed fair in HK. However, at that price I would expect a luxury hotel. This is not. Started with 15+ minutes for check in, and that is with no wait. Followed by my key not working and then arriving in my "non-smoking" suite to the strong smell of smoke. We were moved to a non- smoking room and 20+ minutes later my crib arrived (which was part of my reservation). The rooms are quite dated. And I was freezing for the duration of my stay. When I called maintenance, they said the heat doesn't kick on until it falls to 12c (which it did at night during my trip). Also, no gym on hotel premises. You need to walk outside 10 minutes to a neighboring apartment complex and equipment is dated. Staff was friendly, conceirge was poor and harbor views were fantastic. Completely overrated. The Renaissance in Chicago is much less in price, and much better in service and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Prefect Location and Service, I wouldnt stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: finesilver
Reviews.Content: I stayed there three nights earlier this month. A top Hotel one block from the Star Ferry, two blocks from a metro stop, and right at the waterfront. Operated by Renaissance, a Marriott brand, I knew it would be solid. Add to that if you are a Marriott member, the wireless is free, then the place is darn close to perfect. The room itself was a garden view which still had a huge view of half the harbor especially from the 18th floor. Recently redone, modern, with full amenities, including a small night light and double shower (with the handle which comes off (hose) and also with this great one foot square sprayer from the ceiling. A great bed and layout. The hotel was packed and in fact, was sold out the day I was checking out. Front desk tops, concierge nearly tops (maybe a little less smug), and the bell stand great as was the taxi/intake team. I did not eat there but the place had everything I would ever want, even a second floor walkway right to the metro. I actually stayed elsewhere for two nights, this place was heads and tails above that place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: IrickaItaly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the business and Fair in Hong Kong. We've been there for the Leather Fair. It has a special tunnel for the exhibition entrance, you don't need to go on the street or outside. Lovely hall to stay for the aperitive and happy-hour time. Fantastic swimming-pool on the 11th floor on the roof connected with the other hotel. Clean room and bathroom. And absolutely fantastic view on the sea harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: olympics2008
Reviews.Content: Despite being "old' by Hong Kong standards, this hotel maintains a good standard of deccor. Rooms are nice and modern, although they tended to be all showers with no bath inthe standard rooms. That was the one aspect that was a bit negative.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable stay and great sleep”
Reviews.Author: prescriptiondog
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week on business in Hong Kong and was recommended to stay here due to its proximity to work over there. I have never stayed at a Renaissance before, so I really did not have any expectations but was wowed immediately. The incredibly friendly service started at the reception at check-in and lasted until the last minute of my stay. The rooms are well laid out and have nothing left to desire. Great bathrooms, amazing views, clean and I never had such a good sleep in any hotel in my life. Unfortunately the wake up call was always on time!! One thing that got me out in the morning was the amazing breakfast. It was unbelievable. If it is not booked as part of your deal, the buffet is quite expensive so make sure it is included, but then again, what is on offer is everything you can imagine. Various different buffets of different types of foods from all over the world. You can have Sushi, Dim sum, cooked and fried eggs as per your wishes, european breakfast with various meats and cheeses as well as a huge selection of cereals and fruits and yoghurts. Again, and unfortunately, there is a limit as to how much someone can eat in the morning!! Definitely not to be missed though! Location wise, the hotel is in Wan Chai and located conveniently right next to the Convention Centre. Also equal distance to Central (IFC) as well as Timesquare/Causeway bay in the other direction. Queues for taxis at the hotel can sometimes be long, especially around 7pm. The gym is situation a short stroll across the hotel outdoor area and has got everything you need. The outdoor pool is great also. I tried the restaurant only once, and it was as good as expected. Also room service is great, the only downside may be the hotel singer in the lobby in the evenings,... now I know what they mean if they say to someone that thinks is a good singer will only end up in a hotel bar... thats where they end up here! But hey, it didnt damper the overall experience. Well deserved five points and if I ever can afford on my return, I will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great price”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi P
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had a facelift inside. It's very close to the hustle and bustle of HK and reasonably priced. The amenities are great and the price is reasonable. I stay here with work and it ticks all the boxes. Get a room over level 25 and there is little if any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Goog hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mbacqu
Reviews.Content: Superb rooms after renovation. Nice style, comfort bed and good view

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: contenttotravel
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights here at the end of October. Having never been to Hong Kong and faced with hundreds of hotel choices, it was a real challenge to pick a nice place to stay that we could afford - Hong Kong hotels are so expensive but we came out on top with the Harbour View. Our room was "sparkling clean" on a high floor, all new and modern, with magnificent views of the harbour. It was on the small side but we were hardly there so that did not bother us too much. We also took advantage of the executive level facilities and it is worth the extra to have this option. The breakfasts every morning were wonderful, and numerous choices of both hot and cold food,pastries and fruit. The evenings snacks were more like mini dinners, so much so, we rarely ate dinners out. This suited us because as mentioned, Hong Kong can be horribly expensive, and anything that is half way decent costs a lot. The location of the hotel was fantastic because you have the ferry to Kowloon directly opposite and it makes getting across so quick and easy. We took taxis to most other places, easy to get and the one thing that was quite inexpensive. Also took in tea and scones one afternoon at the famous Peninsula Hotel. I think it is bit of a tourist trap but worth a one time experience. In Kowloon you will be bombarded with tailors in the street offering you suits in a day. I took a chance and had one made, and it turned out ok because I think I was lucky in my choice of tailor and remember to negotiate the price!! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, excellent for the Exhibition centre”
Reviews.Author: Terry36
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times and it is always a high standard. Booked a garden view room but thanks to my Marriott card we were upgraded to a harbour view room on the newly refurbished 20th floor. The room was very comfortable, not very spacious, but the air con is excellent and the bathroom well equipped. The main restaurant on the mezzanine is excellent with a fanastic choice at breakfast and it is equally good for dinner. Not cheap but good value. The hotel's chinese restaurant was a big disappointment to us although it has a Michelin star, maybe more syuited to local taste. The pool is very nice and the pool snack bar is very good for lunch. The best part for us was it is attached to the exhibiton centre and you do not have to go outside to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Chenille W
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Next to a Starbucks to grab breakfast if you want a cheaper option. they have fresh fruit juice too! Hotel is very nice and clean. Great gym. In walking distance to the train station very easy walk and coved in case of bad weather. Great view of the water ask for a room with a view. You can also see the light show as well. Train system is very easy to navigate. Get a pass if you will be there for a while. Hotel bar has small bites avaible if you get in late. We took the train from the airport and then the hotel bus. It is a great affordable option. All transportation I felt very safe and it was very clean. Also next to the ferry for easy access off of the Island.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel where the buffet breakfast is spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Lordy1
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel and ideally situated if you are attending an event at the Hong Kong Exhibition centre as you can walk through to it directly from the hotel. The harbour view rooms have an amazing view but the lower floor ones can be marred by the exhibition centre. The garden view is very pleasant so unless you are going to spend a lot of time in your room it may not be worth paying the difference. You can catch the ferry over to Kowloon across the road and central is a short taxi/MTR ride away. The rooms are very comfortable but as with so many Asian hotels have a pathetic amount of storage space. 2 drawers to be precise plus the hanging cupboard. There is wired internet in the rooms which is free if you have a Marriot rewards card- otherwise there is a charge. Service in the hotel is first class and the buffet breakfast is the best I think I have ever had anywhere. Huge counters for fruits, amazing array of fruit juices from Mango to Watermelon to Orange. Large cooked breakfast areas and wonderful fresh breads and pastries. No delays for coffee top ups etc. In fact it is worth staying here just for the breakfast! There is a decent gym and massive heated outdoor pool although I found it a bit cool. You can lunch by the pool where again the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations!”
Reviews.Author: Gibbsy14
Reviews.Content: 3 nights stay on a round-world trip booked via Trailfinders. Only on the small print of the booking did I see that the hotel was being renovated. Was woken on Sunday at 10am (trying to have a lie-in) by the sound of hammer drills. Apparently - it was an emergency fix for a water main. Was offered another room to sleep in - but was already awake! Using the Gym involved a long trek to the Marriott hotel next door and if you missed a sign post you were lost. All said and done, Anthony on front of house apologised and I was given a free all-you-can-eat dinner in the main restaurant (even if they had no room and had to create a table for me) and a free limo to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Lucecitamn
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 8 nights and there is almost nothing to complain about. If you have the harbour view room, the breakfast is included and it is worth it! The best breakfast ever! And the view is also good. However, I have to mention that the room is very small for such amount of money. There was quite a noise from the street, even though we stayed on the 32 floor. I had the feeling they have no receptionists, we always had to queue for a long time at the reception. Of course, they also always add something to the receipt while checkin´ out, we always expect some items that we didn´t have, for example drinks from minibar or internet. We were unlucky with the weather, it was cold outside and unfortunately, it was also very cold in the room. The housekeeping lady even turned on air-condition and we were freezing when we arrived in the hotel. But this is unfortunately normal in the hotels in Asia. The hotel is located next to the exhibition center, quite a good location. There is also a regular ferry to Kowloon in front of the hotel, but the subway is not very convenient, if you want to use subway, you have to change at least once.

Reviews.Title: “More of a "Destination" Hotel - Better for Families than Business”
Reviews.Author: GreatTrip356
Reviews.Content: This is a 'destination hotel' in the sense that it's hard to 'soak up local color' i.e. find a coffee shop or other stores near by. You need to leave the resort property (by taxi?) to do so. There are plenty of taxi's available at this property. (Unlike the Courtyard Marriott.) It's a lovely hotel with huge common areas. If you need to have a business meeting in the lobby there are many spots where this is possible. If you are just an overnight business traveller as I was, this is not the best hotel choice. When I saw the grounds in the daylight, I had a beautiful view of the pool and palm trees on the property. The king size room was spacious for one person. It could have easily accomodated a roll away or similar. The only real negative, other than the price, was that the bed's mattress was so firm it was almost uncomfortable. The pillows were downfilled and were as comfortable as the Courtyard Marriott up the street. I was surprised at how uncomfortable the mattress was, especially considering the fact I stayed in a sister property the night before.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with all the amenities you require”
Reviews.Author: william820
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance hotel is by far one of the best hotels i have stayed in. The staff are always friendly and very efficient. The pool is fantastic and everything is within walking distance. Public transport is very cheap and efficient. Food is fantastic especially room service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful - Kowloon skyline view”
Reviews.Author: Vince C
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and Sally Ho and Juergen at the front desk were extremely helpful and hospitable. The room had a magnificent view of the harbor and the light show. We used the stocked refrigerator for our own beverages. We used Marriott Rewards points for our 5-day stay 20,000 per day. We ate at McDonalds off the the elevated walkway on the way to the Wan Chai MTR station. Get your Octopus Card from the Customer Aervice counter - it's good for the buses, MTR, some stores like McDonalds, 7-11. The Star Ferry for Kowloon/Tsim Sha Tsui docks about 100 yards from the hotel. Use the overpass from the ferry, turn right and the hotel is straight ahead. The gym is on the 11th floor, outside past the tennis courts golf range and downstairs - then one floor down. It has 5 treadmills, 2 elipticals, circuit machines, free weights, bikes, water. Sign in and leave room card - you need gym shoes rather than flip flops for safety reasons. The 'Navigator' or concierge is extremely helpful - helped us with getting to the Stanley Market, Jumbo Floating Restaurant in Aberdeen and the ferry terminal to Macau. We used MTR and buses exclusively. We would also recommend Al Dente restaurant in the Great Eagle Center on the way to the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay as a leisure traveler”
Reviews.Author: gracetay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights while tagging along on my husband's business trip, and I must this hotel does strike me more as a business hotel especially with its proximity to the convention centre. Made my own plans to meet my friends for meals and shopping, which meant a lot of solo traveling - wasn't a problem at all. The MTR was a comfortable 10 minute walk linked by pedestrain walkways and overhead bridges. Commuting by taxi was also easy so long as you had the hotel's address card. The hotel was conveniently located even if it wasn't at the "heart" of say causeway bay or other popular venues. Concierge was very helpful with recommendations, and preparing address slips and maps for my usage - much appreciated! The rooms were wonderful and comfortable, give me a spacious bathroom, firm bed, good cable reception and I'm a happy camper. Didn't hurt that we had a (slightly obstructed but still lovely) view of the city, and the room was pretty with art over our bed. Breakfast was of the best variety, fresh fruit, fresh juices, cereal, cheeses, porridge, pastries, noodle station, etc - sat really well with my predominantly Asian and slightly Western palette. I would return again given the chance, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “1 Bedroom Deluxe Suite (not for families, poor value) vs. Club level Harbour View Guest room (perfect for lone business)”
Reviews.Author: Avey G
Reviews.Content: Stayed in both rooms in October 2011 and had the opportunity to compare. The hotel in general is everything you would expect from the mid-high tier of Marriott. Somewhat less luxuries and indulging then the JW Marriott located about a mile to the west; it’s a 5 star hotel in a great location with easy access to the Hong Kong Convention & Exhibition center, Wan Chai metro station, the Star ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui and to Wan Chai nightlife district. The hotel shares a swimming pool and a garden (including a small playground for children) with the nearby Grand Hyatt. The club level rooms are located in the top floors (39-41) and the club lounge with its harbor panoramic view is located in floors 40-41. The club lounge provides all the expected services and dining options. The staff is professional and welcoming. Overall the hotel is a nice mid-high 5 star with good location and good service. The Club level Harbour View room (described in the hotels site as: Harbour View, Guest room, 1 Queen or 2 Twin/Single Bed(s), Harbour view, Harbor view 28sqm/301sqft) UPSIDE: seem to be a perfect choice for a single business traveler. My 1 queen room was well designed and newly refurbished, clean and well equipped (kettle, selection of teabags, electrical adapter, bathrobe, slippers etc.). The bed was comfortable and there was a nice working desk. The bathroom and the room share a glass wall. Harbor view is very nice. DOWNSIDE: The room is very small and I would only stay there if I travel alone for business. The 1 Bedroom Deluxe Suites (described in the hotels site as: Deluxe Suite, 1 Bedroom Larger Suite, King, Bathrooms: 1.5, Harbor view, Pool access 80sqm/861sqft) UPSIDE: The room was located in the top 41 floor next to the club lounge. It is surprisingly large. You walk into a very specious living room and dining space with table for six. Next to the dining table there is a working desk. This space has its own washroom. There is a separate bedroom with a king bed and a spacious bathroom with both a walk-in shower and a bath. There is spectacular panoramic view from this half corner room. DOWNSIDE: Unlike most of the rooms in this hotel that were newly renovated, the suits are still with their original décor with old, somewhat worn out interior. It has an 80’s internal design with very old living room set, old curtains and carpet and old green marble bathroom. There is no sleeping facility in the living space (no sofa bed, just two small couches). You can ask for one rollaway bed for extra charge. Although the space is more than enough, surprisingly this room is not suitable for families with more than one child. Poor value if you pay a full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location during trade fairs”
Reviews.Author: aryuna
Reviews.Content: Absolutely best location during trade fairs, as just same building of the Convention Centre, thus avoids hassles, especially the difficult fight for a taxi. Hotel is clean with nice newly refurbished rooms, May be' a bit overpriced during fair period. Position not as great if trade fairs is not what you Are he for. Will certainly return for my next fair.

Reviews.Title: “Improved, but still only for the location”
Reviews.Author: wuyck
Reviews.Content: Recent renovation helps the Renaissance Harbour View to meet the average expectation that you would have of a hotel with this price level. I am happy to say so, as my several earlier experiences never did convince me to return, except for the location. Strategicly positioned next to my regional office, close to MTR, Star Ferry; that all together is hard to beat. And with one of the best Dim Sum restaurants (18 Brook) in the building (but not part of the hotel!). And I hate queues for breakfast, of a hotel like this you simply expect that they organize their business. And why does the business centre close that early (even worse on Sunday), come on: this is HK!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: dudley76
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and pleasant to come back to after a long day. The pool area is amazing. Take the time to sit outside and enjoy. I reserved a room for 2 people and I have high status at the hotel and my room was very small. It was nice was just surprised how they designed the rooms. You walk through the bathroom to get to the bed. Can't be shy about the bathroom. Beautiful views - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel, stayed several times, never had a bad experience. Sadly it is fully booked for my next visit...”
Reviews.Author: Safemach
Reviews.Content: Efficient check in and out, convenient location linked to walkways that take you to underground station, shopping, restaurants etc. Rooms a decent size, prices are OK if they include free internet (ask and you may get). Lifts a bit slow, but other factors make up for the rest. Great choice if you are attending the convention centre.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: EdOverIp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 9 nights between two stays (3 nights then 1 week away in Thailand then 6 nights). We were placed on the 31 floor during the first stay and the bed was very hard for us. The house keeping staff tried their best in making it comfortable for us by piling on mattress pad after mattress pad; I think we stopped at 3 extra mattress pads. :) Our house keeping person, CoCo (very nice lady), gave us a tip that rooms above 33rd floor have softer beds and got a manager to show us up there. They even noted our account and put us on the 36th floor during our 2nd stay. Fantastic follow through! We were upgraded to the harbour view room for both stays since I am a Marriott Gold and what a view! The staff at the club lounge are super attentive. One tip for folks with status -- you can request to have your breakfast at the Cafe (buffet) for free. Since we were there for 9 nights (10 breakfasts), while the lounge breakfast was good it got a little old, so the Cafe was definitely a welcome change. Just ask the lounge staff, they will hook you up! The location of the hotel is great. Not as good as if we were in Central in terms of shopping but you have easy access to buses, taxis and subway. My only complaint is the cost of laundry is a bit high since it was a leisure trip and on our own dime on this trip -- ~$3USD for a pair of underwear and/or socks. However, if you don't mind a 5 mins walk, there is a laundromat near the corner of Lockhart and Flemings that washed, dried and folded 11lbs of laundry for around $7.5USD. We will be back to HK I am sure and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: nick w
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in HK and the Renaissance is a great place to stay when exploring a new city. The views of Kowloon over the harbour are wonderful. There are several restaurants and bars a couple blocks south of the hotel. The nearest subway station is also in this area. The front desk and concierge employees are so helpful. They recommended local restaurants and activities during our stay. So helpful! The hotel is very nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krissi55
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay in Wanchai for business or have a function at the Convention Center, you wont get a better place to stay, perfect location. 10 min walk to Wanchai MRT and 10 min walk to Ferry terminal to take a ferry to Kowloon. They have a really really good japanese Restaurant attached to the hotel, one of the best in Hong Kong! Otherwise not so many good restaurants around, but easy to take a taxi to Soho etc. If you are on leisure, maybe not best location, better choose hotel in Central. And if you stay here, definitely get a room with Harbour View, that's why you are in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly9233
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of October. We requested a refurbished room with a harbour view and we weren't disappointed. The room was small but clean and modern. We were on the 34th floor and had a fantastic view of the harbour. The only negatives were the breakfast which is incredibly overpriced and the gym which is quite a long walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kowloon Ferry and Wan Chai”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: Usual Marriott standard. Nothing is too much trouble. Easy to access Metro by walkway. Taxis are pretty reasonable. Concierge very helpful. Try to book into Tim's Kitchen in town. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but cramped”
Reviews.Author: Carync6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there on business. We have stayed here before but the rooms were recently renovated. While the rooms are generally nice, the decor is cold and uninviting. The room design is very awkward with the room door opening directly into the bathroom. There is a door separating thaw hallway and bathroom from the rest of the room but if you are in the shower or usingi the toilet, please keep the door latch engaged as housekeeping or anyone else with a key can come directly into the bathrooml. Very awkward. The floors are laminated wood and just not warm and inviting. The hotel bar is nice but service is a bit slow. The workout facilities are nice but you have to walk forever through a maze of inside and outside to get there. Check in was seamless and the hotel car service was prompt and very good

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: pinayflashpacker
Reviews.Content: Stayed in '09 for exhibition. Hotel attached to fair site. Very big room with all amenities needed. Didn't have views on my room. Comfy bed. Nothing much in this area for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good for HK Convention Centre visitors but not for shopping trips”
Reviews.Author: SchueyMalaysia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice if you plan to attend functions at the HK Convention Centre. Otherwise, I would rather choose Causeway Bay or Central. Even though it is located about 10 min from the Wanchai MTR (with sheltered connection directly from hotel to the station - via 2 buildings & an overhead bridge), the "walking routes" are always to jam packed with people, particularly when there are functions at the HK Convention Centre (which I presumed is All Year Long). So, I found the walks between the MTR station and hotel rather uncomfortable. As for the hotel itself, it was recently refurbished to a high standard and the room I was assigned to was very well re-furbished (i.e. practical, clean and beautiful). I had one of those "middle corner" rooms, which was quite small but due to its layout, almost 70% of the room was covered with floor to ceiling window, thus providing a spectacular harbour view. However, the room is designed for single traveller or couples: - my bed was supposed to be a king size bed but it looked way too small to be one - as the room was rather small, it would be difficult to fit in two mid-size luggages (I had only 1 luggage, so it wasn't a problem at all for me) - the shower room (sorry, NO BATHTUB) had glass window (i.e. no privacy). Service:- Impeccable. It was amazing how every housekeeping staff we met on our floor seem to know our names and which room we were from. I have not idea how they managed to accomplish this as this is a fairly large hotel. Food:- Good. We ate at the breakfast restaurant & the Chinese Restaurant. They were both very good. The reason I gave this a hotel a 3 star rating (even though it is difficult to find faults with this hotel) instead of a 4 or 5 because I was there for a shopping trip and I hated the long and crowded walks to the station. I would have preferred a hotel nearer to the MTR station. There was also nothing much to see / to do (unless you are interested to go to the many dodgy bars in that area) around Wanchai.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & Hospitable Staff”
Reviews.Author: Krishnapv
Reviews.Content: Stayed for few days last week and found the bayview from the hotel very good, it is conveniently located next to the HK Convention Centre and can be accessed conveniently from HK Central through cabs or MTR. Staff is hospitable and friendly. Good breakfast options available and served within time, if notified overnight

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and nice”
Reviews.Author: Bellesister
Reviews.Content: This is a really convenient hotel to stay in hongkong if you're going to an exhibition at the convention center. It's within walking distance to the convention center. And for pleasure and sightseeing, the hotel is also conveniently located near the MTR station and the ferry pier to go acrodd to Kowloon. The rooms are clean and very modern with flat screen TV. The staff is also helpful and calls you by name when you call the operator or room service. I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, the location and breakfast superb”
Reviews.Author: JonasCh
Reviews.Content: Was staying here the first time a couple of years ago, I like it and it is very convenient location when going to the fair. The clubfloor is ok with a marvellous view, but compared to the Langham on Tsim Tsa Tsui were we stay otherwise the service is not as good....but still a god choice.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 705golfer
Reviews.Content: Was sent to Hong Kong for work and ended up staying at this hotel. Whlst it is a good 5 star hotle was very unhappy being hassled to join the Marriott club when checking after a 5 hour travel. In regard to breakfast be aware they only charge room rate ( not clear ) and when I had my first breakfast I was asked to sign and I informed theM i assume this is included in the room package and answer was this was for administration and again was done again the next day. On my check out I was charged over HK$250 for my breakfast each time which is very expensive so would recomend anyone staying there for holiday eat out so much cheaper ! Also not internet you must pay HK$120 for 24 hrs where any other hotels I stay in Asia included in price ( as is breakfast) !. Overall good location but after you add up the additional costs to your bill maybe can look around for better deal if on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Well organized, clean and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ajaxajs
Reviews.Content: I like the room I was given. Though it's not too big it's not too small either... The bed is comfortable and the bathroom is clean... Like the shower! Though I was disappointed that I dint get the harbor view room it is fine as the city view is not bad. however next time I will ask for a harbor view one. If u become a member of their program Internet is free which is awesome! Wifi too! Close proximity to mtr n shops n my office so a comfortable option which I wudnt mind stayin again...

Reviews.Title: “Good, consistent and great business location”
Reviews.Author: Starfish2201
Reviews.Content: Located next to the HK Convention Centre this hotel is ideally located and is all well located with good access to the Star Ferry and MTR. Staff are friendly and professional and a range of restaurants is good. The Club floor is great value and a perfect sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle. Whilst the new rooms are smaller than the old ones they are still good but perhaps lost some of their character. Have stayed at this hotel numerous times and it is a very professional hotel and service is always consistently good. Also the pool - one of the largest outdoor pools in HK is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: InjiM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with work again and I have to say it was a great hotel. I stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms with a great view of the harbour and it was very modern and spacious. I was staying during a busy time so I would say make sure you reserve a table at the bar there if you want a couple of drinks before heading out or before bed. Location wise it was fantastic and I did try to walk everywhere but the cab option is much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, especially if you are attending an event at the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Craig S
Reviews.Content: I would only stay at The Renaissance Harbour View if I were attending a convention at the convention center. It is expensive and fairly average over all. The service, however, is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best lcoations to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Pankaj S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Wan Chai harbour. Since I am a Mariott Gold Card member, I got an upgrade to Harbour View room and what a view. Wall size glass windows and you see all ships and ferrys floating in water and straight way, you can see Kowloon harbour. The hotel has covered connection to Wan Chai marker, convention centre and underground and is located reasonably near to other attractions. What works in favor of this hotel is easy access to transport options and being in the city, close to upmarket Staff is nice and architecture of the hotel is modern. Since this hotel shares the boundary with another hotel and some of the residentisl apartments, some times it becomes confusing if once can use the park (which actuallyis meant for other hotel and the apartments). We used it since no asked us anything. But this park and the swimming pool on 11th floor is different We used ferrys to move from Hong Kong island to Kowloon as that is economical and faster. Must see in Hong Kong (1) Ocean Park - this is simply fantastic (2) Disney Lan - smaller han other disney lands but nice and perfect My daughter has been so happy there, she did not want to come back to India. Very nice holidays

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Themadtrainer
Reviews.Content: Currenty stopping in this hotel for the weekend and have to agree with every positive comment I have read! in arrival i was warmly welcomed and as a high Status Marriot card holder I was immediately upgraed to a full suite with a huge corner balcony. I was escorted to my room by the manager which was a very good touch! there is building and renovation work going on in the hotel however there is no disruption to guests and the hotel will be even better when this is completed! Club lounge is very good with good food and surroundings and the service is excellent! Breakfast buffet on the first floor is amazing! and to die for! best hotel breakfast buffet I have seen! service thoughout is to a very high standard! pool area is very nice although shared with the Hyatt next door, for gym lovers beware the gym is next door in the Hyatt! so a bit of a walk through the gardens and gets very busy! weekend entertainment is provided in the ground florr lounge bar and is very good! reccomend this hotel to anyone! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: sydjf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the Hong Kong Island side, with easy access to Taxis, Trams, MTR (Train System) and the charming Star Ferry. The hotel itself has recently rennovated their rooms, with what you would expect from a corporate Hong Kong hotel. Clean, well appointed rooms with all the amenities (comfortable bed, clean and modern bathroom, flat screen TV). The Buffet Breakfast is of high international standard and offers lots of choice. We did not have the opportunity to dine in the hotel for Lunch or Dinner. There is a great open pool; that is great. The service was mixed, but what you would expect from a foreign hotel. The staff were helpful without being amazing. We had a few billing issues, however were addressed fairly rapidly. Restaurant wise, we tended to dine at Lan Kwai Fong, (Western influenced area) most nights and enjoyed the retail, dining and general feel about the area. Its a short taxi or 2 stops from the Wan Chai MTR train system.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: stylish_30
Reviews.Content: The hotel ticked every box - it is very conveniently located, yet in a quiet part of Hong Kong; our room was very comfortable and the air conditioner very effective. The hotel has a fantastic roof top garden and a massive pool with a lovely resort atmosphere ... On the 11th floor! The staff are absolutely fabulous - very efficient and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for both leisure and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: BooHK1212
Reviews.Content: Efficient, friendly, great location, luxurious are just a few words to describe this hotel. And most importantly extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel on Hong Kong island”
Reviews.Author: Craig A
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located directly behind the Convention Centre and only a short walk from Wan Chai MTR station (along elevated walkways) is very convenient. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations and the newly renovated rooms are spectacular. The rain shower in the bathroom was a treat. The pool area (shared with the Grand Hyatt) is pleasant with plenty of loungers and pool attendants constantly walking around to take drink orders or bring fresh towels. The staff were consistently superb. There were always 2 or 3 staff members in the lobby ready to provide advice and assistance. The only downside was a somewhat hard bed. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Clara D
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong was our first stop in our Asia trip and this hotel really started everything off on the right note for us. My husband travels quite a bit for work so we booked everything off on his points and since he has status, they upgraded us to a room with the spectacular harbour view overlooking the convention centre. (On a side note, the hotel is undergoing renovations on certain floors, so make sure when you make reservations to ask for a room that's on a newly renovated floor!) It was also our wedding anniversary, so they gave us a nice bottle of champagne with chocolate covered strawberries...YUM! We were also given access to the club lounge where Hors D'Oeuvres and cocktails were served throughout the day. The receptionist was kind enough to also recommend the hotel restaurant for their breakfast buffet and my husband and I agreed it was the best buffet breakfast we've ever had! The selections available were incredible! They have a fresh juice bar, pastry station, western style station (omelettes, pancakes etc), Japanese station, Chinese station...the list goes on! The staff there were super attentive, as soon as you signal, someone rushes over to assist you. As for the room, while I personally love the modern feel of it, my husband was not a big fan of the open concept bathroom. It was a pretty strange layout, where a panel door serves as a divider between the bedroom and bathroom, but there's no privacy whatsoever between the front door and the bathroom itself. Hotel also located in a central location, Wan Chai. One MTR stop away from Causeway Bay (mega shopping area) and several MTR stops away from Kowloon. From the walkway, it takes about 10 minutes to walk to the MTR station, and even though it's hot, there's cover on the walkway so no complaints about that. All in all, an amazing experience, largely thanks to the professionalism all the staff displayed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cathie13
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fab, ideally located for concerts at Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre and next door to Hyatt. Rooms are spacious and bar in the lobby is great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveB_150
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with exceptional service in a fantastic location (for Hong Kong & Kowloon). Staff are fantastic and rooms amazing plus outstanding pool area for when you need to escape the craziness of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - staff where excellent!”
Reviews.Author: gs007
Reviews.Content: Went as it was the only hotel we could find with a pool and a play area for our 2 yr old. But we went to the pool twice and the playground twice... as you seeon realise that in Hong kong you dont get timeto bathe and play, there is too much to do!.. The fact that they are there is a massive bonus, but its location alone makes staying here a definate!.. 2 min walk to the star ferry and you are in Kowloon, you can walk to the central and buiness district, plenty of bars, shops, restaurants... its perfect. the staff in the bar area where brilliant with our son, they dotted on him, and he loved going there. made the holiday so much better. will go again, infact i wouldnt even consider other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located for a Hong Kong City Break”
Reviews.Author: SurreyRobin
Reviews.Content: Main consideration when choosing the Hotel was location and we were not dissapointed. Perfectly located in Wanchai 10 minutes walk from MTR with one stop from vibrant Causeway Bay area to the West and one stop to Central/Soho (with its expat bars and restaurants), plus a Star Ferry link to Kowloon. Wanchai itself had its fair share of lively bars and Restaurants, although a bit seedy at night. Having said that we found our favourite Peking Chineese Restaurant here called The American: great food and very reasonably priced. (Highly recomended). Beware that there are two Star Ferries, one from Wanchai and one from Central and make sure you catch the right one on the return..! We really liked the Hotel, we had a free upgrade to a Harbour View Room on the 26th floor from which the view was fantastic and greatly improved the experience. First impression was that the room was smallish and a bit lacking in storage space albeit very modern bright and very well equipped. Could be a bit tight if you travel with a lot of luggage. This is the only minor criticism we would have and it would not prevent us from returning. Liked the pool and pool area, although changing facilities could be improved. Renovation in the Hotel was ongoing in the upper floors and we were warned about this but it did not disturb us as the work was limited to 0930 onwards. Would definately recommend this Hotel and would consider returning ourselves. For Trips and things to do, China Day trip just across the border was a highlight. Shopping was great but remember to haggle extra hard. Go toTemple street Market first to gauge prices and use that for a benchmark. China should be cheaper but the business is so good with so many customers some traders can afford to hold their prices.Try a less busy trader and you may have better luck. Also went to Lamma island by Ferry, with some good Seafood Restaurants and a pleasant walk across the island. As regards Markets, we went to Temple Street Night Market and the Ladies Market (daytime), latter was possibly better. Also visited the Flower market on the last day and picked up a bargain selection of cut Orchids for only HK$60 which we took back to the UK !

Reviews.Title: “Great view and super location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAllCreation
Reviews.Content: Plusses and minuses include the following: Positives: * Really fantastic views of the harbor, which is great during the day and even better in the evening. * Rooms are very comfortable and spacious. * Restaurant had very good food, and a good default option if you cannot get into the city one evening. * Staff was very helpful and professional. * Although expensive, was actually very good value based on location, quality and the superb views. Negatives: * It is costly. * Not all the rooms face out to the harbor - make sure you get one that does, as the views are well worth any additional cost (or ask for free upgrade). In Hong Kong, ensure you explore the following before leaving: * Take ferry across the harbor and have lunch on the other island. * Get to to the top of Victoria Peak. Great photo oppotunities. * Take the cable car to the Big Buddha. Go early so you can have the car to yourself, as it will allow you to have flexibility to take photos from all angles. The views are awesome, so you will want to take many photos going up and down. * Rent a car or a cab and go around the island (plan about 3-4 hours with stops) to take lots of great photos and get a sense for the entire island and not just the downtown district, which is great itself. Places to stop for photos around the island include Aberdeen, Deep Water Bay, Stanley Bay, and the Stanley market (good place for lunch).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: dkracerfl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a newly restored room. Absolutely wonderful. Tastefully appointed. Great view. Very quiet and comfortable. Had a maintenance issue- engineer was there in less than 5 minutes. Problem couldn't be resolved, manager was on the spot to move me to a new room with a team to help me move. Next day, a sincere apology. As a very frequent traveler I know that problems sometimes happen. It's not the problem but how the staff handles it. In this case the staff handled it so very well. Better than I ever remember seeing. Also- breakfast buffet was superb with a wide selection of foods and a fresh juice bar. Wish I had more time than the two nights I was there. For sure, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GregNRose
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this Hotel while in Hong Kong on Business. I would strongly recommend it to anyone visiting the area. It is very conveniently located -- right on Victoria Harbor. It is easy to catch a ferry across the water and explore. Likewise, it is very convenient to grab a taxi or get to the Metro. There are a lot of shops and restaurants within walking distance. The view of the Harbor from the hotel room was amazing. Service was great and the morning buffet was excellent! I can't wait to go back. Note: If you are a member of the Marriott Rewards program, high speed internet is free in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value and great views”
Reviews.Author: bucketlista
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter weekend in Hong Kong and prices everywhere were inflated. The Harbour View was the best value available at the time, with terrific sit-down harbour and Kowloon views from "Harbour View" room. Worth the price upgrade to get the view. Most hotel rooms in HK are small but this one didn't feel cramped, partly due to the floor-to-ceiling windows. Hotel location in Wan-Chai was very convenient to ferry (right at your door-step) and metro (just a 2 blocks away by covered walkway). Terrific restaurants nearby and a fantastic Easter buffet with great service in the hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Selective guest service”
Reviews.Author: kap2000
Reviews.Content: Seems this hotel has selective guest servicing....iam sitting in in the lounge and no staff is interested in offering at least a glass of water whereas they are asking other preferred guests non stop for what they want....seems service is only for selected guests and others they ignore...never again a trip to this hotel ..looks like this is the only Marriott property which gives this kind of service to it loyal gold members...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a great view and service”
Reviews.Author: AnandGnanaraj
Reviews.Content: I reached the hotel in a cab and had few dollars change. The cost of the transport was so high and I was wondering how to get the dollars. To my pleasant surprise the hotel guy paid the taxi and put it on my bill. With that start, I had a great stay. The Harbour view is great. The staff are really friendly and the Metro station is very close. That takes you to the entire city. The conference venue was just next door and made the stay very cool. Overall, a great place to stay and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but stay in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: liked_copper
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel due to flight disruptions because of the snow in Europe. We had been in the Eaton Smart in Kowloon but they were booked up so we moved over to the Renaissance. Its a lovely hotel, the views are good, the rooms are big (for Hong Kong) and it has all you need. But we felt it was missing something and I think that was the buzz of Hong Kong. For the price we paid I would rather have stayed in the Eaton Smart, its smaller and just felt that it had more soul and was a little more authentic. So if you have the option I would save your money for the markets and stay in the Eaton rather than the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise for a change”
Reviews.Author: GSLove
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel loaded with fine restaurants, great views of the harbour, beautiful pool, playground, tennis area, and updated rooms. The service was great and the staff was always nice and helpful. Also located in close proximity of anything you want to see in Hong Kong. 5 minutes from MRT train to airport and other areas. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to experince Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ashandbecky
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Harbour View Hotel, as suggested by the name, has magnificent views over the Harbour and Kowloon. The floor to ceiling windows allow for some breathtaking views. The location of the hotel is also excellent, being right in the centre of Hong Kong island. You are a 5 minute walk from the Wan Chai MTR station and the Wan Chai Star Ferry Terminal is across the road. There is a Starbucks right outside the hotel too. The hotel was in the process of being renovated during our visit so the rooms are very modern and comfortable. We did not use any of the restaurants/gym/swimming pool so are unable to comment on these facilities. The staff were all very friendly. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: schultzemily03
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up in the car we were looked after. The service was amazing, rooms were nice, good location the only bad thing i can say about this place was the beds were too hard. I will definitely return but will just request a softer bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wondering Hotel and I will definite go back again!”
Reviews.Author: SduNyc
Reviews.Content: Nice location, great service. I stayed there for 3 nights with my kids during the spring break. I stayed one night and left for 5 days and came back for two nights stay. They had my room upgraded to a harbor view room and provided an additional rollway bed free of charge. They also provided complementary fruits in the room and free drink for my kids. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The view was nice and the room was clean and comfortable. My son left his stuff animal in the room and they kept it and gave us back when we returned to the hotel. They also provide luggage storage service free of charge. I had stayed seven different hotel during my 3 weeks vacation. This was the best one I had stayed during my trip. I will definite go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & fun”
Reviews.Author: Ivonne33
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, only a few steps to the convention centre. The buffet @ the Cafe is really good, with a wide variety of fruits and fresh squeezed juices as well as a noodle bar. You must spend some time at the lobby bar, the girls sing nicely and music there is fun and great for business purposes. Rooms are small but spaces have been maximized smartly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, fantastic location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Keyamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our toddler & we just loved it! The views of the harbour are just breathtaking, you can even see the symphony of lights at 8 pm every night from the comfort of your own room. Location is fantastic, everything is either a short walk away through walkways through various buildings or a short taxi ride or ferry away! Both the Chinese restaurant & the Cafe have great food. The cafe is especially very child friendly. All the staff are very helpful & went to great lengths to make our stay comfortable & great. We'd definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to HK

Reviews.Title: “was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Faraz89
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very good and we stood there for seven days and was very good, the service, the swimming pool nd gym everything was very good. The rooms especially was very comfortable and there was hot water 24 hrs and the hotel is situated near to the sea sooo the view from the hotel is great at day and night time. If you're going to hong kong frm my point of view this hotel is 1 place u wont miss to stay and enjoy the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: c2maecab
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay in this hotel for 5 nights. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Breakfast is very good. Our only complaint is the noise from the other rooms especially late at night when they using their bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Luxury "Under Renovation"”
Reviews.Author: Afagato
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights at the last minute at the end of Easter. The promotional offer was exceptional value and included HK$200 of food and beverages per day. We were told on check in however that there was construction work under way at certain times of the day. This was fine because we were out during those times so no inconvenience was suffered. Our room was on a recently renovated floor. The rooms and furnishings were new and of a high standard. The room had a view of the garden and the pool which was magnificent. The pool area is great, but finding the gym was like looking for Wally. The gym is in the Hyatt hotel which is adjacent. You have to follow the signs and it took longer to walk to and find the gym than it did to have a work out! A star ferry terminal is a five minute walk away so getting to Kowloon is easy. It is connected by walk ways to the Wan Chai MTR, but it is still a good 15 minute walk. Taxi rides to Lan Kwai Fong ans Soho is only HK $30. The common areas of the hotel are spectacular and it is truly a 5 star experience. The staff were excellent and very helpful. I had a small problem with bill on check out but the staff member resolved the matter in my favour even though I may have been in the wrong (possibly). My only gripe with 5 star hotels is the charges for the internet. Access to the internet is now as necessary as electricity and clean water. The governement provides free internet in many public palces why do hotels which demand a premium for the room not provide a modern necessity inclusive? Apart from this the Renaissance is a magnificnet hotel and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but in difficult location”
Reviews.Author: Cheemar
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure this hotel is worth the money it costs. It is a modern building, the staff are very helpful, there is a nice restaurant and kids playground area, it has some basic amenities nearby. However the rooms are on the small side (we had four pieces of luggage and it was a challenge to house it all as there are no wardrobes as such). The rooms are nicely designed for the bedroom, window view part of it (the Harbour View name in the title is true - and is great to look out either over to Kowloon or down to Causeway Bay). However the shower is next to the front door, as is the toilet. All next to where you hang your clothes in an open wardrobe rack. An unfortunate combination this can be. Room service is good - don't bother eating at the Cafe Renaissance if you order room service once though, because the menu is almost identical as is the pricing. Surprising thing - the business centre charges for internet. And there is no free wifi. This to me was surprising for a "world business city". The main problem I had with the hotel was the location. Whilst being on top of the harbour, and maybe a 20 minute walk to the MTR, you are better to stay at the tip of Kowloon on the other island. More closer to the late night nature of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MNtoAnywhere
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days in Hong Kong at the Renaissance Harbour View Hotel. We had a very nice stay at the hotel. It is conveniently located a few blocks from a subway station and right next to the ferry stop. We did find ourselves traveling by subway to the central district quite a bit, so you may want to consider looking for a place down there if you will be spending most of your time there, but we really enjoyed the Renaissance. The hotel itself is very comfortable. We stayed in recently renovated harbor view rooms on the 14th floor. The room was very nicely done, and had a great view of the harbor. The rooms are a bit on the small side. There is no wireless in the rooms, but a wired connection is available. There is wireless in the club lounge if you have access. We had a great time in Hong Kong, lots of shopping and sightseeing. Definitely go to the top of Victoria Peak at night, and take a 1/2 day to check out the Buddha at Ngong Ping.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: kayzie60
Reviews.Content: Great location to ferry to Kowloon and to the MTR trains. Bus service two streets away (10 mins) walking to Immigration Centre to catch bus to Stanley Markets (260 bus). Taxi service not expensive to and from the hotel to Peak Tram and Central Pier and back from the Stanley Markets and to/from Ocean Park. Our Garden View Room was very spacious with an excellent view, overlooking the garden and playground area (excellent for children) tennis courts available. TV Plasma. Excellent swimming pool area. Charger in the room for Australian applicances. Internet available in the room and downstairs in the Business Conference Room. Mini bar available also coffee/tea in the room. Restaurants within the hotel were great, service was good. Staff were very friendly in all areas of the hotel from the checkin, checkout, sitesighting, conceirges, restaurants, navigators. Walking distance to Wan Chai shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great views.”
Reviews.Author: orchidluv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Deluxe Harbour View room. Room very small especially when we had the extra bed in it, big old tv ( come on Renaissance, havent you heard of Flatscreen TVs?) but the view from our window was fabulous. Great location, shopping mall next to hotel and convention Centre and easy to get to MRT and Ferry. Service good. Had a meal on our last night in the Dynasty restaurant which was supposed to be a 1-star Michelin restaurant but very disappointed with meal. Very expensive and didnt taste any special but the worse thing about it was the service. It was indifferent and they seemed in a hurry to get rid of us - as soon as they saw we had finished eating, they swooped down and cleared the table completely except for the teacups we were drinking from! We felt very uncomfortable and not wanted.Not a good experience.Breakfast in restaurant was very good.Hotel seemed very busy with business type people.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: travelling_sushi
Reviews.Content: When traveling to HK, the best place to stay is somewhere close to the MRT and somewhere were transportation is not a problem. My partner and I decided to try the Renaissance Harbourview since many of our friends have stayed there previously and they said that location is quite convenient. True enough the hotel is facing the harbour and just a few steps from the main entrance is the Star Ferry which can take you to Kowloon side. The MTR is about a 10minute walk from the hotel through a sky walk. We arrived at around 3am in the hotel after a 2.5 hour flight. There was only one staff at the front desk who's name is Ryan. He was extremely helpful and accommodating. He gave us a refurbished room which we requested for and recommended us to a place where we can have a midnight snack. Walking on the streets is fairly safe, except if your not familiar with the Wan Chai district, it would be a red light all around. Upon checking out, my partner had lost the keys to his luggage so we had to request for someone to come up and break the lock. A hotel staff from the engineering department came up to assist us. He spoke very little english but offered to give us a new lock free of charge. We really appreciated this kind gesture. I am very impressed with the staff at the hotel. Ive traveled to Hong Kong many times before and I really hate to stereotype most of the locals that Ive encountered are usually quite rude. I was surprised and very pleased with the service and the helpful hotel staff. Perhaps they can do something about their slightly musty "refurbished" carpet but the service makes up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient”
Reviews.Author: tommillerjones
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days there and found it a good centre for visitng family and for sight-seeing. We were the first to occupy newly renovated, rather small, room - good garden view but little of the harbour visible. Room simply furnished with fast internet access (extra charge), firm bed with really good bed-linen. Curiously the shower room and loo did not have a separate door but were integral with entrance passage - OK when you're used to it. Not many drawers. Would be ideal for single business person. Hotel seemed in excellent condition with roof-pool and playground shared with neighbouring Grand Hyatt. Entrance lobby like a barn and sometimes made uninhabitable by over-amplified, shrieking singer. Otherwise fine. Efficient porterage.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and view”
Reviews.Author: jpp60993
Reviews.Content: The location was great, right next to the star ferry terminal and the hotel is attached to the convention centre which is worth a visit just to admire the awsome metal architectural structure. View from our view over the harbour was a real wow. Easy to get around from the hotel, coffee shop right next door where we had breakfast. Lovely panoramic pool to chill out at. Friendly efficient staff. Overall a good find that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: kaymee
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay in WanChai. Previously, we stayed in a hotel in TST, Four Seasons in a kind of Central and Island Shangri-la in Admiralty.
