We found that this Wan Chai area is surprisingly convenient to go to main area of Hong Kong. First, the hotel is just a couple of minutes away from the ferry terminals to TST and Hung Hom. Second, you can go to Central and Causway Bay by taxi with not substantially more than base rate (i.e. about 20 HKD). Third, it is also easy to go to the other side of the Island such as Ap Lei Chau because taxi fare cost less. Finally, if you want to take public transportation such as MTR, you are connected to all the way to the station trough covered elevated walkways. For the hotel itself, as long as you can get a renovated room, you will have no major complaints. The room is not as big as the one in Four Seasons or Shangri-la. But very clean and functional. And the harbor view is so excellent that make you feel that you’re really in Hong Kong. As a Marriott hotel, the services were well organized and excellent without trying too hard. Overall, it is a very good hotel with excellent location, clean/modern facilities, sophisticated and comfortable services and reasonable rate. I think it is quite underrated in terms of current rankings in Tripadvisors partially, I guess, because it is under renovation work. I am not sure if they will raise the rate substantially after completion of the renovation. But at least as of now, I think it is one of the best value hotels in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good location!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelverymuch10
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, wired internet is fast. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Scottmcm
Reviews.Content: If location were the only thing that mattered the Renaissance would be the best hotel in Hong Kong. Couple it's superb location with a 4+ star hotel and you have yourself a real winner. Located in a massive business/retail complex with skyway connections to both the MTR (subway) and the Star Ferry to Kowloon. The hotel has 4 restaurants; Dynasty (Chinese), Scala (Italian, very good) Cafe (casual) and lobby restaurant/bar. The staff are friendly, attentive and knowledgeable and most are quite fluent in English. The hotel is not pretentious like a Hyatt/Ritz etc. but offers all the amenities one would expect in an upmarket facility. Excellent WiFi, limo to/from airport (extra charge,about $85USD) spacious rooms, cable TV, coffee/tea service in room, hair dryers, a/c adaptors, copious pillows, fantastic "rain" shower stall, great beds, tremendous view of the harbor. In fact you could say it is the in the center of the harbor area. Plentiful ATM's in the plaza, Harbor cafe for excellent cappuccinos also in the retail plaza and a Starbucks and 7-11 across the street. Both accessible via Skyway. There are numerous great hotels in HK, but none any better than this gem. My personal opinion is that HK Island is the best location for a first time visitor. It has the feel of any great large city compared to the pandemonium of the Kowloon side. This is not to say it isn't busy and occassionally crowded, but it does feel more like a big US city than across the bay. The best thing I can say about the Renaissance is it is directly across Victoria Harbor from the Peninsula which gives you an idea of the value of the location. Is the real estate types are fond of saying, "Location, Location, Location"

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: TX1969
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and view from my room on the 35th floor over Victoria Harbour. The Kowloon ferry departs downstairs and most Hong Kong bus lines are within walking distance. Loved the breakfast every morning and yes, please check out the gardens and pool on the 11th floor........ one of a kind. Always had a perfect night sleep due to the great pillows and the extra large comforter. The hotel has an elegant lobby lounge with waitstaff but not a traditional bar area. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations (December 2010) and you will hear the sledgehammer in your room between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. 7 days a week. No chance for a nap on the weekends. The lobby, pool and restaurants though are not part of the renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Good location a tad tired”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: This used to be the New World Hotel many years ago. There is work taking place at the hotel and guess this will only be an improvement. I found the room slightly tired, but not enough to affect my stay. As hotel rooms go and given the price of square footage in Hong Kong, the room was fairly roomy ! The bed was very comfortable with ample pillows, equally comfortable. It's practically attached, via a walk way, to Wanchai metro station. You need exit A5. A large hotel, where by and large, staff I encountered were helpful and friendly. I have to admit, I did not use any of the hotel facilities - really no need to with an abundance of restaurants and bars in Hong Kong. If you like Indian food, the UK reputedly having better Indian Chefs than India, I can thoroughly recommend an Indian restaurant under a seperate review, Bombay Dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the pool area”
Reviews.Author: Hupflinger
Reviews.Content: Personally this is one of my top5 favourite hotels in Asia. I stay there every year at least once, in the past 5 times a year - for privte and business reasons. I like the location net to the fair, you can also take the boat to Kowloon which departs frequently direct in front of the building. I also like the mix of guests, the lobby are, the live music there, the OUTSTANDING dim sum restaurant in the hotel. Don't mis it! The rooms are average I would say, consistent quality but nothing special from the interior. Go for the more epensive Harbour View rooms, the view to the bay and fancy illuminated Kowloon side is BREATHTAKING. It is worth. Another recommendation is to ask for the rooms located in the corners of the building - those rooms have huge window facades with panoramic view and seem to be a little bit bigger. AFAIK the pool landscape (which is shared with the neighbour hotel) is the LARGEST in HK. As HK is a busy and exhausting place, this is a excellent refugium on the 11th floor to relief from stress. Whenever I am in HK, I plan time to relax there. The pool is great, lovely shaped, the deckchairs have cozy frottee covered matresses and the staff serves drinks and food. Try one of the fresh juices, e.g. with lime, ginger, mint... The hotel has no spa, therfore you need to go to the neighbour hotel, the staff will arrange for you. I tried it, but the value for money is soso, sure it is nice, but bloody expensive for Asia. Before I forget...in one discipline the hotel is #1 for me: The doormen. The have a Indian doormen, this guy combines passion, heartblood and customer-orientation like noone else.And it is a kind of theatre to watch him how he organizes the taxi queue...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel. Room Renovations in Progress”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Lving
Reviews.Content: I completed my third stay at this hotel last month, and will return again. If you are attending a conference at the Convention Center, there is literally no hotel closer. I am Marriott Platinum, and have always liked the full breakfast in their Lounge on the top floors. The evening reception is nice as well, and has beers and wine available for no-charge. They are renovating the rooms currently (thankfully) and I was given one, and it was very nice. There is a clean, modern look and it beats the chrome and mirror looks of the old rooms. I only once heard construction noise, and they confine construction to the middle of the day when most people are out. I was sorry to see the Kowloon Renaissance go away, but this is just as nice of hotel if you don't mind staying on the island. You are steps away from the Star Ferry and the Admiralty and Wan Chai MTR stations are within easy walking distance. (I would not do Admiratly with luggage...it is about a 15 minute walk.) There are many decent restaurants just outside the hotel and within easy walking distance, although I think the Kowloon side offers better diversity. If you are considering this hotel again the JW Marriott on points, you won't be disappointed here, but it isn't an "over the top" experience. Nice rooms, updated common areas and a great location make this my next stop for my Hong Kong trading!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel excellent view and location”
Reviews.Author: FunOnly
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised after having a below average experience at the Marriott Courtyard Hotel in Beijing. We must of been in a renovated room on the 35th floor as it was very nice with remote controlled lights and modern bathroom with shower in a tub. The staff were fantastic as the check in clerk escorted us to our room after check in. We then received a visit from the housekeeping supervisor an hour later to inquire if everything was in order. Charges in the bar were average for an upscale hotel however the breakfast was expensive so we eat at an adjoining cafe. The wireless internet was an extra $18 USD per day which is excessive, free wireless is widely available so no need to use it. There is a free shuttle bus to the MTR airport express train that is very clean, cheap and efficient, in fact you can check your bags and obtain your boarding pass the same day of travel and enjoy the luxury of traveling to the airport with hand luggage only. Public transportation is excellent in Hong Kong with the Star Ferry (Wan Chai) pier 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Be sure to go for a ride upstairs in the double decker tram - 10 minutes walk away - fantastic photo ops from the seat at the front of the second floor

Reviews.Title: “Not inexpensive, but adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gushkub
Reviews.Content: I was given an upgrade to harbor view room due to the renovation work going on in the hotel. The room had a magnificent view, but at first I was very worried about getting any sleep thinking about the construction work. However, there was no noise to keep me up, my stay was very pleasant, the service was good. The location was great. I would not pay more than US$200 for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property and service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBill
Reviews.Content: The day we checked into the Renaissance, I was sick. I have extreme motion sickness and had just had a very uncomfortable ride in a cab from Kowloon. As soon as the staff there understood my condition, they responded with outstanding service. They got me to a room immediately, even though it was 10AM. They brought me crackers and tea to settle my stomach. They took care of our luggage and expedited our registration. In short, they were excellent. This is a beautiful property in a great location, but their staff is number 1 in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tikoska
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location, atmosphere and service is excellent,surrounded with shopping malls which very convenient, also has big pool, gym and other entertainments inside. But i think, it is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: JanetOOroy
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Renaissance harbour view couldn't have been better! Location wise and otherwise.... .....The room was cool and welcoming with a fabulous view of the harbour from the 37th floor. Any requirement other than what was already available was immediately attended to. .....We experienced the services of very helpful and extremely courteous staff at the reception and restaurant. .....Although major reconstruction work is going on there from 10 in the morning till 6pm, the staff at the reception prepared us for it. I must make a special mention of the Navigator, Mr. Samuel, who guided us expertly on how to use our time to do and see the most of Hong Kong. He is a walking, talking guide book... Thank you very much, one and all at the Renaissance Harbour View for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “View was great, but do opt for Renovated Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: High_J
Reviews.Content: I booked a Habour View Room and was assigned one of the rooms on the 18th floor which had not been renovated. The view was lovely. However, the furnishing was relatively old. E.g. the TV was old with its image flickering when turned on. Also, I found the bed uncomfortable as it was definitely 'worn out'. I could feel the certain parts of the mattress 'sank'. After 2 nights of uncomfortable sleep, I paid for an upgrade to a renovated room which was well worth it cos I slept better thereafter. The renovated room was better laid out, brighter and exude a more "cheerful" feel. One big grouse I had was that the hotel did not provide international papers. Only local papers are provided. Basically I was told I had to go buy a copy of the Financial Times or Wall St Journal from their gift store! This was appalling given that the hotel is part of the Marriott establishment. I've stayed at other business hotels in HK and the provision of international papers is a standard practice. Service-wise, I had no complaints. Overall, loved the habour view, but I hope that they'd complete the renovation soon and add in the little touches which would differentiate itself as part of an international chain.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location.”
Reviews.Author: WizzyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd visit to this hotel and we still enjoy coming here. The rooms are being upgraded gradually and we stayed in a refurbished room with a Harbour View. The bathroom was very pleasant but I didn't particularly like having to use the hairdryer in there as it delayed my husband and son having a shower etc. The location of this hotel is ideal, only 5 minutes walk from the Star Ferry and 5-10 minutes from Wan Chai MTR. The pool on the roof of the 11th floor is superb but is very busy at weekends with many people who appear to perhaps not be hotel guests. I would highly recommend this hotel and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place with great pool and playground”
Reviews.Author: hstone5
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and spend there two times a week with our daughter in a suite and even got an upgrade to a larger suite. She loves the pool and play ground on the 11th floor. The restaurant has been really good for breakfast and dinner. The lounge has been great and in particular the service has been great.. Since not all room are refurbished yet, please ask for a refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price & Nice Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: hoops7k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. I was able to get a decent rate for Hong Kong. The hotel had some construction going and it was mentioned on the website during booking. The rooms are nice but average some of the wood around the bed set was starting to peel. Other then that I really don't have any complaints. The staff were very nice and helpful with anything that was needed. Got a good rate using AAA. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights in renovated Harbour View Room. View was a side view rather facing towards Tsim Tsa Tsui (although was called a full harbour view!). Room was a bit cramped with a rollaway bed. Bathroom was small (no bath) and storage space limited. Pool and kids playground were excellent. The drive to make guests pay for a poolside buffet ($80 per head) meant that during the weekend day and evenings that no food other than the buffet is available from the bar menu. This was a little off-putting and when we tried the buffet, it wasn't that great either. Breakfast choice and quality was good. Mini-bar and house-keeping were a bit hit and miss. Location great for ferry, access to Wan Chai and short taxi ride to Central/Soho. Express bus to Stanley market only a short walk to Gloucester Rd.

Reviews.Title: “A real discovery”
Reviews.Author: See-Tai-Fan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this hotel, I am surprised that it is not rated higher. It;'s part of the Marriott chain with good facilities and staff but about half the price of the J W Marriott in Admiralty. The staff are very friendly and the views can only be described as breathtaking, a 180 degree view of the harbour. There is a good Executive Lounge with a wide range of drinks and snacks. The rooms are comfortable, perhaps not quite up to JW standard but still very comfortable and much better rates. Location is very convenient, near Wanchai MTR station. The flagship frestaurant (Dynasty) is superb, quite well known in HK, I invited spome local people as my guests and they told me they already eat there and it is one of their favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service and average room”
Reviews.Author: Kate155019
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is my home town and I was having my wedding reception in the Renaissance Habour view hotel. My husband and I spend two nights there during the event. The hotel renovated the foyer and it was very grant and tasteful with the habour view, marble floor and a two-storey-high ceiling. We spent one night in a complementary suite and one night in a double bed harbour view room. The only disappointment was both the suite and the regular guest room are quite small and dated. The habour view from the room is very nice and the room service is average. The hotel is known to be good for food and i found the service is very good in general. The wedding reception was wonderful, service and food were excellent. I would recommend this hotel to people who want to hold a conference or party, or a convenient location that is very close to the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hollysingle
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a UK travelagent. Special offer was stay 3 nights and a free upgrade from a garden view room to a harbour view room. We stayed 11 nights but had to pay extra to secure a renovated room - another HK$110 per night at check in. Renovated rooms are on the lower floors. (above floor 11). Staff very polite and helpful, hotel clean and very well placed as next to Star Ferry and MTR station. Taxis plentiful. Swimming pool and facilities shared with the adjoining Grand Hyatt Hotel. Pool area was only busy at the weekends. Hotel used by flight crews. Food in the hotel quite expensive but there are lots of different places to eat outside. Recommend Lucy's in Stanley if visiting the market. June is in the Typhoon season but it mainly rained at night. Lots of interesting things and places to visit to keep you busy.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS NEED REFURBISHING”
Reviews.Author: KYBALION
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very busy at all times and crowded, so that noisy. What surprised me that most of taxi drivers didn't know the location of the hotel. Most of the rooms are in very old condition, but some rooms are already renovated. (Mine wasn't but my colleague's.) Rooms with harbor view is much better. Breakfast was overcrowded and poor service in a small restaurant. I'd stay somewhere else, at a better hotel if I go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be in HingKong”
Reviews.Author: Vinodraib
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a leisure /business stay in heart of the city, this is really a cool place to be in. Post your business meetings, there are many good shoping places around this hotel which is just walkable! Very reasonable price and best amenitis that i have seen in most hotels. Specially, don't forget to take out an hour for a swim.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act All the Way”
Reviews.Author: rabbitloverHk
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed for a week at the Renaissance Harbour View Hong Kong Hotel. What an outstanding hotel!! We had a renovated garden view room on the 15th floor overlooking the pool, playground, tennis courts and park. You can also see part of the harbour from the room. Although we did not have the harbour view, the view we had was very pleasant. The room itself was truly 5-star - brand new, posh, elegant, luxurious and very comfortable. Housekeeping informed us we got the largest room on the 15th floor. We put an extra bed in the room and there was still plenty of space to walk around in. The beds were the usual Marriott ones, which means they were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was all marble and had a huge shower cubicle with a rainfall shower. There was no tub, however. The LCD TV had a ton of English channels on it. Location wise, this place is hard to beat. Across the road is the pier for the Star Ferry for going over to Kowloon. The MTR station is 5 minutes walk by covered walkway and this will take you to most of the attractions in HK. Taxis will come right up to the hotel and this is also a cheap and quick way to get to nearby tourist spots. If you walk for a couple of minutes into the Wan Chai area, there are tons of restaurants there to choose from so no need to pay astronomical hotel prices for food. I found the Renaissance Harbour View to be a wonderful family hotel, good for taking care of kids when you're not going out. This is because of (i) the absolutely large free-form pool that the hotel has (must be one of the largest of any hotel in HK), the enormous playground with so many different kinds of play equipment and (iii) Cartoon Network Asia on TV to keep the kids occupied. My kids really loved the playground, the size of which I have never seen in any hotel that I've stayed in around the world. All three of the above mentioned features really helped to keep the kids busy and excited. Perhaps the only drawback, and this is certainly being very picky, is that the hotel is large (over 800 rooms) and therefore you cannot expect the staff to remember your name. Nevertheless, the staff are always happy to serve you when the need arises. The size of the hotel did not bother me at all and all the great facilities helped to make up for the lack of a personal touch. I would certainly recommend this to anyone who is going to HK. Its a bit of an oasis in a crowded, fast paced metropolis.

Reviews.Title: “Busy location, Great views”
Reviews.Author: J&MDAV
Reviews.Content: Busy, busy, busy hotel next to the Convention centre and Star Ferry, as well as 5-10 walk from ‘Wan Chai’ MTR [Metro] station and trams. Good base for exploring Hong Kong. Compared to other Renaissance properties, including our stay in Shanghai, seems like the rooms are due for an upgrade. Dark rooms and hallways, and some room amenities seem a bit dated. Nice views from the business lounge on 40th floor over to Kowloon - expect to be charged for WiFi access throughout the hotel [HK$120/day].

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl007
Reviews.Content: Checked in because of a cancelled flight (volcano) - get a very good online rate - extremely discounted. Transport from airport was with a very big, comfortable bus - 15 Euro - it was a kind of collect drive - but there were only guests from the Renaissance - so it took just 40 minutes - which is the regular time from the airport. You can also have a limousine, but it´s over 65 Euro or a private van for around 40 - but the bus worked very well - just go to the Marriott Desk at the airport. At c/i they gave me a very nice, big room on the 24th level - facing the pool - very good choice - because all the rooms with harbour view are next to some construction area. From my room you could oversee a nice palm court and the pool area - perfect. Bellmen are nowhere - they have kind of security people next to the main doors and they don´t care if you have 4 or 5 bags. A friend of mine had a regular room - they are very, very small and outdated - not worth the money even it had a harbour view. Pool area is really very, very nice - lots of sunchairs and they offer barbecue every evening - drinks and snacks all over the day. Had some room service - nothing special, but good food. Bar in the lobby area is also nice. It is def. not a five star hotel - like the Conrad - but the prices are on the lower side, if you check the internet in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0cny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaisssance for three nights as my last stop in China after a three week visit. I stayed using Marriott points. As requested, my room was harbor view and the receptionist told me it was in the newly renovated rooms. It was on the 19th floor which sounded high enough but the convention center still obscured some of the harbor view although there was still lots to see. Next time I'd try for a higher floor. The Star Ferry dock is right across the street. To see the light show it's necessary to go across to Kowloon. I went over early one evening and had tea at the Peninsula which is a must do when in Hong Kong. Then I found a place on the prominade on the harbor to watch the show along with lots of other tourists. I actually wasn't wowed by the light show. I'd heard so much about it I expected more but it was fun and only lasted about 15 minutes or so. Just seeing that part of Kowloon and being part of the crowd made it worthwhile. The room was large and pleasant. It had floor to ceiling windows but had curtains that could be shut to completely darken the room. I usually left the curtains open so I could see the lights of the Kowloon buildings across the way. The bed was firm but comfortable, not rock hard as in many Chinese hotels. The office area had sufficient lighting and good work space. The bathroom was updated with lots of nice amenities. After three weeks of Chinese food I had a pizza in the lounge a couple times. It wasn't the best I've had but it was okay. The lounge singers were also not the best but okay. The lounge itself was attractive and the staff was efficient. The various concierges I worked with over three days were very helpful and gave me good information. As in many Chinese hotels they wrote my destination in Chinese characters on a hotel card so I could show it to the taxi driver. The card also had commonly visited tourist sites listed so if I was out I could still pick up a taxi and have the destination I wanted written in Chinese. More taxi drivers in Hong Kong spoke some English than anywhere else I'd been in China, including Beijing, but having the card was helpful to ensure I ended up in the right location. Unlike in Beijing, all the taxis I rode in used honest meters and the drivers were pleasant and welcoming. The hotel was connected to other parts of the downtown businesses, shops, subway and restaurants by a covered walkway. I followed the concierge's easy directions to find the nearby subway station. The subway is very clean, safe and efficient with lots of good signage. As a single traveler who doesn't use subways very often I found it easy to use. And having it connected by a walkway to the hotel made it even easier. Overall the Renaissance is a large western style hotel with eastern staff who made me feel welcome. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Location and Experience”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyergrl101
Reviews.Content: After landing at the airport, we started our experience with the Renaissance with the shuttle organizers, as we had arranged transportation from the airport to the hotel. Counter service was very courteous and efficient. Shuttle ride took less than an hour. Upon check-in, we received great service. No problems at check-in, the process was very quick and pleasant. The hotel manager walked us to our room and showed us the ammenities. We had been upgraded to a suite, which was large, newly renovated and had a beautiful view. Note that not all of the floors have renovated rooms. The room was beautiful, as was the bathroom, but another thing to note is that apparently only the suites have tubs. My parents were in another room and when they requested a room with a tub, they were told there were only showers. We had access to and used the lounge. Although nice, it was not as great as some of the other Renaissance or Marriott lounges we had been too. It was in need of a bit of a renovation, but again, service was nice. My husband used the spa and thoroughly enjoyed his massage. We checked out the pool, which was nice as well. The spa, pool and gym are all shared with the Grand Hyatt. Location is about 5-7 minutes from the MTR. We used it regularly, so it was nice to have the station so close by. The only complaint was that the rooms are not wired for wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rexetersg
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this Renaissance. It provided everything one would expect of a business hotel in Hong Kong and some fun as well. The rooms were clean and well-maintained, though a bit small which is par for the course in HK. In the evenings, the lobby area had live music and a small but fun crowd. The gym was quite spacious and well-equipped. The location was both a plus and minus. It is right on the harbor so the views from the executive lounge were panoramic and beautiful. The ferry to Kowloon is across the street and thus quite convenient. However, this hotel is a little removed from the central business area so restaurants and shops are not very close by and thus the food options are limited. If you have a lot of meetings in HK, it might be better to pick a more centrally located hotel, otherwise you will find yourself in a cab much of the day. R

Reviews.Title: “Great harbour views”
Reviews.Author: JANEANDCHRIS
Reviews.Content: Try and get a harbour view room as they are well worth it. Stunning views acroos Victoria Harbour across to Kowloon through floor to ceiling windows. Very comfortable rooms. Interesting entertainment in the bar! Two singers every night. Not much atmosphere as bar was part of the lobby. Good location, walkable to bars and restaurants and close to MRT and Star Ferry. Recommend using the Big Bus Tours.

Reviews.Title: “NICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: nairajay10
Reviews.Content: Ok, honestly when I read some of the reviews I was a bit skeptical to stay here but a good deal so me booking in this hotel for two nights and I am glad to say I was not disappointed. The hotel is walking distance from the Wanchai MRT station all you have to do is follow the signs and walk over a covered walkway right into the hotel.We got the garden view so could'nt see the harbour but still it was nice. The pool allthough shared with the Hyatt was not crowded and was clean though they could heat the water a bit.The room was big and clean.The staff at the front desk were good too.On our way back it's a short walk to Gloucester road and then the A11-12 bus stop and your back at the airport at ease.The hotel is close to Wanchai/Causeway bay which are good places to hang out specially if you want to check the night scene

Reviews.Title: “Always Great!”
Reviews.Author: CheerfulChickie
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I've stayed at this hotel. I stayed here for western New Years in 2009 and again the week after New Years in 2010. The location is fabulous for bouncing back and forth between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The Star Ferry is across the street from the hotel. Taking the ferry to Kowloon is much cheaper than a taxi. There's also restaurants, bars, and stores that are connected via walkways to the hotel. Sometimes I just wanted to relax and get a bite close by and do a little shopping at the nearby shops. For big shopping, Kowloon is definitely the best. The hotel also has a desk in the lobby area that you can look-up daily tours to the various Hong Kong island, mainland China, and Macau, which I really liked. I like to sign up for tours as I go. The Hotel is also attached to the Hong Kong Convention Center, but unless you're part of the convention there was no reason to really go there. As far as rooms, they're a decent size, a bit smaller than Marriott rooms in the US, but still nice considering the limited space in Hong Kong. The gym is located in the Hyatt hotel next door, which is connected via walkways (a bit of a walk to get there). But the gym facilities were great. I didn't use the gym during my first stay at the hotel but I made a point to use it daily during my second stay to balance out the great food I was eating in Hong Kong. If you're a Marriott rewards Gold/Platinum member, you also get free drinks and happy hr food in the top floor loung which has a spectacular view of Victoria Harbor. Beautiful and breathtaking! I would definitely stay at this hotel again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, on the Harbor with fine views”
Reviews.Author: NickBeaufortSC
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel and a fair price ( less than $200 per night). We enjoyed it, service was top notch, the room was just right, clean and modern. As good as any but the very finest luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad option”
Reviews.Author: missduhr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times in total as I accompanied my partner who was there on business trips. Each time we stayed in a different room. If you're able to book a Harbour View Room, then you'll be treated to a wonderful view of the Kowloon skyline and harbour which is especially gorgeous at night. This room is also bigger and looks newer. I've also stayed in a Garden View room (read: no view, only of the buildings facing the hotel) and Partial Harbour View rooms (you'll see part of the harbour but not much of the skyline). These rooms are smaller but still comfortable. There's enough space for your suitcase and to walk around in. Check-in is very efficient and friendly even though our last visit was during the HK Rugby 7s and the hotel was fully booked and busybusybusy! The rooms and bathrooms are clean but definitely showing their age. Beds are king size and comfy to sleep on, pillows are super soft but they do provide foam pillows on request. Location-wise, it's about an easy 5 minute walk to the Wan Chai MTR on an overpass. I found it pretty convenient and safe. The hotel is located between Causeway Bay and Central which met all my needs - all I did was eat and shop and there are plenty of places to do that in these areas. For convenience I would recommend visitors to HK buy an Octopus card which can be used on the trains, ferries, trams and buses. Saves you from queueing up to buy a single trip ticket every time! The Star Ferry terminal is across from the hotel and you can take a ferry across to Kowloon. I would also recommend a bus ride up to The Peak which is a relaxing and fun way to see some of the quieter parts of HK. Only costs HK$9.60. This hotel has a corporate feel and I would classify it as a business hotel. If you can find a cheap rate, it is a perfectly acceptable hotel to stay in for leisure. Nicer, mid-to-high range hotels in HK are not cheap, but at this price range, I think it is possible to find a newer and better hotel on Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service with much care!”
Reviews.Author: Angelina-bunny
Reviews.Content: Me and my BF stayed there during the CNY break. The location is quite good as it's next to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. The staff are great-they sent us a lovely cake on my BF's birthday and that impressed me.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: awaydaydiva
Reviews.Content: very convenient for the Star Ferry and underground station, in fact everything. The rooms are nice, food a bit expensive but to be fair that's usual for 4* hotels. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “The best view I ever had”
Reviews.Author: mukherjeek
Reviews.Content: Stay was excellent - staff very friendly and helpful - most of them knew English, (which is a blessing in China)! The view of the Victoria harbour from the high floor was absolutely fantastic . The business centre faciliuties too were professional - I enjoyed every moment of my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly willing to help employees and a great view”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby1957
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an easy walk from the MTR subway system, via an overhead covered walkway. Also a short walk to the Star Ferry pier. The employees were always willing to help out with any touring questions and advise. The room we had was small, but the view of the Harbour was great, able to watch the nightly laser show. We had access to the club level and the continental breakfast and afternoon treats and drinks were a real plus. We'd stay here again!! Had dinner in the Chinese restaurant, it was good but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: gingerwife
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Renaissance for 3 nights, and were pleased with the spacious, clean room, excellent service and amazing harbour views (check out the 8pm light show - unbelievable!). We had access to the Club floors for a small supplement, and it was well worth it for the delicious breakfast, complimentary evening cocktails and afternoon tea. We also used the outdoor pool during our stay which was large, clean and again had great surrounding views. Only negative about the hotel was its location - the adjoining exhibition centre closes in the evening along with most of the shops and restaurants (and there isn't much there to start with). The immediate surroundings feel a little bleak and lifeless, so I would recommend heading to the Times Square area for dinner (we ate at the Red Pepper restaurant, for authentic szechaun food at a good price). The hotel was conveniently close to the Metro station, which was just a couple of stops from Kowloon for shopping, and from the heart of the business district for everything else (including the Peak Tram). The concierge was very helpful with all our requests. Overall, a great hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ansh97
Reviews.Content: The location is superb and the rooms are nice, very nice. The views are legendary and definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, outstanding view”
Reviews.Author: blakkkobera
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while attending a fair at the Hong Kong Convention Centre. The location of this hotel is perfect for anyone visiting the dozens of fairs that take place every year at this centre. The hotel lobby connects directly to the centre, allowing one to get to the fair in 2 minutes without stepping outside. Earlier I used to stay in Kowloon, and the trip would take 20-25 minutes. The other big plus is the amazing view of the Harbour--insist on a harbour facing room-its well worth it-one can see the entire stretch of Kowloon, and some partsof Hong Kong, with the beautiful harbour in between. At night, the view is even more spectacular, with the skyscrapers on both sides fully lit up, providing an amazing backdrop to the boats passing by. Though I didn't use the facilities, I could see two lush tennis courts and an immaculately maintained large outdoor kids play area from my floor. Service was the usual Hong Kong standard--super efficient but not exactly friendly. Stay here if you're here on business, and have work mainly in the convention centre, or in the Hong Kong side--you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: TVTVTV
Reviews.Content: Plush room, efficient service and good location makes this hotel a winner in my views.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: headintheclouds13
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't deserve the stars it has been given. The hotel is in serious need of an update. I heard there were some newer rooms but I stayed in an older room. The check in and check out takes forever. There was always a long wait at reception and to get in a lift. There was an awful (sewage like) smell in the lobby of the hotel that remained for the duration of my stay, which was one week. The rooms are seriously outdated and shabby. The beds are so hard- you may as well be sleeping on a brick wall. The smell in my room was unbearable- it was a combination of mould, decaying animal masked with room deodoriser. It was unbearable. I went to the effort to purchase a scented candle to mask the odour, but in fact it made it much worse. The hotel is attached to the conference centre- which is good if you are doing business there and it is also right by the ferry terminal. Those are the only redeeming qualities I was able to find in this place. It really was a miserable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: yfuwong
Reviews.Content: Good location, can easily reach here by Airport express and some walk. Room is expensive and small as usual in HK, but looks great inside with big flat screen tv and all other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: bajan-chic
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a great location, breakfast is fabulous...keeps you full until late afternoon. We spent new years here...really nice view. Room was not renovated but was still nice. Did not spend so much time in the hotel so no idea about the other dining options

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts”
Reviews.Author: qb76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Renaissance when we went to HK to welcome the Twenty10. High points: Location, reasonable service, very helpful reception staff & extremely knowledgeable concierge. Downside: I would say a bit over price, even newly furbished rooms seems old, size of rooms are not good for a family of 4 though we booked a deluxe room. But overall we liked the convenience bit in terms of public transport availability. Would like to stay again but depends on the pricing.

Reviews.Title: “hotel fine. Location not great”
Reviews.Author: probativev
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business last November and was here for one night last week for leisure travel. The load down: Pros: 1. LOVE the outdoor swimming pool which they share with the Hyatt next door. It's too cold to use now but in the summer it is awesome. They say they close it at sunset but there were people coming to use it even when it finally turned dark. I don't think they really close it until later in the night. The waiters and waitresses working poolside were really friendly and helpful. 2. Services are generally first rate. Cons: 1. The location IMO is inconvenient. 10 mins walk to MTR is a long walk for HK, and it is to one of the most crowded, busiest, and confusing MTR stations. Not a good place if you are on business and always in a rush. You'll have to taxi everywhere, but if it rains, the taxi line will be very long and you're stuck with the MTR mess or stuck in taxi line. 2. Not thrilled with the breakfast buffet. Food tasted just so so. 3. Rooms are very small, although most HK hotels have small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with STUNNING views of the Victoria Harbor, and priced accordingly.”
Reviews.Author: GOPBI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night (January 5, 2010) as this is our designated crew hotel for all layovers while in Hong Kong. This hotel also hosts crews from several European airlines. This hotels’ single biggest asset is its’ location... It’s about a seven (7) minute walk or less to the Wan Chai Pier where you can board the famous Star Ferry. From the Wan Chai pier you can reach either the Tsim Sha Tsui pier or the Hung Hom pier- both on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. Located just in from of the hotel, directly on the waterfront, is the Hong Kong Convention and Expo Center. For longer distances there is several private bus lines that operate from a nearby terminal. You can also access the city-wide subway system, MTR, from the nearby Wan Chai station on the Island Line. You can make connection from the Island line to either the Tsuen Wan or Tsuen Kawn O lines. The Airport Express train starts at the Hong Kong station, about a 10 minute or less taxi ride from the hotel. The Hong Kong station has airline check-in counters for most airlines. Passengers with confirmed airline tickets can check-in, deposit baggage and receive boarding passes from their respective carriers- all before boarding the airport express train. Lobby / Check-in: This is a busy hotel and you’ll notice that upon entering. The check-in area is on the second floor- a short escalator ride up. There are multiple desks and a few desks reserved exclusively for Marriott (the parent company of Renaissance Hotels) Rewards elite members. The lobby itself is rather small and quite busy, but still very well designed and efficient. On the opposite side of the check-in level is a waiting lounge and bar. As normal, since our rooms are pre-paid and pre-assigned, our check-in consists only of room key card distribution. Room: My room was on the 25th floor and faced the water, which meant EXCELLENT views of the Harbor and Kowloon Island. The room itself looked a bit on the small side of average, but didn’t “feel” small. Everything was well laid out to maximize space. It was equipped with a small writing desk, with multi-power and phone line ports. Wi-fi is available with charge, hotel-wide. The TV was an older tube-style with local and international multi-language programming. My bed was an American-sized Queen and was of moderate firmness- a nice surprise as Asian beds tend to run substantially on the firm side of the spectrum. The bed was topped with a faux-feather duvet and multiple (foam) pillows. The room is quite bright as the windows are nearly floor to ceiling and given the absolutely stunning views- this is a *huge* plus. The drapes are not “black out” so if you’re sensitive to light when sleeping, you may have difficulties during post-sunrise hours. The windows are tinted and very well sound insulated. Additional room amenities included a stocked mini-bar (at typical high hotel rates) and a stocked complimentary coffee/tea/hot water serviette. In the closet was a mini-ironing board and attached iron. I found myself lying in bed relaxing and just watching the harbor traffic go floating by. Bathroom: Like the bedroom, the bathroom was noticeable smaller than other hotels in the same class, but very function in all aspects. It has a stand-up shower with very hot water and excellent water pressure. A decent selection of Marriott-branded pre and post bath toiletries are provided for daily use. There was a wall mounted hair dryer. Everything in my room was clean and in functional order. I didn’t notice any obvious signs of excessive ‘wear and tear’. Hotel facilities and Amenities: The hotel has one lounge located on the lobby level that serves light food and drink. There are also three sit-down restaurants; one Chinese and one Italian venue- both open for lunch and dinner only. The café which offers “international” cuisine is open for all three sittings. Of course, a full menu of in-room dining (room service) options is available 24 hrs- at typically high prices. While the hotel has a decent selection of dining alternatives, given the fact that Hong Kong is one of the best cities *in the world* for food aficionados , I’d highly suggest that you explore the surrounding areas as there is a great many excellent and reasonably priced options nearby. The hotel has a nice outdoor seasonally heated pool, located on the top of the main lobby building. The pool area includes attached hot tubs and numerous sun chairs and sitting areas. You can order light food and drink poolside. The hotel also has a rather basic gym (not 24/7) with a fair selection of exercise equipment and free weights. Personal training is available at extra charge and with prior appointment. The business center offers most all services you would need like copy/fax/printing/translation/computer use and rental- at posted rates. They will also arrange for pick-up and acceptance of your UPS, DHL and FedEx packages upon request. The hotel can also arrange for things like non-emergency medical attention, child care and onward travel arrangements- upon request with the Front Desk staff. There is also a by-invitation-only lounge, with great views of the harbor and free light refreshments. It is for use by Marriott top tier members and guests staying in higher level rooms. SUMMARY: PROS: 1) Location- you’re in the middle of it all and have excellent local transportation options- within walking or short taxi ride- to further explore the surrounding areas. 2) Views from guest rooms- you’ll have some of the best views of Victoria Harbor. CONS: 1) Price point-- there are other hotels in the immediate area that are just as convenient in terms of transportation options as the Renaissance, but at lower prices. 2) Rooms tend to be run on the smaller side of average.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, Costly WiFi Access, Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Crumpled
Reviews.Content: Why is it you can stay in a 2-Star hotel in HK or China and not pay for WiFi access, but at the more expensive hotels they charge an extra ~$12 a day? When I asked about this at the front desk or the Renaissance, the person I was spoke with referred me to a manager and he was very indifferent and arrogant about the issue. My point was that the room rate should have covered some WiFi access, even if only in the lobby (as with many hotels in China). The room I stayed in was not updated, smelled strongly of chemicals (in fact the entire hallway had a chemical odor), and the front desk staff was the most unfriendly I've dealt with in China - a 10-day business trip staying in large and small hotels. The pool area was quite nice and a pleasant break from the noise and hustle & bustle of HK. The lobby bar is kind of fun for drinks and cheesy music.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel that is also good for leisure; just note that front desk people here act like shrewd businessmen”
Reviews.Author: goldentiger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is large and nice. Location next to the convention center makes this a primarily business hotel, but we chose this hotel for holiday/leisure travel because they had a promo rate and the location is ideal for shopping, with Causeway Bay just one MTR stop away and Tsim Sha Tsui just across the harbor via Star Ferry. Accommodation is very nice, and the views facing the harbor are really good. Our group occupied two rooms and one of the rooms had a slight tobacco smell, although we were supposed to be in nonsmoking rooms. The smell can only be detected when first entering the room, after which we either get used to it after a few seconds or the smell dissipates after one opens the door. This is a primarily business hotel, and the front desk act like they're businessmen! I got a promotional rate and it was really good value. I booked garden view rooms only though. However, while checking in, the hotel staff was trying to convince me to upgrade our rooms to a suite telling me they also have a promo and it's a really good deal with free breakfast and nice harbor views. But the rates of the suite she wants us to get was HK$1,000 (about US$130) more per room per night! I insisted on the original booking and they upgraded us to a renovated room with a harbor view. Perhaps the hotel probably overbooked the cheaper rooms, that's why there's this sales pitch! But the most unexpected experience I had with this hotel is when we checked out. When I got my credit card charge slip, the cashier told me "we charge in Hong Kong dollars." And said briefly, "this is the equivalent amount in your base currency." So I proceeded to sign the slip. After reviewing the slip again, I noticed the note in the slip that says I had been given a choice of currencies for payment (which in this case I wasn't) and that currency conversion is not provided by VISA. I inquired why this is so. It turns out that the first cashier charged me in US$ using the hotel exchange rate of US$1=HK$7.49, while it usually is around US$1=HK$7.7 in most places. Not only did the first cashier not notify me regarding the exchange rate but he gave me the wrong impression that they charged in HK$! Another cashier reversed the charge and gave me another slip with just the HK$ amount without the US$ note. Good thing I noticed this and this was taken care of. The hotel would've charged us around US$20.00 more due to the exchange rate. I just wasn't very happy with this incident that something like this could happen in a reputable chain like the Marriott. This is what is written in their credit card charge slip. It does create the impression that one is really paying in HK$ which is not the case. The USD amount is not that prominent and the rate is written in HK$1 = US$0.1335 instead of the more usual US$1 = HK$7.49. HKD X,XXX.XX ============ RATE: 0.1335 NO CommissionFee BASE AMT (TXN CUR): USD XXX.XX I declare that I have been offered a choice of payment currencies and my choice is final. I understand that the currency conversion is not provided by VISA. My rating for this hotel would've been 5 if not for this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: woodtiger
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here en route to China. It is really easy for the Star Ferry to Zhuhai, which was our reason for staying here. There is a free shuttle bus. The room was clean, spacious and very nice. I like the Marriott bath products, and this was the same as any other Renaissance. I have stayed here, the HK Island Renaissance and in Beijing. This is far better that the HK island Renaissance, and on a par with the Beijing hotel. Check in staff were friendly and helpful. We ate in the hotel restaurant, which was fine, although a huge restaurant and completely empty at 8pm. I guess most people will go out in HK, but after a long flight and with a busy day to follow, I just wanted an easy, quiet night, which is what we got. Very nice hotel and would stay in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located on Hong Kong Island just minutes away from the Star Ferry. Check-in is on the second floor, it was fast and friendly. My room was on the 26th floor and had a partial harbour view. Room was small and compact. Large double bed, sofa, nice TV with limited English channels. Mini bar which I did not use. Bathroom clean, except for some mold around the bath tub. The room is done in dark woods and glass, very appealing. Huge windows to look out at the harbour and traffic below.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you have renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Tk100964
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at the Renaissance : once in an old ran down room which was really old and once in a renovated, comfy, elegant room. Make sure they don't put you in one of the old rooms. They are usually on the highest floors and they told me at the check in "we upgraded you to the executive level". Which actually means "we gave you an old room". As Marriott gold member, I have access to the exec lounge on the top floor which is great. Fantastic views, good drinks, great breakfast. Also the location is great with the ferry to Kowloon in front of the hotel and topclass nightlife in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: HenryZh
Reviews.Content: Nothing more to elaborate, average stay but good location and view.

Reviews.Title: “night parking”
Reviews.Author: Myhits
Reviews.Content: Stay with good connections. Hope the room from seaside. Find the General Manager of hotel from Handle bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Destinie W
Reviews.Content: We stay for 4 nights from 6 November, 2009, overall satisfied with this hotel. View of our room was excellent, nice! Staffs are friendly and informative. The location was convenience to Star Ferry Terminal, MTR station, and lots of local cafe and restaurant. Value money to stay, may return to stay in future!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Central location”
Reviews.Author: RH_Travellors
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and had a very good room. Arranged for car service from the airport which was well organized and room was clean and modern. I didn't have the harbour view side of the hotel (guess that's why we get a good corporate rate) but I felt that everything was high quality in the rooms in terms of comfort and facilities. Staff were helpful at check in and breakfast buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Leighandnigel7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in October 09 and would certainly go back. It's good value for Hong Kong and in a great central position. We got an upgrade to larger room (16th floor) and to include breakfast for the equivalent of arounf £40 which was well worth it. Breakfast is good, but we didn't eat in the hotel other than that. The pool area is lovely, an oasis in the middle of the city. The staff are efficient, although not over friendly. The best thing about the hotel is the locatiom, you never have to wait more than a minute for a taxi, the Star Ferry is a short walk and the nearest MTR station about 7 minutes walk. A good hotel which I can happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, but crumbling hardware”
Reviews.Author: victorsh
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with my girlfriend at this hotel. We got one of the harborview rooms, and the view is amazing. But the toilet had problems and overflowed. They clearly need to fix this place up.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel met all Expectations”
Reviews.Author: JohnMargaretG
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Australia at dusk and took the shuttle bus to the Renaissance Harbour View Hotel on Hong Kong Island. We chose this hotel because it was overlooking the harbour and close to all transport. We asked for a harbour view room on a high floor in expectation of a quite room and a good view. We were not disappointed. We were shown to our room and when the curtains were pulled aside, a most magnificent view from the 32nd Floor was to be had. The view was a 180 degree view of a busy working Victoria Harbour. The room service was superb, staff were friendly and informative. No problems with language barriers. The room was roomy, clean with a kingsize bed. The buffet was international class and food to die for. The pool on the 11th floor, reportedly to be the largest in Hong Kong was delightful after sightseeing on hot days. This hotel was 4 to five star quality and probably a little more than we wanted to pay but the service, views, and central location were well worth it John & Margaret Grieves Queensland Australia

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Great View, Easy Access”
Reviews.Author: SameerBadruddin
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the Railway Station, very clean, n friendly staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great and beautiful Hotal”
Reviews.Author: ChristianM1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located almoast just a jump from the beach right beside the beautiful Convention Centre and is very beautiful in it´s interior design! I specially recomend the buffet "specially the breakfast buffet" in the Hotel. The choices and variations of food are the best I have ever seen compering to hunderets of hotels I´ve been to!! Oh and before I forget to mention. Huge Huge nice outdoor swimmingpool. Well. What more can I say then Great Hotel, Best Location, Beautiful Rooms and best food ever!!! Get there and just enjoe! Greets Chris

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clueless but nice receptionist and do ask for renovated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: icequeenvic
Reviews.Content: Good location - just 3 mins walk from the Star Ferry Terminal and 7 mins walk from the Wan Chai MTR station by cutting through several buildings via pedestrian bridges. Clueless but nice receptionist who could not figure out the final cost of my booking through Marriott Reward Points but was nice enough to offer extra bed for the 3rd person at no additional charges. Although we were very happy with the room (posh, clean & newly renovated - do request for a renovated room), but it was facing the garden (renovated rooms with harbour view were fully occupied!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Norie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sisters and our children. My room overlooked the harbor so we did not have to go outside or pay for the symphony of lights. We saw everything from the convenience of our room. This is in the same complex as the convention center. It is in the heart of town so everything is within a walking distance. A mall is in the same building. A wide range of restaurants to choose from and a grocery store - all within walking distance. A short walk to the metro. A short walk to the pier. The lobby is typical streamlined Renaissance, very contemporary. The beds are very small though, not even a full bed, (two beds in a room.) I believe this is common in Asia. Most hotels in Asia I have been to have smaller double beds (with the exception of Renaissance Beijing, which are the same size as those in the U.S.) Lovely pool, just like a garden. The garden/pool area has a restaurant that offers buffet lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay”
Reviews.Author: Natasha98
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time. Its a nice central local. The room we had the last time was a small odd shaped end room tho. The room on our previous visit was larger. But otherwise it was quite adequate. Its a big international chain with just a room and your up on the 12 floor etc with no opening windows and just aritical AC thing going on. Not what we really like but if your going to HK well thats all you can get. We are happy to stay there again tho due to the location. The staff are just like any other large chain. There was an event on when we visited so we decided to go with the garden view this time (due to escalated cost). I recall we had a harbour view room last time

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, superb views, awesome amenities”
Reviews.Author: ChiTheCynic
Reviews.Content: On previous visits to Hong Kong, I'd always erred on the side of value for money rather than luxury, but with some Marriott points at my disposal I decided to spend 10 days at the Renaissance Harbour View Hotel - and I was not disappointed! Hong Kong knows how to do customer service, and from the moment I arrived I was treated like a star. My luggage was taken from me the moment I got out of the taxi, the check-in was simple, and I was provided with complimentary refreshments within an hour of arriving. The room looked out over the harbour, which as any visitor to Hong Kong will know is a fantastic vista. I had access to the executive lounge where there were free drinks, food and snacks served all day long. The swimming pool overlooking the exhibition centre was a delight, and the comfort and elegance of my room was outstanding. As for location, you can't get more central than the Harbour View, meaning that the whole of Hong Kong is literally at your feet. Take my advice, if you're going to Hong Kong for the first time, spoil yourself and experience true customer service at this luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JoshesBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on business and my main gripe is that the room appeared ok but smelt quite damp. If I could have been bothered, i.e. if it hadn't been late and I could have motivated myself I really should have asked to change rooms. I've never asked to change rooms before but this is most definitely the closest I have come. Breakfast buffet was ok, albeit quite expensive and it was pretty hard to get waiting staff to provide top-ups etc which was pretty poor considering how quiet it was even at 7:30 am. given this hotel is near our office it was a no-brainer to use but nonetheless it's not somewhere I would rush back to given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the warm friendly feeling”
Reviews.Author: foreignerInSZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Feb with my wife, I'm a platinum card member so I get a lot of freebies like free room upgrade and a gift package on arrival. That was nice but just part of the hotel policy, nothing warm about it. Maybe its because this place is bigger and holds 1000s of customers each day that you do not get the warm and friendly hotel service as you normally would with this chain. The views are fantastic, facilities are top notch however the room is a bit antiquated. I didn't even get a plasma TV and the room was a tad small even after the upgrade. Overall experience was good and I would recommend it for other travellers, just don't be expecting warm friendly service... its quite cold and you feel like your just another customer and passer by. Most memorable: The executive lounge and harbour view is excellent. Great service and there I do get reminded of why I continue to use this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Exhibition Heaven”
Reviews.Author: L0unger
Reviews.Content: If you ever need to attend an exhibition at the Hong Kong Convention & Exhiition Centre, then this the place to stay. The exhiition centre is attached to the hotel and is an approximately two minute walk located through a walkway within the same building. The hotel is reasonaly priced and the rooms look exactly as the pictures depict. .I was given a room in the newly refurished lower floor and I must say it was surprisingly spacious (room enough for a two seater plus small round tale at the foot of the bed) and beautifully decorated in that luxury minimalist decor that Far Eastern hotels do so well. The lighting was superb, especially the reading lights which were spotlights located overhead none of that fiddling and trying to adjust side lamps. Excellent amenities , flat screen t.V etc. The only downside was the bed, which was not as comfortable as one might have expected. the mattress being rather hard and lumpy. However everything else was tip top. The staff were very friendly and helpful and one was albe to get a Visa to China within the hotel premises which was speedily delivered to my room wihin 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and wonderful service made this a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KimKDallas
Reviews.Content: As long time Marriott business travelers, we chose to stay at the Renaissance Harbor View Hong Kong rather than one of the more local / regional hotels while in Hong Kong. It was definitely nice to have a familiar feeling hotel to come back to at the end of the day. The Renaissance Harbor View is on Hong Kong Island overlooking Victoria Harbor and Kowloon (the part of Hong Kong that's actually attached to mainland China). The staff there was wonderful, and gave us a great (upgraded) room with a view of the harbor. Even bigger surprise was the fact that the room was on the corner of the building on the 30th floor -- so not only did we get to see the Kowloon skyline across the harbor, we could see a portion of the skyline on Hong Kong Island as well. Each of the skyscrapers seemed to outdo the one before --- views were breathtaking day or night. I don't think we closed the drapes the entire time! Rooms Beds were decently comfy (although a little hard) and the temp was easy to control in the room. Room had 2 standard sized twin beds. Bottled water and fresh fruit were provided in the room. Bathrooms were really nice – marble – with separate tub and shower. The junior suite also had a separate ½ bath in the living area which made getting ready in the morning go a little quicker. Slippers, robes, safes, hair dryers and ironing boards were provided in the room. In room coffee was ok, although like much of Asia it was instant. 2-3 kinds of tea were also available. Concierge Lounge We were given access to the Executive Lounge on the 40th Floor. Staff service there was wonderful, regardless of time of day. There were coffee, tea, sodas and water available from 6am to midnight. Daily continental breakfast was available M-F from 6-10am and 6-11 on weekends and holidays. In addition to breads, cereals and fruits, there were a couple of hot options available each day including boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. Breakfast was excellent and the coffee was really good! Afternoon tea was available from 3-5. Complementary cocktails and hors d’oeuvres were served from 5:30 to 7:30 pm. In some hotels, the evening snacks could serve as a substitute for dinner --- this was not one of those places. Options were good, but fairly light. Each night carried a different theme, but generally, the hot items gave you the option to try fairly local dishes. Alcohol was available at other times, but was billed to the room, Free Wi-Fi, as well as a computer that you could use were also available in the lounge, The staff there was also able to take care of our checkout. The lounge was fairly quiet regardless of time of day and had great sunset views. Lobby Bar On our first night, we needed a light meal despite the fact that it was fairly late. We stopped in at the lobby bar. They had a selection of appetizers to choose from. Food was excellent, and reasonable considering the hotel / location. Each night, there is live music in the lounge. It’s a great place to watch people and relax after a long day. Transportation From the hotel, you can access the Wan Chai MTR station by covered walkways which is really nice when traffic is heavy or when it’s raining. It’s also a short <5 min walk to the Wan Chai pier for the Star Ferry. What turned out to be the best tip I found on TA was using the Airport Express Tourist Card. There is a counter as you exit baggage claim in the airport where you can purchase the cards using cash or credit card. For $300HK / person, you get a roundtrip ticket on the Airport Express train, shuttle service from the main stations to several of the big hotels in Kowloon and on HK Island, ability to use in-town check-in (more on that later) and 3 days of unlimited MTR (subway) usage. The airport train is very clean, leaves frequently (every 12 min) and is accessed right from the terminal. The trip is about 25 minutes to HK station. If you take the Airport Express in from the Airport, the H1 Shuttle bus provided by airport express will take you directly to the Renaissance. The shuttle runs on a schedule about every 20 minutes and will get you back to the Airport Express Train when you leave as well. Note – you will need your Oyster card pass to enter and exit most stations. $50HK of the ticket is refundable if you return the card when you leave. http://www.mtr.com.hk/eng/airport_express/aepass_index.html Area There are lots of little restaurants, pubs, 7-11, drugstores, bookstores, etc. within walking distance. You should be able to find what you want fairly easily without paying hotel prices. A walk around the convention center in front of the hotel offers some great views of the city / waterfront and felt safe – even at night. Service Overall, service was top notch. Everyone you saw spoke to you and was very friendly. We were always greeted with a smile. English was common in the hotel. Housekeeping was great, and kept us stocked with bottled water and fresh fruit. Room was serviced twice a day. We were walked to our room by someone at the front desk when we checked in. Pool There is a really nice pool area between the Renaissance and the Hyatt next door. However, might be a little noisy during the day due to some construction going on around the convention center. Hotel was a great choice. Marriott property was a little more in the financial district, but not on the waterfront. The new Courtyard property is a little closer to the waterfront --- but a little farther from things. The Renaissance was a great choice based on location, view and ease of getting around. I’d definitely go back when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RatpackScotland
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived the staff could not have been more helpful and after a long trip from the UK this was much appreciated. The rooms were clean, comfortable and great value for money. The food was great and service fantastic. The location of the hotel is very central and good position for exploring Hong Kong. would highly recommend this hotel, one of the best Renaissance hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good View of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Pushkarwagh
Reviews.Content: Good view, great service. Nice and clean and comfortable too after a long day at office. Located right in the business district and just next to the commercial center - one can save time to reach any destination. For leisure - just take the ferry across the harbour and reach right in the middle of the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LKW9
Reviews.Content: It was a delight to stay here from start to finish on our stopover. My beautiful room had just been refurbished (20th floor if you are going in the near future) and had tremendous harbour views. Service and staff all great, and the room rate was excellent too. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Musty.”
Reviews.Author: LiangShanBo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed on the 21st floor and my main impression was: "musty." It just had this musty smell - the floor and the actual room. It seems like it is due for renovation. TV set was really old (I was surprised it even had a remote control and didn't require the manual turning of knob to change channels). Location is great as it is attached to the expo center in Wanchai and very close to Central. I previously stayed at the Hyatt, which is also attached to the expo center and it was significantly nicer. This place is probably half the price though. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SampleTheCulture
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on multiple occasions and I will continue to on my future visits. The hotel has undergone some recent renovations which give it a very new feel. The lobby is common with what you expect from a Renaissance but since its in Hong Kong, and space is a premium, the rooms are a bit on the tiny. The views are awesome pretty much from any room and it has a great pool and fitness center. The location is in walking distance from the subway as well as the Star Ferry, which will take you to Kowloon if you wish. If you are attending an event at the convention center you are connected to it. My only complaint, internet costs you 15 USD for 24 hours. I am all for free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Fair Service, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for the third time...Not sure if I'll go back or not. It's not a bad hotel by any means, but there are so many others in HK that I prefer to this one. The hotel has a very big 2-story lobby which is connected to the HK Convention Centre, which is the biggest plus for this hotel (if you're in HK for an event there, as I was). I was given a 'recently remodeled' (according to the clerk) room...Fairly nice, but nothing special, typical small HK room, furnishings seemed new (the flat-screen TV was nice) but not what I'd call luxurious. Bathroom had a stand-alone shower, no tub. Bed was comfortable. I was also 'upgraded' to a harbor view room, but on the 19th floor...It overlooked construction workers who are adding on to the convention centre. To see the harbor, I had to look very sharply to the right...But I didn't pay for a harbor-view room, so I have nothing to complain about. Breakfast and dinner buffets are fair, not great...I felt like I was taken for a ride for HK$350 (US$45ish) for their dinner buffet, which was very lacking compared to others in town. For the money, try another HK hotel unless you're in town for something at the HK Convention Centre. Not a lot of shopping or other visitor-friendly businesses nearby, but I'm used to staying in Causeway Bay which offers SO much more. To summarize, this is an okay hotel...Certainly not bad, but not among the best in Marriott's Renaissance nameplate. Great for the convention centre and the Star Ferry, but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Older rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie042
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a like an airport, hundreds checking in and out eveyr few hours. older rooms, small; understandable for hkg but needing a renovation. great location. It s a no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KevinLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through an agent, great hotel and great location on Hong Kong Island, ask for a room overlooking the harbour fantastic views of Kowloon. The rooms are a little smaller than usual but you are on HK we stayed on the 33rd floor, we also had breakfast as part of the package which was good, the pool area on the 11th floor is fantastic. There is some work going on in the conference centre but this did not impact on our stay. All the staff are friendly and very efficient. Use the walkway from the reception and that takes you behind the hotel where the shops and bars are, a tram runs along to "central" about 5/8 minutes to where all the shops attractions are including the wonderful central-mid level escalator, take this to the top and watch the world go by, be careful it is a long walk down! The tram fair is a 2HK dollar coin exact (about 20p) Two other great areas here are Lan Kwai Fong and SoHo great bars and restaurants just take time to enjoy the vibe. About two minutes from the hotel is the star ferry to Kowloon this costs 2.20HKD (22p) each way, the ferries are quick and frequent. We did not use the underground as we had no need (we walked!).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey2Kingston
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect from this hotel after reading mixed reviews. But we were pleasantly surprised to find that his hotel was fantastic. The views from the hotel were amazing, overlooking Kowloon harbour, we were situated on the 34th floor. Rooms were very clean and spacious. There is construction work going on in front of the hotel at the conference centre, however we did not hear any noise at all. I would ignore some of the reviews that have been published on here and the noise is very minimal. Just to be on the safe side I would request a high floor room. The hotel offers a friendly and welcoming service. The fitness centre is very good. The location is fantastic. The star ferry is just next door which makes it easy to visit Kowloon. Taxis are very cheap, food is fairly expensive, and drink is very highly priced. 2 vodkas and coke will set you back anywhere between 10 and 15 pounds. I would definitely recommend visiting Stanley market and there are some bargain to be had! Clothes, accessories, pictures etc. There is a light show every night at 8pm on the harbour, if you request a harbour view room you can see the light show from your room, otherwise I would recommend getting the star ferry across to Kowloon at this time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a great location and have amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel with fabulous view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghAnna
Reviews.Content: After a long flight this is a lovely hotel to arrive in. Reception were welcoming and helpful. The room was lovely with a stunning floor to ceiling view of the harbour. Everything was of a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterChris
