Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Hong Kong and we loved it!The hotel was excellent.The room was fantastic as it was on the top floor and the windows are huge!The room was tastefully decorated and very clean.We had access to the private top floor lounge with free drinks/snacks in the early evening.The drinks included champagne ( Moet ) and the memories of sipping champagne with the harhour views are long lasting.The hotel was very helpful on advise about trips and transport.I was recommended this hotel by a friend and it lived up to all my expectations.Maybe it was all the champagne but I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.We watch the New Years Eve fireworks whilst we were there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Watch the room type!”
Reviews.Author: ParkerBordeaux
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks on business. GREAT location - close to Wan Chai Ferry to Kowloon, close to the MTR. Hopewell Centre (at the end of Luard Rd) a 10 min walk away. Lots of stores, including a TASTE grocery store where you can pick-up snacks, etc... Room quality varies GREATLY. Try and get a lower floor (14-21) as these have been renovated. Older rooms are VERY dingy, run-down, and quite depressing. Hallway carpets threadbare, smelly. Smoking floors: 11, 21, 37. All other floors non-smoking, but this is not really enforced. First room they gave me (older room) smelled like a smokers' convention had just left. Harbor View rooms worth every penny but be prepared for street and construction noise. The hotel faces a busy artery that leads to the midtown tunnel. There is also a bus hub right across the street. Earplugs a must for sleeping. Garden view rooms quieter with nice views of the pool. Pluses: GREAT exercise / workout facilities, fantastic pool (50m heated outdoor, shared with Hyatt). New room decor & layout, room service (cheap, fast, and efficient), hotel lobby & lounge, hotel restaurant (GREAT breakfast buffet). Minuses: front desk staff - friendly, but barely literate in english. Well-meaning, but essentially clued-out. If you have any issues, immediately ask for a manager (not really a manager, but someone who actually understands english). No concierge so you're on your own for any trips. **Construction** The Convention Centre next door is undergoing a major expansion. Expect construction to last until at least May. Drilling noises 7 days/week from 8am until 6pm (10pm on weekends). Older rooms (higher floors) dingy, smelly, run-down.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, old rooms and more noise”
Reviews.Author: moobaby214
Reviews.Content: Just had a week at this hotel. Problems started at check inn. I am a platinum with Marriott and had requested two things. A renovated room + Harbour view I was given none. So I asked again and was given a Harbour view room on the 38Th floor. Once up here it was a old room not renovated. The room itself was OK bed was hard and no wireless had to use a cord. OK so here I am in HK wanting to sleep in forget it. Major construction going on for the convention center right outside the hotel. It starts early 630AM and goes to 8PM my guess it will last until late 2009. If you are a light sleeper or want to sleep in advise another hotel. The maids make more noise then any other hotel I have ever been at. Slamming doors, clanging things around, talking loud not what I would expect in HK. Workout area is "shared" with the Grand Hyatt which is next store. Overall not bad but very crowded. They need more stuff with two large hotels using the same gym. Not close have to walk outside it's over at the Hyatt. Club lounge on the 40TH floor is average. Breakfast was weak as was the night snack food. Hotel staff were nice they really do try here to make your stay a good one but they can't change the location relative to all the construction. I personally would not stay here again. No question you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “building work”
Reviews.Author: Byrne_8
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but building work going on from 7 in the morning untill 6 in the evening 7 days a week. Building site is also level with the swimming pool area

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain for a 4-star!”
Reviews.Author: mdns
Reviews.Content: Was at this hotel for a convention, so I didn't mind getting the older room and not facing the harbor for under US$200, as I wasn't going to spend too much time in the room other than for sleeping late at night. The older room was... old. The bed is OK, not too comfortable, not bad either. It was clean, and that was plenty enough for me. If I were to come back again and would know that I'd have more time to enjoy the room or the view, I'd probably would ask for harbor view and renovated room. Breakfast buffet was good, but for 3 mornings in a row, they didn't change the menu that much, so by 3rd day I was just eating, not really savoring. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa-MTML
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location. The room is a little small for the price, but great view. It clean and the staffs are attentive. The food was good. But more of the people in my previous group tour stayed in kowloon and seem to be alot more convinient. It's definitely a good hotel to stay for a romantic getaway, but too expensive for just checking out Hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Superb views from bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Eatmyshoes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past & the standard is always good. I love the location, you can get the star ferry right outside the hotel which is really convenient. The rooms are well kitted out & comfortable, especially on the business floor - see if you can get an upgrade. The views across the harbour from the bedrooms are magnificent & you can never get bored of watching the constant spectical that is HK Harbour. The hotel is a good business hotel & great base for exploring Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “standard 4 star hong kong hotel”
Reviews.Author: 180mis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights recently on a business trip to Hong Kong. Having previously stayed at the Grand Hyatt next door, i found this hotel to be below par. Yes its a 4 star hotel opposed to the Grand Hyatt being a 5 star; but the Renaissance doesnt live up to its name. As you enter the lobby it smells of cheap apple blossom perfume/cologne spray. I had a harbour view room on the 25th floor, which i found to be reasonably adequate in size. Had a view over the harbour primarily overlooking the star ferry terminal in wanchai. Good points: relatively good location; next to HK exhibition centre; Bad: service isnt up to standard; the lobby feels like a train station at times; lobby was being renovated and no notification of this was advised; food is VERY expensive for a 4 star hotel I dont think i will stay here again unless they renovate the rooms and improve their service.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Location with a Great View”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: Located in a complex that houses the Hyatt Hotel and the Hong Kong Convention Center, the Renaissance Harbor View has some on the most spectacular views in the city. I booked the four night stay through Marriott’s on line web site. Total price, with service charges, was 6,820.00 Hong Kong dollars for four nights. Service charges were 150HKD. The hotel is convenient to the Star Ferry terminal, (one of them), bus stops and about an hour’s cab ride from the airport. (Airport to hotel transportation varies from as little as $6 US for a bus to $55-65 US for a cab and the “hotel shuttle” service stops at this property and charges about $22 US. Another option is the airport train which costs about $15 US). Visitors should be aware that local cab drivers do not all speak or understand English and I found that many people in the city had never heard of this hotel. Bus drivers from the airport had no clue either. The easiest solution was to ask for the Hyatt or the Convention Center. On one occasion, I showed the mystified cabbie my room ketywhich has a photo of the hotel on it and that settled the problem. The facility is well kept and offers the expected Marriott levels of hospitality. Average per night cost for a single room was about $250 US with the weekdays being higher and weekend rates slightly lower. Room, bath and hotel facilities were as would be expected and there were no problems except that the hotel staff was unable to help me change another Marriott reservation at a San Francisco Airport Marriott that I had scheduled for my return to the states. The issue was finally resolved when a business center staff member used her personal cell phone to call the SFO Airport Marriott and cancel my reservation. This sort of extra attention was, I found, typical of the hotel. One small but important plus is the free bottled water in the room which was replaced every day. Marriott hotels often try to sell bottled water in the rooms at exorbitant prices, so it was good to have this available at no additional charge. I had not taken my laptop on this trip, but was pleased to find free internet service available in the Club Lounge and it worked well and was available up until 11PM. Although I do not usually use hotel restaurants, I had two dinners in the Scala Restaurant in the hotel and found the food expensive and not especially good. I would avoid this in the future, but timing and commitments more or less forced me to eat in the hotel. I would certainly use the property again. As charming and lavish many of the Hong Kong hotels may be, this property was a good deal for the price and well kept, despite heavy convention use. The adjoining Hyatt offered rooms with similar views at more than double the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Wanchai!”
Reviews.Author: fafafooey
Reviews.Content: Spent a few months in this hotel while on business travel in Hong Kong. The hotel is average, nothing special for a hotel in Asia. During my stay the lobby was under construction. It's close to the MTR and Central. I much rather stay on Hong Kong side then Kowloon. In Kowloon you are mobbed by people trying to sell you stuff and are stuck with the tourists. Also this hotel is 5 minutes to Old China Hand and other bars in Wanchai. If your single or here for an extended time, Wanchai is a nice (cheap) place to hang out and people watch!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Majorramesh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Renaissance, Harbour View Hotel in Hong Kong. The Hotel is very well located in Wanchai, very close to the Star Ferry. People looking out for Indian Vegetarian food can take the ferry to Kawaloon and have a meal at the Branto or Woodlands or Sangeeta restaurants. All the restaurants are located close to each other so you can choose from. There are a number of North India non veg restaurants also located in the vicinity of Nathan Street, Kawaloon. The buildings from the Hotel to the Wanchai MTR and to the bus station are inter connected so you will not get wet even if it is raining. There is a super market in the next building toward the Ferry site. So you can pick up your beer and nick nacks from there if you have a long stay. Khana Khazana is a good vegetarian hotel on Jaffee street next to Subway and only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and always smiling. Mr Dino from the concierge helps you in getting around town even if you are a first timer. He gives you very good directions and tips.

Reviews.Title: “OK for business, definitely not for leisure”
Reviews.Author: travelgaljkt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week during the typhoon season (not a good idea). Good average hotel; don’t forget to request for the harbor view. I stayed at the 11th floor, which is the only floor with a balcony with the harbor view. If you plan to stay during daytime, DON'T they're under renovation it's very noisy. Room is a bit small for the price; breakfast is boring and almost the same everyday, lobby is very ‘cold’ and uninviting, could use more flowers or decoration. Plus point: Close to public transportation (skybridge to MTR station is connected to the hotel) and Ferry to Kowloon is just across the street. Recommended for business traveler, but definitely not for leisure or romance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Setanta04
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here as part of our round the world honeymoon. We picked this hotel, mainly because of its location and views.We were not disappointed.The views from our room were spectacular. The room was a good size with all the normal features. We received a cake,fruit and a bottle of wine on arrival,as a honeymoon present ,which was nice. The hotel is 5 min walk to star ferry which we used nearly everyday.Taxis in the city are really cheap.We used the underground but I found that you have to walk a lot more to platforms than you do on other cities undergrounds.But maybe I was feeling just a bit more lazy than usual. In general the staff were helpful,although the conceirge could have been alot more polite.This was'nt just one of them but actually two different men who manned the desk at different occasions. We had drinks in the bar and the two singers & piano man were excellent. The pool area is lovely and the staff very attentive.Be warned though food and drink prices are ridiculous. The internet room was easy to use and prices quiet reasonable. There is a small shop which was handy. And we booked all of our excursions at the desk in the lobby. We will stay here when we return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but noisy and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DrAdamSC
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance Harbour View in Hong Kong and seemed to have nothing but problems. The hotel is very nice but our first room smelled moldy and drove my allergic wife crazy. Our next room was recently renovated and very nice (sans mold) but our Harbour View was directly into the crane at the Exhibition Center construction site. Our final room was great but the constant daily drilling and jack hammering was extremely annoying. The hotel notice of some construction noise understated the issue. Overall, I will probably not stay at this hotel again. The staff was great but the noise and moldy smell (and we were not alone in this observation) were too much considering the price of the room. Although we asked for an adjustment to our rate it was ignored. We did change hotels to a cheaper Renaissance in Kowloon that was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Fine hotel for sites and business.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBusyWoman
Reviews.Content: Greatest thing about this hotel was the location adjoining the convention center (and with direct access to the ferries and the subway). It was our first trip to Hong Kong and we chose the hotel for it's location. Hotel was very expensive, but the service and facilities were quite impressive. We had a 'garden view' room on the 33rd floor which is code for 'we don't promise you a harbor view'. Hotel is built to provide a fanstastic view to most rooms, so our room on the end had a bit of a strange shape. In terms of meals, we particularly enjoyed lunch in the Lobby Lounge (HK$138) -- this was 4 courses and we enjoyed each one. We also tried their expensive Italian restaurant (La Scala)and my Italian husband thought it was reasonably good. The garden is on the 11th floor and is shared with the Hyatt Regency -- it's quite impressive with grass/trees, multiple pools and a restaurant that looked nice but did not seem to be open when I was there. The fitness room is shared with the Hyatt and is attended and well equipped. Clientel was almost entirely british/australian/US at breakfast (buffet), but at dinner (buffet) it switched to almost entirely Chinese. There also seemed to be a large number of airline crews coming and going. I really enjoyed my visit and would return, particularly if the rate was better.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: redpete
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip and found it to be very comfortable and convenient. My room had an amazing view of the harbour (worth requesting this in my opinion) and the breakfast was probably one of the best and most expansive I've ever had. You could have pretty much anything you wanted. It was handy for me as it was right near the office, but for pleasure visitors I'm not sure the location would be that great - it would probably be more convenient to be closer to 'Central'. Also had I been visiting for pleasure, I wouldn't necessarily choose to stay here. Not because of anything the hotel lacks, but mainly due to the atmosphere that comes with a massive hotel with 40 storeys. It has all the amenities you could want, so if that's what you're after, then I'm sure you'd be happy here. But if you're looking for somewhere with a bit more individuality, I don't think this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for the price. Actually quite a bit cheaper than other hotels on HK island. Very convenient location if attending a show/event at the convention center, but otherwise it's a bit of a walk to get to the MTR. The one thing that was really crazy was the tiny little beds. Barely a twin size and hard as a rock. The rooms were small, but a single queen bed would have helped make it feel roomier. There are definitely nicer options on the island (Conrad, Marriott, Shangri-La) but they were about US$100 more per night. So again, it wasn't bad for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what it is”
Reviews.Author: AreAnyNamesNotTaken
Reviews.Content: Even if you didn't know that this hotel is attached to a massive conference centre, you can somehow sense it as you walk through the door. The whole place has the no-nonsense/no-frills atmosphere of a place occupied almost exclusively by foreign businesspeople, who arrive late and leave early, staying for one night only. The rooms are perfectly clean and adequate, but completely non-descript and rather dated (and a little tired in the case of mine, whose cupboards and bathroom sink were scuffed and chipped in places). Everything is designed with just enough space for its intended purpose, and not an inch more. The morning breakfast experience is as close as I ever hope to come to being in a factory production line. In terms of location, the hotel is very well situated. Being just outside Central, it benefits from cheaper rooms than its peers, whilst still being within walking distance (or a very short cab ride) from the business district. Going in the other direction, it is also only minutes from Happy Valley Racecourse (which is an absolute must if you're in town on Wednesday night). Plus, of course, it is on the waterfront, with incredible views across to Kowloon. The only downside to its positioning is that the next door convention centre was undergoing huge, all-night building works while I was there, resulting in a crashing of cranes and lorries that kept me awake until 3am. Overall, I'd say that it's a good place to lay your head in Hong Kong, if that's all you need it for. However, I'd recommend that vacationers and honeymooners find somewhere a bit more characterful for their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: STL_MO_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall good stay for 19 days. The hotel location is very convenient to the convention center and the Wan Chai MTR station. The view of Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong skyline is fabulous. The staff were very cordial and prompt. The service level at the hotel was always good to exceptional. The daily breakfast buffet is wonderful. I did have a few small piques with the hotel. For a long stay with 2 people the closet space is inadequate, we ended up using the desks drawers for storage of clothes and other effects. We asked the hotel to clear our minbar fridge so we could use it for our own supplies. Unfortunately the fridge was so shallow, it was almost pointless. I wish we had asked them to remove the fridge entirely to use for storage of clothes and other things. With the exception of our space challenges everything about our experience at the Renaissance Harbour View was very good. I can't speak to the value end of our booking since it was a business trip (with a couple of personal days) and all the arrangements and payments were not handled by us. Would I recommend staying here if you are in Hong Kong? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slippery1952
Reviews.Content: I visited Hong Kong in March 2008 and my wife and I stayed at the Renaissance Harbour View Hotel. I booked the hotel for three nights via the internet (www.asiarooms.com) and paid £110 per night inclusive of breakfast. We arrived at Hong Kong Airport around 6.30am and after taking the fast train into Hong Kong Central station and transferring to the free hotel shuttle, we arrived at the hotel around 9.30am. In other hotels I have visited, should you arrive as early as this you would be told to return at about 1pm. Not so the case with this hotel, as I was informed that our room was not ready but if I returned in about one hour’s time then one would be made ready for us. We duly returned at the suggested time and the pass cards were handed to us for room 1804. The room overlooked the garden as the harbour view rooms are more expensive and I can't see the point of paying for a view when you only look out of the window a few times during your stay! The hotel is ideally located on Hong Kong Island and is only a short walking distant from the Wanchai Star Ferry Terminal. It is only a relatively short distance from the Wanchai MTR station that will allow the traveller to take advantage of the excellent rail links and low-cost travel around Hong Kong. I have stayed at this hotel three times now and would most certainly recommend it to any first-time traveller to Hong Kong, I would also recommend it to any traveller returning to Hong Kong who has been disappointed with their accommodation on previous visits. I can not praise the hotel personnel highly enough as they are always friendly, professional and courteous in all their actions. The hotel rooms are well appointed and the breakfast is a joy to feast on as there is a wide variety to cater for Europeans and Asians. I never took advantage of the swimming pool and health club that is shared with the Grand Hyatt, however, I did walk around all the facilities with my wife and everything looked in pristine condition. I hope I have another opportunity to visit Hong Kong and the Renaissance Harbour View will by first choice of hotel even though there have been many more first-class hotels constructed there since my previous visit in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance luxury in Hong Kong? No such luck!”
Reviews.Author: UK_Frequent_Flyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel's claim to provide 5-star service is completely ill-founded in our experience. The rooms require urgent renovation - here are a few good reasons: 1. The old -fashioned bulky TV set block the mirror - a ridiculous arrangement 2. The lighting system is awful: the central control switches on all the light at the slightest provocation, even when you try to change the air conditioning setting in the middle of the night. it is also impossible to switch the light in the corridor separately from room lights. To add insult to injury, the reading lights are spot lights in the ceiling, so one person has no chance of sleeping whilst the other is reading. On top of all that, there are no power sockets next to the bed, and no standard lamps. We had to borrow a lamp and an extension lead and plug it in at the opposite wall, creating a trip hazard. The hotel staff were unapologetic about this. 3. There was no tray for the kettle, no cups (just mugs) and no wine glasses. All that had to be requested. 4. There is only one armchair (the other is a desk chair) and no coffee table. 5. The colour scheme is dominated by dark greys - in combination with bad lighting makes the place feel gloomy. 6. The pillows smelt funny and had to be changed. 7. Linen was not changed daily, and room make up was idiosyncratic: one day they forgot to add tea, the other the bed turn down in the evening. 8 The bathroom is small, dark and inconvenient, and the toilet bowl uses a rather disgusting flushing system with a "delay and display" action. 9. Singing in the bar is painful to the ear (out of tune), but reverberates around the lobby, because the bar is "open plan" - so there is no escape. (The best option is to pop to Grand Hyatt across the 11-th floor swimming pool, where singing at the Champagna Bar is exquisite!) The HKCEC nearby is in the process of building an extension. Funnily enough, that does not create the principal disruption - it is the rest of the arrangements in the hotel that are woefully inadequate. Oh, and internet in rooms is wired by default, and cost HK$830 (over GBP60) for 10 days (14 days, in fact - but that was the only option).

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Hong Kong after a 13 hour flight to this hotel jettisoned most of the lethargy and jet-lag I'd picked up from sitting in a cramped seat. The hotel is well placed for travel on the MTR, and the staff were friendly, attentive and more than happy to help out wherever possible. We were upgraded from standard rooms to the Executive Floor. Although the room wasn't the largest I've stayed in, the view over the harbour was amazing. A private breakfast area with efficient and discreet staff awaited us in the morning. After a long day sightseeing, bedtime was welcomed and the room was free from background noise and I had two very comfortable nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_Flyer
Reviews.Content: Great location for Convention Centre and Wan Chai business area. Large, high class, fully serviced hotel which shares excellent outdoor facilities (bar, pool etc) with the Grand Hyatt. Particularly recommend the nightly barbeque in the outside restaurant when the weather is good. Very spacious, well equipped rooms - those with a harbour view very spectacular. Though not the queasy as the windows are full height. Inside restaurant and bar also very good - though the nightly cabaret is a little cheesy !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view of harbour”
Reviews.Author: SJ100DB
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Renaissance Harbour View in January en route to Sydney. We booked a Harbour View room & were upgraded to the club floor on arrival. The room was a decent size & had a very comfortable bed & excellent shower. The highlight was the floor to ceiling windows with a stunning view of Victoria Harbour. We thought the location was good as it was close to the Star Ferry & a short walk to the MTR station. We found Hong Kong very easy to get around & with excellent transport links. The restaurant Dynasty inside the hotel was very good & a reasonable price. It was too cold to use the pool but it was a good size with many loungers & a good view of the harbour. I was a little apprehensive about this hotel after reading some reviews but I had no need to worry as it was great & would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay here as a Gay Traveller”
Reviews.Author: coupefletch
Reviews.Content: Hi we stayed here on the 28th Jan for 2 nights on our way to Sydney. We arrived at the hotel complete with our luggage after a long flight from Heathrow. We made our way to the check-in area and we welcomed by a smart young lady who was apparently a trainee, However, she did have a member of staff with her watching her every move. My travelling party consisted of me and my same sex partner. We were asked whether we wanted two singles or a double bed, I asked for a double bed and were asked a further 3 times what type of bed we wanted. We could not believe what we were hearing. A service industry and they hadnt come across gay people before, for gods sake, there was various airlines staying in the hotel we werent the only gay people they had come across. We found this very embarassing at check in with the whole of the staff looking at us as though we were monsters with 2 heads. We did speak to the manager on the way out with no joy. Other than that the hotel was clean, they had complete floor renovations going on during the day. We did find it hard to relax in the hotel in the day if you popped back to the hotel for and hours sleep. My final word is be aware of the evening buffet we asked for the menu at breakfast for the evening meal which they showed us but when it came to the evening we were pushed into the buffet evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RAB68
Reviews.Content: We had a week in the Harbour View and it was superb. We arrived early Sunday morning and in our room within 10 minutes. We had a corner harbour view room on the 19th floor - very spacious with floor to ceiling windows giving a fantastic panoramic view of the harbour, skyscrapers and the Star ferries busily sailing to and from Tsim Sha Tsui and Hung Hom (Kowloon). The room was very modern and immaculately kitted out and serviced (it was even 'refreshed' each evening - choccies and complimentary bottled water). The facilities were great, the pool area on the 11th floor was huge, full of trees, greenery walking/running paths, tennis courts and a massive swimming pool. We used the pool every morning (no one else did!), it was slightly chilly but, followed by a sauna, a really refreshing way to beat off the jet lag. We ate in the Renaissance restaurant a couple of times and had three (huge and varied) buffet breakfasts - quite pricey but top quality and exceptional service. The service at the hotel was incredible - we had a (small) problem with our shower head and within 5 minutes of reporting it, it had been fixed. There are plently of places to eat and drink nearby and the MTR station is a five minute walk along a covered walkway. The whole area (Wan Chai & indeed Hong Kong) is extremely safe so make sure you really explore. Buy an Octopus card (a really handy and cheap way to use all methods of public transport as well as various shops and tourist attractions etc). If you do one thing in Hong Kong make sure it's the trip to Victoria Peak - it's touristy but the views are incredible. A tip would be to avoid the viewing platform (fee) and go for a five minute walk on the Peak Trail to afford some spectacular views of the Hong Kong skyline and harbour...if you do two things, use your Octopus card on the Star ferries as much as you can...they are fantastic. All in all the Renaissance is a great place to stay in probably the best part of HK (Wan Chai) for a visitor. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Welshtraveller005
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room but upgraded free of charge to club. Our 40th floor room had fabulous views, incredibly comfortable, spacious, well furnished. The club lounge provided complimentary cocktails and canapes and service there and in the hotel was absolutely superb. The location is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay for Us!!”
Reviews.Author: Goneagain
Reviews.Content: We had a very memorable stay at The Harborview Hotel. After working at a Children's Home in India, this hotel was an oasis! However, we immediately realized that, after traveling for 24 hours, we had picked up the wrong bag at the airport!!!! Continuing onto a 12 night cruise would be impossible w/out my clothes!!! The staff at The Harborview went into gear and almost immediately located my bag at the airport. They literally put us on a shuttle bus and when we arrived a hotel concierge (located at the airport) was waiting outside for us. He walked us thru the process we needed to complete to exchange the bags and then put us right back on another shuttle. We were very grateful for the seamless and helpful service!! Eventhough we were staying on our Marriott points, we were given a 27th floor room with a panoramic view of the harbor. We enjoyed the buffet lunch and the location was convenient to the cruise ship and Star Ferry! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. Do yourself a favour - go for the Harbour view”
Reviews.Author: retiredScotland
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the morning after a long travel from NZ. Decided to upgrade to a harbour view and it was worth it. Got room service and it was good - the staff were very attentive and friendly.Loved the location - used the Star ferry to Kowloon several times -. Would recommend this Hotal anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, great staff, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Basil192
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for another business trip during the New Year period in Hong Kong. After our terrible experience in the Mariott Chicago, we wanted to change our stay as the Renaissance is a Mariott hotel, but we heard good things about the hotel from coworkers so we went ahead and stayed there. It was our first time to Hong Kong as well, so it was a great experience. The hotel is very clean and the service is fantastic. It is nicer than the one in Chicago, and even though its undergoing refurbishment, it probably doesn't really need it. We stayed in a club harbourview room on the top floor 42 (i think), but it was surprisingly small, but I guess this is the way in Asia. Rooms are smaller than average. The housekeeping was great and kept our room very tidy, same with room service, and any other service provided by the hotel, no problems at all. The Club Lounge was great, the breakfast wasn't as good as the Mariott in Chicago (who thought i'd miss something from that awful hotel) but the super friendly staff (especially Jeff) made it a pleasure to be there every morning. The view from the Club Lounge is also fantastic, beautiful views of the harbour. We had a great view from our room too, and were literally next to the fireworks..it was amazing. I really enjoyed it. My only complaint was the air con at the hotel, they had a pretty old system that was hard to regulate..and the air was very stale, cold and dry, so we turned it off most nights..and the carpet and bathroom could use a bit of refurbishment..but other than that, it was great, would definitely stay there again. Staff were very friendly and helpful and made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: I booked a twin room through the hotel website at a promo Rest and Dine rate of 1700 Hong Kong Dollars per night inclusive of 500 HKD dining credit. The rate was pretty reasonable considering that Express by Holiday Inn was going for 1350 HKD! The hotel lobby was nice and spacious and one reson I choose this over Express was that there is a free shuttle bus from Hong Kong Station. The room was ok and bed was firm, but the pillows are horrible! I had asked for foam pillows but somehow they just never arrived when I checked in. Also I don't know if the walls are paper thin or I just have an obnoxious neighbour because whenever I talked in the room at 6p.m., the next door neighbour will just bang on the wall (which I reckoned is a signal for me to be quiet) but still, at 6 pm? Then everynight, at 3+am, I will be awoken from my sleep (aleady, getting to sleep is hard because of the bad bad BAD pillows) with more banging on the wall from next door (I would think that there's someone rather than imagine it to be haunted). The bathroom has an aged 90's decor or black marble and wood which is not really my cup of tea. The Chinese restaurant was good though, although the selection of Dim Sum on weekdays is slightly too little. One thing for sure is that I will never return to this hotel again: it's not very bad, but I can get better hotels with better pillows elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: monopoly
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for a family of 5 (with 3 teenagers),we were upgraded to harbour view through our travel agent and have to say that the views were great, the rooms clean ,the beds comfy and the bathrooms always stocked with clean towels,robes and toiletries.They are refurbishing floors at the moment ,but started at 10am and were finshed by 6pm so we were normally on our way out before it started so this did not affect us.We loved this hotel ,its proximity to the star ferry and the MTR made it a good choice for us.The staff from the doormen to the reception ,concierge and room staff were polite ,helpful and nothing was too much trouble.It was our Sons 21st birthday while we were there and he was given a card and a cake.Little touches which make your holiday special.I would stay at this hotel again,if we returned to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good things and some bad things”
Reviews.Author: KET777
Reviews.Content: I will be here for 14 nights for business. Because of the room it will be (and is) unbearable. I can put up with a tiny room (and mine is actually larger than the average) however, the rooms are old and worn out. The wall paper is coming off and has mold along the seams and part of the carpet is actually rotted. I hate to plug in the very old worthless hair dryer ,because the socket is surrounded by mildew and pulls out. of the wall with wires exposed when I unplug it. Stains on the chair and carpet. The night stands and desk are so beat up if you had them at home you would throw them out. There is no excuse for this at $350+ U.S. per night. Pure greed on the part of the owners. Needless to say this is very depressing. So they dress up the lobby, hallways, exterior - but LOOK OUT when you get to your room - it's simply nasty. The only good thing about this place is the service - the employees in every area of this establishment are outstanding. But that can't even come close to making up for the awful living conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice if you stay in HongKong”
Reviews.Author: bondy_w
Reviews.Content: There are lot of problems with this Hotel. The rooms are very small and even though the interior on the first sight looks pretty there are stains on the wall and on the carpet and even worse there is mold in the bathroom and in the closet. The room has a certain humid smell and the windows can not be opened, which make this hotel very uncomfortable for people with allergies. After my complaint the hotel employees agreed that they have that kind of problems with the not renovated rooms (only the upper floor more expensive rooms are renovated according to personal). Also a big disappointment the breakfast: only the cheapest of food is served. The orange juice is not real and only a chemical look alike. I have only seen cheap cheese and sausages. Even so the selection seems to be big (becasue of the addition Chinese section) it is not really big. While those parts of the hotel which are in the limelight of the public like the lobby are maintained quite well, those which are not (like the gym) tend to leave a at least partially shabby impression. If you look closer e.g. in the elivator you can see decorative parts being fixed with sticky tape.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: t2311ps
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel good location for subway etc. Rooms very clean but small (normal for Hong Kong) nice beds. Good breakfast included with room. Staff very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: littlesisterWales
Reviews.Content: What a start to a long trip. The room was very good - new toothbrush every day! Amazing pool and changing facilities. Lovely meal in restaurant. Such comfy beds too.

Reviews.Title: “Location and View”
Reviews.Author: CoopsBristol
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times before and never disappointed. Staff are great. Location is perfect for getting around Hong Kong, ferries, buses, trams and MTR all close. Wanchai night life will broaden the mind of most. If you like full speed cities but need an oasis this might be the place. Rooms are of a good standard. Pay the extra for a Harbour View 'cos that's what Hong Kong is all about. Lobby Lounge renovation now completed so good place to sit and "people watch". Always good for a longer stay not just a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Waggers21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Harbour View for thee nights in January '07. Our travel agent had upgraded us to a deluxe room and we were delighted to be upgraded again on arrival. Our room had a fantastic view of the harbour and was very modern and spotlessly clean. I simply can't fault it! Service was first class all round from very helpful and friendly staff. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A+ for views & location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFast
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Renaissance Harbor View, located on the island (Central) side of Hong Kong. Stayed here in August '07 for business--1x in a harbor view and 1x in a "pool" view room. If you have the option, splurge or try to get upgraded to a harbor view room--the views are stunning and rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows. Overall the rooms are small-ish, but nicely decorated in an understated Asian decor. I thought the beds were like rocks (no Marriot feather beds here for some reason), but I was tired and also slept like a rock. Internet access from a laptop is $10 per day or you can get hourly. (Not sure if they have internet access in the business center.) The Wan Chai ferry terminal is just across the street, a 10-minute ride on the Star Ferry which connects you to the Kowloon/mainland side for < 40 cents USD. The subway (MTR) is nearby and accessible by covered walkways, although I had problems getting back from the MTR to the hotel (no signs). The subway is very safe and efficient, and signs are in English. Taxis are cheap, and be sure to take the double decker bus to Stanley Market for a beautiful drive around the island. From HKG airport, I recommend the Airport Express tram ($10 one-way) to the Central station stop in the IFC building, and take a cab to the hotel (<$4). To return via the Airport Express, you can purchase your ticket at the front desk or at the station. The restaurant/coffee shop is on the 8th (?) floor and has terrific views of the harbor, if you want the view but don't have a harbor view room. The pool is beautiful, and a nice place for the sunset view of the harbor. Take the one-hour Aqua Luna harbor cruise ($20) aboard a replica Chinese sailboat (junk), which runs 3x daily from the Wan Chai and Kowloon piers. Be sure to carry a business card from the hotel, which shows the hotel in English and Cantonese. Many cab drivers do not speak English and are not familiar with the Renaissance. I've heard great things about the Shangri-La, and also recommend the Langham (esp. the Club Floor) if you prefer to stay on the Kowloon side.

Reviews.Title: “OK - nice view - nice pool - rooms need renovation”
Reviews.Author: alohatiger1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights before travelling to Bali. I stayed in this hotel already 10 years ago, and they didn`t change anything. I think the rooms need some renovation. I came back to this hotel because I remembered the great view over the Hong Kong Harbour. So, when you choose to come to this hotel, make sure you book a Harbour view room, the view is perfect. The also have a nice poolside where you can relax after sightseeing. The hotel is ok, they have great breakfast, staff is friendly, but overall I would not come here anymore. I think there are better hotels in Hong Kong. As I got a very good rate thru my company it was ok, but not much of a big highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Great view great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Wimmie
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and stayed 2 nights in this hotel. I actually booked Garden view but was upgraded to a nice Harbour View suite on 19th fl. Dinner at Dynasty was the best!! Breakfast was good with fair choices. Part of the hotel was under renovation but overall was a pleasant stay. What disappointed me was that we booked a board room for a meeting on Sunday and we five persons were put into a very tiny room (for 4) in the business center. As we asked for the larger room, they offered us with more charge the meeting room for 20 persons where the song inside that room could not be turned off or dimmed. So we decided to get packed in the smaller quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views but functional at best”
Reviews.Author: waynesays
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of a trip to Hong Kong and Bali. Having upgraded to a harbour view room (an absolute must) I was pleased with the breathtaking views across to Kowloon. The pool area is excellent although the views shown in most brochures are misleading as you look directly onto the convention centre (which was being extended when we were there). Staff are reasonably attentive. Now for the negatives - the rooms feel a bit dated and do not seem that clean (there was a bit of a strange smell in our room). At the time of our stay the hotel was undergoing noisy renovations to the lobby. The location is a bit far removed from the action of Hong Kong Island (it was a taxi ride away to Central / Soho areas) Would I stay here again? Probably not, the hotel would be fine for a business trip - there are better options on Hong Kong Island for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: watchitLondon
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel on Hong Kong side. Absolutely must have a harbour view room ( although the next door conference centre is extending with plenty of building work and the hotel lobby was being refurbished - no discount or prior notice was given to us) although to be fair it made little impact on our stay. Superb location and views. Covered walkway to metro and nearby shops. We ate out of the hotel with breakfast at a deli t the end of the walkway and dim sum and local restuarants cheap and plentiful. Nearby ex pat drinking and red light area not too seedy and local street markets next door worth the visit. Starline ferry a short walk and trams and buses nearby -its very easy to cover HK and Kowloon side. Use peak tram to get up and then walk round the corner for a bus back down to get the views and quicker exit. Stanley market not as cheap relatively (Primark t -shirts cheaper!) but plenty eating and drinking places and easy transport via No 6 bus. Allow plenty of time to get back from Aberdeen harbour via the tunnel as very busy. Definately recommend the longest mid level escalator trip with then a leisurely walk down through the zoo (which was well worth the visit )and then exit and drop onto the peak tram -as a sort of trip itinary.

Reviews.Title: “would return”
Reviews.Author: LancashirePeely
Reviews.Content: wonderful location and fantastic hotel.. real luxury with excellent service and very good value for the price..cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: w0rldwidetraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from the 10 February. The hotel is on the waters edge of Hong Kong Island which looks across the harbour to Kowloon. The staff were very helpful and our room was very comfortable and very clean. Our room also looked across the harbour and was toped up daily with free bottles of water which comes in very handy. The hotel pool looked very nice although we did not have time to use it and the restaurants in the hotel were also good. The hotel is next to the star ferry terminal couldn't ask for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel would definitely return again”
Reviews.Author: newgrange
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the Renaissance on they way out to NZ and again on the way back. Fantastic views, excellent room service, very high quality restaurants in the Dynasty (Cantonese) and Scala (European). The tasting menu in the Scala is particularly good. We found the staff without exception to be helpful and concerned with our well-being. The location of the hotel is second to none. They are currently undergoing some renovations but are doing their best to lessen the impact. Good selection of breakfast foods. I would definitely stay there again should I find myself in Hong Kong and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: glasgow1888
Reviews.Content: What everyone else has said really: Superb views over the Harbour, nice rooms, very comfortable. Very much a 4 star city centre hotel and doesnt try to be anything else. Good location, reasonable food and attentive service. Desperately missing an important feature: A BAR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but that's pretty much it”
Reviews.Author: mare1205
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business and decided to stay central on HK Island. Only a few Hotels have a pool like the RHM which shares its out door facilities with the opposite Hyatt. Unfortunatly, the pool was closed and there was no excuse. The rooms are very small compare to other Hotels in that area. While 'the don't disturb me sign' was posted out side my door, house keeping was interrupting me eight times on a Saturday afternoon for no particular reason. Even better, there is a huge construction side right next to the door, and the Hotel didn't had the curtesy to mentioned that while booking directly with RHM a couple of weeks prior to my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbour Views”
Reviews.Author: Brummy07
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance Harbour view Hotel. On arrival we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to Club Level at an additional cost, we were so glad that we did. We stayed on the 38th floor with a harbour view (which we had previously booked). The room and bathroom was excellent, very clean. Breakfast, afternoon tea, cocktails and free use of the internet was included with the upgrade (all of which we enjoyed). The location was excellent, it was a short walk to Wan Chai MTR, the Star Ferry, a bus service across the road and there was always a taxi available. I would never go again in June because of the humidity. If purchasing a made to measure suit try the tailors on Hong Kong Island, when we went over to Kowloon we were pestered continually with people trying to get us into their shops and giving out leaflets. We went into a couple of these shops (escorted by the man who had given us his leaflet) only to discover that some of the shirt material I could have purchased cheaper at Birmingham Rag Market, cheap and very poor quality. This harassment I found was a downside to Kowloon. We purchased an Octopus pass which enabled us to use all forms of transport including the tram to The Peak. Excellent value, the MTR is clean and efficient. If you go up to see the Buddha it is takes approximately 25 minutes by bus (not for the faint-hearted). This pass can also be used to buy food, drinks etc. in various venues and, if like us, you still have credit then some of the shops at the airport accept them. There is a free shuttle service from Hong Kong station to the hotel which we took, we bought a return pass on the Express Airport Shuttle, it was convenient, quick and easy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel, we could not fault it. It was clean, ideal position, staff were excellent. They also have their own security staff who are visible at all times. I don't think that I will visit Hong Kong again only because I have seen all the tourist attractions but if you are travelling over to Australia it is an excellent stop to visit for a few days to break up the journey. Overall, it was an excellent hotel with wonderful harbour views.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: mushis
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Harbour View Hotel is good in the sense that you are given a comfortable room, the food is good and the staff are friendly. Yet, the hotel does not seem to have that special something. It does not push that little bit extra to provide truly exceptional service. If you want true luxury I would not recommend The Renaissance Harbour View Hotel but if you want a good location and stunning views it is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: Montana Business Man
Reviews.Content: My first comment would be that the Renaissance has the very best location of any hotel on Hong Kong Island. And since I prefer Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, I consider the Renaissance to be the very best place to stay. PROS: 1. My top priority when I travel in Asia is to be conveniently located next to subway entrance. If I'm only in town for a few days, I don't want to lose 2-3 hours a day from walking between the hotel and nearest station. The Renaissance is a fast (and covered) 5 minute walk to the Wan Chai station and just 60 seconds away from the Star Ferry terminal. Lots of hotels are located near a subway station, bu the Renaissance is the only one close to both a subway station AND the Star Ferry. 2. Right across the street via covered walkway is a 7-11, grocery store, coffee shop, and about a dozen restaurants, including the extremely popular (and cheap) Cafe de Coral. Acquainting yourself with this area will save you big bucks on dining. 3. Service is impeccable, but that is pretty typical for most of Hong Kong. 4. Next to the fitness center is a cleaner. Their prices are about 40% lower than the prices listed on the price sheets in the hotel closets. 5. If you in Hong Kong to attend a convention at the Convention Center, this is absolutely the most convenient hotel to stay at. 6. There is no such thing as a cheap Hong Kong hotel, but the Renaissance offers a great, great value for the price. It is way cheaper than most other well situated hotels on Hong Kong Island. 7. Fantastic and large pool that hardly gets used. CONS: 1. The fitness center, while nice and modern, is quite small for the size of the hotel. It was so crowded in the mornings that you had to put your name on a waiting list for a treadmill/stair climber or stationary bike. Tip: walk another 50 feet and sneak into the Hyatt fitness club. It is bigger and spectacularly equipped. 2. The buffet menu hardly varied the 5 days I was there. It is great quality, but I got tired of seeing the same thing over and over. See #2 above for alternatives. 3. The furnishing and rooms are ultra clean, but I would not call it luxurious. The entire hotel really needs a furnishing update, so if you're looking for super luxury, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: vanessa_jm_gray
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just had a two night stay at the Renaissance Harbour View in Hong Kong. We were upgraded to a suit when we arrived, which was a good start. The room was lovely and the Harbour views were excellent. There is a bit of building work going on next door with the conference center - but it didn't disturb us at all. The room and bathroom were clean and well appointed. The staff were helpful and the buffet breakfast had everything one could wish for and more. In the evenings the lobby bar had two singers who entertained very well - singing all ones favorites! The location was great - 2 minutes walk from the Star Ferry over to the shopping metropolis of Kowloon and 5 minutes cab jouney from from Lang Kwai Fung - where all the nightlife is happening with trendy bars and restaurants. The air con in our room wasn't working - so the first night was hot and stuffy - but they fixed it as soon as we told them. Its a great place to stay and we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Ren Harbour View in HK for 5 nights, paid for by a Cat 5 travel package through MRP. We received an inside corner room on the 28th floor overlooking the pools and gardens. Pluses: 1. The room was quite spacious, with standard amenities: lots of bath and hygiene items, robes and slippers, safe, mini bar, coffee maker, etc. A/C worked well. The room was also very quiet. 2. Service was generally very good. Housekeeping and room service was friendly and prompt. Room was kept very tidy. We received a plate of fresh fruit at the beginning of our stay. Turn-down service with a little puzzle toy was also provided every evening. 3. Location is terrific - right next to Star Ferry to Kowloon (we took the ride every day), very close to MTR Wan Chai station and other shopping. It's a short taxi ride to Central/Airport Express and the Peak tram. 4. Food service was excellent. The breakfast buffet in the coffee shop was quite good (we were disappointed not to have it available when we arrived a couple minutes late on one of the days). I was able to order food from Dynasty and have it delivered via room service (the sweet corn soup and barbecued items were sooo good!). 5. Two bottles of water are provided free of charge and are replenished daily. Minuses: 1. The hotel is older and lacks much in the way of style or attractiveness. However, everything is very serviceable, so this is a minor point (unless you like trendy hotels with a lot of character or super luxury). 2. The hotel caters to business people, as it is a central transportation hub and right next to the convention/exhibition center. I was trying to come out of the elevator and got rushed by about 30 businessmen with rolling suitcases who refused to stand out of my way to let me exit. 3. Elevators can be very slow and crowded, even though there were 6 available. We often had to wait for the second or third to arrive because there was no room. 4. Restaurant choices are fairly limited and quite expensive, although good. If you are used to American style Chinese food, Dynasty might be a bit of a rude awakening (although not nearly as much as any of the street stalls you'll see around HK). 5. Bed was too hard, although the linens and pillows were fine. 6. TV choices also very limited. Basically there's one channel to satisfy various regional interests (like the Australian channel), but most of it is news and Chinese language stations. The only watchable English channel was Discovery. By the end of the stay, I was anxious for news on anything but Iraq and Gaza. There are ppv movies at around $12USD. 7. Light in the closet would not turn off, even when the doors were closed. This was my first real visit to HK and I enjoyed it immensely, even though it rained for about 75% of the trip. Weather was warm and humid a couple of times but mostly very comfortable (although wet - make sure to bring good shoes and an umbrella). We did the usual tourist stuff, like the Peak, HK Disneyland, Temple Street night market, and the big Buddha on Lantau Island. The Star Ferry and MTR are cheap, clean and extremely user friendly, so it's very easy to get around. Lots of shopping, although prices for high-end goods are comparable to the US (no tax though). We ate at the teppanyaki place right next to the hotel on the exhibition centre side; beautiful restaurant but more traditional and expensive, so don't expect Benihana! Overall the value received at the hotel was quite good and we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless stay”
Reviews.Author: nobster666
Reviews.Content: Hotel well situated. Service flawless. Offered upgrade to executive floor (well worth the extra £40). The purpose of the trip was primarily business and the hotel is perfect for this. I also took my wife along with me and she thought it was great too. The most impressive points were attention to detail: turn down service, excellent room service, complimentary and unsolicited birthday cake (which they must have noticed from my passport). i will gladly return here. As large corporate hotels go this is the best I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “spring weather”
Reviews.Author: fco
Reviews.Content: Fantastic spring weather mid April. Took express train from airport (cheaper to buy double package) and then courtesy bus to outside hotel. For return took taxi to express train terminal, which has quick check-in for bags rather than at airport. Hotel checked in quickly but first room smelt very bad but were changed after a little while to another similar room. Room size smallish and drab as is rest of hotel. However, staff service is exemplary at all times. Breakfast very average selection and quality neither good nor particularly bad. Ubiquitous Filipino group sang bravely in a cavernous entrance area, which ruined any sound. Bar food was quick and fresh but tends to expensive as are drinks. Very much a business hotel (part of the HK Conference Centre) and lacks any atmosphere. Has a retro look of old style socialist hotels ie block shape, with marble but drab. Very handy for one of the Star ferry terminals, a couple minutes walk. We got a good corporate rate but would otherwise consider elsewhere for more "character". The staff are the best part.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer23
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Renaissance Harbour View hotel in time for the Chinese New Year. We watched the fireworks from our 17th floor bedroom window and it was quite an occasion. We found the service at the hotel was excellent and our room was large, very clean with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom and good views of the harbour. The staff were all very helpful, and the breakfast menu was excellent. This hotel is a good location for the Star Ferry and local MRT. The New Year decorations and lights were really colourful. The hotel gardens are lovely with a splendid pool which we did not have time to use. The views from this part of the hotel are amazing. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a good base for sightseeing on Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: snakedriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel end of March for 4 nights and it was a truely amazing experience. a. We arrived early morning from Europe and got our room right away. b. We got an upgrade to a harbourview room for free with an amazing view through the floor to ceiling windows c. The breakfast is huge and all fresh (certainly the orange juice!) d. The swimming pool is the largest outdoor of Hong Kong and comes in handy after a day of sightseeing. e. Location is excellent: easy walk to MTR and right next to the Star Ferry to Kowloon We would highly recommend this hotel. We booked through asiarooms.com and got a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAAC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon and we were very impressed. The receptionists were so friendly congratulating us on our marriage and gave us an upgrade to a room with an amazing view over Kowloon. They sent us up the most amazing chocolate mousse cake, a small bottle of sparkling wine and some bath salts to welcome us and again congratulate us. The location was great. The pool is shared with a five star hotel next door and it was really great overlooking the harbour. Beware, we were charged €7 for a beer by the pool which ended up being a baby can of San Miguel! We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and a free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: travelforfunReading
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location right next to the star ferry at Wan Chai on Hong Kong Island and the tube. It was lovely, with great views and I even got a free upgrade to a suite on the 37 floor with harbour view. Even without the suite this hotel is perfect for location and the staff are very helpful. Recommend that you don’t eat at the hotel coffee shop though as its expensive, if you go into the small shopping centre that is attached there is a small coffee place in there that is cheap with excellent food, the freshly squeezed juice is lovely first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: plod7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days and was very satisfied with the hotel itself and the location.Had a corner harbour view on thirtyish floor(can't remember room number) and it was excellent.If I was super critical I would say we had dinner in the hotel restaurant and felt it was overpriced and lacking in any atmosphere.However as other reviewers have said there are plenty of options close by. Would recommend this hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a Hong Kong trip”
Reviews.Author: highfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with Marriott points in May. Beautiful corner room which was unexpectedly spacious for Hong Kong. Overlooked pool, and to the peak beyond and had a bit of a side harbour view. Very clean and well equipped. Public areas very nice and live music in lobby at night. We didn't eat in hotel because we were handy to so many places outside. Got from the airport with hotel shuttle bus which was fine but as taxis turned out to be good and cheap I suspect a taxi wouldn’t have cost much more for 2. It was very hot, but you could walk from the hotel through covered walkways to Wanchai area where we ate and visited lots of other little bars. Hotel location excellent so we made our own way around without the need to book an organised trip. Got taxi from hotel to Peak tram station to do peak and have lunch. Short walk from hotel to Star Ferry for scenic crossing and to visit Kowloon, and followed signs to subway which was the best underground I have seen anywhere in the world – organised, clean, air con, cheap. All in all a great stay and a well located hotel

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - Chinese New Year”
Reviews.Author: David92263
Reviews.Content: I had a three day stopover in HK - the first time I had been back since it became a SAR. Trailfinders booked me into the Renaissance and I got allocated a Harbor View room on the 20th floor. I ate a couple of times in the coffee shop where there is an excellent buffet. As somebody said elsewhere in these reviews the Harbor view from the room was worth every penny of the cost, the bed was comfortable and the whole place sparkled. I was there for Chinese New Year and the hotel laid on a special performance of the Dragon etc - well done! A memorable hotel. Book it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view.”
Reviews.Author: sandrinekent
Reviews.Content: I have spend with my family 6 days at the Renaissance Harbour HK. We travelled with 3 kids 11, 9, 2. U lived in HK fro 5 years before and wanted to take back my daughter where she was born. I know lots of different hotels in HK and wanted to be on HK side as it is more convenient with the children. This hotel is really good value compare to other hotels. Very clean, friendly. We had 2 harbour view rooms and we really enjoyed watching the fireworks for Chinese new year from our rooms. The location is the best. Wanchai, next to MRT and star ferry and shopping centres. Breakfast was great but very expensive. We ended up going to DeliFrance every morning which is on the way to the MRT. My favorite hotel in HK is still the Shangri la hotel in central but I recommend this one with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “FIne - but a little bit old”
Reviews.Author: RichRichRich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location if you are doing business on Hong Kong Island. It's probably walking distance to where you need to go. It's located right on the water. My room had a view of the "new" exposition center and TSK. My only complaint is that it's a little bit run down, or maybe just a bit on the tired side. My room wasn't as nice as I'd have liked. Just not impressive. They had cheesy live music in the lobby bar every night , which was fun to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh but at very good prices- hell of a pool”
Reviews.Author: RandGP
Reviews.Content: Last Hotel on a 3 week trip and we decided to treat ourselves given that prices are cheap here. Superb large pool. Very central Hotel near to Star Ferries. Our 1 moan would be that for a Hotel that knows that it is going to have a lot of travellers with late flights - they only had 1 quite poor shower/changing room (for both sexes) by the pool area. Compared to other Hotels such as in Singapore we did think that this let the Hotel down - but each to their own. Other than that could not complain - the service is pretty much over the top with so many staff to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: ozallan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for 5 days including New Years eve. Had a room on 28 floor with spectacular views up the Harbour. Could have spent the whole time in the room enjoying the view. Great location and easy access to the ferry and subway. Rooms really good size and comfortable. Only negative is that even though there are 6 lifts they seem to take ages to arrive. Great buffet breakfast but a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great service great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: Sophie-7
Reviews.Content: Convenient location about 5 min walk from subway and 2 mins from star ferry make this hotel ideally located for all that HK has to offer. Excellent service, friendly and helpful staff. We had heard that rooms in HK were small but were pleasantly surprised to find that ours was actually really spacious. We had a garden view room on a non smoking floor that still offered excellent view of 2 IFC. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved magnificent harbour views whilst lying in bed.”
Reviews.Author: Ozlovers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance in July for 3 nights with a further night in August en route to Thailand. We received a warm reception and were invited to stay on the club level with its own concierge and club lounge where we were able to breakfast and have evening cocktails before dinner. Of course, afternoon tea was also served here. The views of the harbour from our bed on the 38th floor were great and we were able to see the cruise ships as they came in to dock. Swimming pool and fitness rooms were to a high standard and the food in their a la carte restaurant was of a high quality and served in an intimate fashion. The hotel is very well located for walking to and from many shops and other restaurants and for catching ferries across to Kowloon. Taxis are cheap and it is well wothwhile to take a trip out to the New Territories where there is so much space after Hong Kong itself. This was our first visit to Hong Kong and it will not be the last; The Renaissance is high on our list of hotels to re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool - fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 01forLondon
Reviews.Content: Well, I've stayed in a number of hotels worldwide but this has got to be one of the best!! The service is impeccable, the hotel rooms are large for HK standard and the facilities are very impressive. The hotel is situated right in the centre of the HK Wan Chai Business district and is therefore great for the business traveller. We can recommend the rooms on the 8th floor because they have balconies and are also good for pool access. The pool is huge and the area catches quite a lot of sun between the sky scrapers. There are sun loungers and a bar along with free towels for guests. Two things to note - firstly - this is an international hotel with piano playing in the lobby along with peanuts and cocktails. If you are looking for true Asian culture this is not the place to be. Secondly, this hotel is on HK island and therefore has less spectular views than those on Kowloon as you are already in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller2-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Our family of four - Husband, wife, son 19 & daughter 16 stayed at this hotel for 10 days 19 - 29 Dec, 2006. Had connecting rooms on 17th floor with harbour views. Check-in and check-out both seamless, staff friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, simply furnished but not unpleasant, beds were excellent but pillows a bit soft - we got used to them. Comfortable wing chairs and foot stools that we used to sit in and gaze out at the ever changing view. Rooms were a reasonable size which was fine as we weren't in them too much. We were there for Hong Kong, not for the hotel room. Housekeeping staff were efficient and friendly too. Close to Star Ferry terminal and not too far from MTR. We had breakfast included in our package and could not fault the buffet available each day. Also had Christmas lunch there - this was outstanding. Construction work being undertaken at the Convention Centre next door meant that there was sometimes a bit of noise. It was not intrusive - more a hum and we often didn't even notice it. Pool area excellent. We would certainly stay at this hotel again and would highly recomment it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: avourlid
Reviews.Content: This is a vey good hotel. We spent two days here over NYE. The room had excellent views of Victoria Harbour and Kowloon, very clean, very well serviced and spacious. Breakfast and dinner at the Scala restaurant were excellent and we also had lunch at the all-day restaurant which was also very good. We relied on the hotel for our New Year's entertainment - it was ok but nothing major and was very surprising to find that with such a great location, the hotel doesn't have a lobby taking advantage of it. Location-wise, Wan Chai may not be as convenient as Central, but still only a 5-min taxi ride to everywhere else, so the price difference with the hotels in Central is definitively worth your stay in this area. Would definitively stay there again for the same price (room of around HK$1900 which for the season I found to be very reasonable for that class of hotel).

Reviews.Title: “It's certainly not the Grank Hyatt !!!”
Reviews.Author: S6blr
Reviews.Content: I was there for several days on business. In terms of blandness, this hotel is clearly resting on its laurels as being right next to the convention centre. Room -- average, location -- average, staff service -- average. IF (big IF) there is a convention on at the convention centre, you'll never in a timely manner get a taxi at the hotel. You're better off to exit on the Harbour Road side and walk to the Taxi Rank about 250m away where you'll not wait.

Reviews.Title: “Good location BUT bed hard as a rock”
Reviews.Author: UnitedMiles
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel since the 1990's and watched it go through several management changes. The last time was Christmas time 2005. Sadly the hotel has gone downhill and I would not stay here again because: 1. during the winter they don't heat the rooms. They did give us a little heater to plug in because we were cold. They must hear this a lot because they quickly brought us a heater when we asked why the thermostat didn't work. 2. HK hotels are notorious for having very hard mattresses. These were hard as a rock even though we upgraded to a "nicer" room. Here are the positives though about this hotel: 1. Good value for the price unless you need a comfortable bed to sleep on. The hotel looks very nice but the room furniture is simple and bare. Probably on par with a Comfort Inn look in USA. 2. Excellent location as it is near the Wanchai Star Ferry and about a 5 minute walk to the Wanchai MTR station. Great view of Victoria Harbour. Service is very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cm3
Reviews.Content: just came back from Hong kong, lovely city. anyways we stayed 5 nights in the penthouse of JIA hotel and then 2 nights in this hotel. i must say i liked this hotel more. u can call this a hotel while the other one is nice apartment. u can read my review of JIA hotel too. anyaways, great check in and check out people even though now i have problem that my marriot points have not been added. we had 2 rooms normal harbour view room which was good with nice view but the bathroom is old. the other one was club suite, it was amazing, huge with 2 bathrooms and comfortble design. the breakfast at the club level was basic. would stay here but only suiets not the normal rooms. oh i forgot the ferry that takes u to the other side is next to u but the subway(metro) is a bit further away. swimming pool was great also. if anyone needed more info u can email me on cm3207@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great harbour view!e”
Reviews.Author: cliffandjules
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a harbour view room. The view is excellent, although slighly spoilt during our stay by the re furbishment of the convension centre next door, but great view. Rooms are on the small side, but well equipped and clean. We were room only and had breakfast there one day, but as this is expensive (nearly 20GBP each) if you can get a good B and B rate, go for it. A really lovely pool with sunbeds is available on 11th floor, the website does not make as much of this as it should, it is superb.

Reviews.Title: “A most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Long-haul-traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as the first stop on our honeymoon. Check in was very efficient, it was a large hotel but there were plenty of staff to check us in. They congratulated us straight away and about 10 minutes after we had got to our room a celebration cake, small bottle of champagne, green tea and a plate of fresh fruit arrived. The room was spotless, tastefully decorated and we had a fantastic view over the harbour. The swimming pool was also very pleasant and relaxing. On our final night there was an amazing thunderstorm and we sat watching it through the floor to ceiling window of our bedroom. The concierge was most helpful and gave us lots of information about the places to visit. The hotel is situated opposite the star ferry so we travelled each night to Kowloon for dinner as the place was busier. Our only negative was that the staff kept calling us Mr and Mrs Jones (my maiden name) and my husband kept having to correct them but this was only a minor thing! We had a most enjoyable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ictd
Reviews.Content: greay hotel and outstanding staff, club lounge rooms a must for free drink nice food during happy hour with fab views over harbour

Reviews.Title: “Keen to make a profit”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Harbourview in late September, and were impressed by the location and qualities of the hotel. However, we found the staff were somewhat keener on extracting a profit than on providing old-fashioned service. Based on past experience, I prefer the Grand Hyatt opposite!

Reviews.Title: “A little underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: noonie
Reviews.Content: Having read all of the reviews I was a little disappointed to wait around ten minutes to check-in (after complaining to the supervisor that I had been there a while and she was ignoring me) - and then get a side harbour view above an extremely noisy street, bearing in mind that I am a Marriott VIP. The room was clean and tidy but a little tired and drab and extremely small (room 09 on all floors) - and to be avoided in my view. Breakfast was a pretty good affair as was the health club / swimming pool shared with the Grand Hyatt. Maybe I was expecting too much but choice of room seems very important to these ratings...and my room was not that great. As an area there is plenty to do in Wan Chai but I still prefer Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: smurf76
Reviews.Content: We spent a week of our honeymoon at the Renaissance Harbour View hotel and were extreemly impressed.
