First off, the location is excellent, a stone's throw from the Convention Center, with fabulous harbour views across to Kowloon. We received a honeymoon upgrade to one of their superior harbour rooms and it was excellent. Also, their honeymoon package was really good, champagne, cake, bath crystals, tea etc. We didn't have the breakfast in the hotel so can't comment, but did eat in the European style restaurant which was top notch. We also had the Dim Sum in their local restuarant and it was excellent. However, watch out for the wine and drink prices, very expensive compared to local Wanchai bars. A major plus for this hotel is the outdoor pool on the 11th floor, it's fab! with great city and harbour views. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Julesn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at start of August this year for 5 nights. We were lucky enough to use Marriott points for the stay, but paid to upgrade to a harbour view room - well worth it! The views are amazing - including the thunder / lightening storm on our last night as a tropical storm brushed past!! Rooms a little on the small side, but well equipped, I understand this is the norm in HK. Pool lovely, but barely spent 5 mins there as so much else to do! Personally loved being on the island and getting Star Ferry over to Kowloon - Very close by and easy for buses and underground too. Shopping near and whole area clean and safe! Higly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bayston
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this hotel which made our 4 day stopover in Hong Kong so memorable. We were on the 36th floor with absolutely stunning views over the harbour to Kowloon and the New Territories in the distance. The window was floor to ceiling and sitting in the comfortable armchairs you could lose yourself just watching the passing shipping which ranged from tiny sampans to huge container ships. The presentation of the room was immaculate and the staff made every effort to make our stay enjoyable without being obsequious. Centrally located, this is the perfect hotel for a brief stop as you do not waste time getting around, with the ferry almost on your doorstep and a very helpful tours desk in the main lobby.We have been recommending this hotel to all our friends and at least 2 have already booked!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a room & view”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_england
Reviews.Content: We travelled for 5 weeks and this was our last hotel and what a hotel it was! It was a good thing we didn't stay here first otherwise we would have been disappointed with all the others! We had a deluxe harbour view room on the 26th floor. The view was really good and overlooked the harbour and Kowloon. We could see the laser/light show from our room. The room had a huge king size bed and all the lights, tv, radio, alarm etc. were operated from a panel next to each side of the bed. The service here was brilliant. Every night a chocolate was left on the pillow. On the telephone there was a button called "Delighted to serve" and they were. We don't get room service that often but on our first night after a long flight from Sydney we did. The food was gorgeous and well served and presented. The hotel is located on Hong Kong Island right behind the Exhibition Centre. The ferry terminal to Kowloon is just outside the hotel so the "Star Ferry" can be caught across for the equivalent of 15p each! The MTR (subway) is a short 5ish minute walk away and even walking to the centre is not too far. When we return to Hong Kong we will definitely return to this hotel. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: drmarkf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 adjacent harbour-view rooms for 9 nights in July 2006. The booking was made through the Trailfinders agency in the UK and included flights to HK and Bangkok with Gulf Air - the whole lot for a very keen price. We found the Renaissance to be ideal for our needs. It's well placed, with the Star ferry to TST and Hung Hom a couple of minutes walk, and the MTR in Wanchai about 7 minutes walk. There are always loads of taxis available. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Nice pool [a major plus in HK], and Broadband network available in the rooms. The rooms are adequately sized by HK standards, and the views were fine. There's a 7-to-11 minisuperparket in the Great Eagle Centre next door, and loads of restaurants of all prices and styles within 10' walk. We had very few negatives, and none serious: breakfasts were rather expensive [but there's a Pacific coffeeshop a minute's walk away in the Great Eagle Centre, and the Renaissance's restaurants were otherwise reasonable by HK hotel standards]; they were refurbishing rooms on our floor while we were there, but they only worked from 10am - 5pm, and we couldn't actually hear any of the work once we were in our rooms with the doors shut [might not have been so good it we'd been in a closer room].

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: han2606
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for 2 nights. Check in was quick, no problems at all. However, the first room we were given was right next to the lifts and very noisy so we requested to be moved. The second room had a view of the pool and was very nice, we were also given a welcome bottle of champagne and a cake as it was our honeymoon. The room was nicely decorated with comfortable furniture. The breakfasts here are fantastic, loads of choice and good quality. We did have one other meal in the hotel restaurant but that wasn’t as good as breakfast. We didn’t get a chance to explore much around the hotel but the surroundings seemed fine. There is a lovely pool with a great view over the Harbour which was nice to cool off in. All in all a very good hotel with good staff and we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Views in most of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days but we could have stayed longer. The rooms are okay but the pool is nice. The hotel is close to the ferry to Kowloon where we visited daily because my husband had three suits made at Sam's Tailor on Nathan Road. There is a Renaissance in Kowloon but they don't have harbor views. There is also a J.W. Marriott near Hong Kong Park where I will stay next time because it is in Central where most of the nightlife occurs. You must ride the Hong Kong tram and take the peak tram to Victoria Peak for the most outstanding views of the city. We spent little time in the hotel because there was so much to see and do. The view from the promenade in Kowloon is something to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hong Kong location”
Reviews.Author: NWood_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hong for 6 nights as my partner's sister lives and works here ... we found this to be a perfect location for visiting any part of "The Island" or for getting to Kowloon, the airport or any of HK's major attractions. The Renaissance is located in Wan Chai directly on top of the HK Convention & Exhibition Centre, overlooking the amazing HK harbour and across the road from Wan Chai Star Ferry Pier, with boats taking only 5 mins to Tsim Sha Tsui across the water. Wan Chai MTR station is only 5 mins walk away via a series of interconnecting aerial walkways that take you through Central Plaza skyscraper. For airport access, an easy 25 mins from HKG via the Airport Express to Central Station (Hong Kong) and then 2 mins in a cab. Be warned, there is a charge per bag by taxis, but with downtown check-in available, this airport transport is fantastic. The Renaissance is without doubt one of HK's premier located hotels and somewhere between 4 and 5 star standard ... you can't beat the value for money and the hotel has everything a visitor could need. Rooms are not huge but are perfectly formed and upper floor rooms (we were on 35) offer stunning harbour vistas. The bar prices are high, but the cocktails are great. The reception staff are cheerful and there to help, anytime day or night and most requests are no hassle for them to entertain. Highly recommended hotel for the best pool terrace view in HK, on the 11th floor and separating the hotel from the Hyatt next door, who's guests also use the sizeable and exceptionally welcoming pool, terrace bar and cafe. The staff are helpful and the pool is a real haven for weary travellers with no shortage of loungers, towels or drink service. A great place to stay ... I'm sure we'll go back !

Reviews.Title: “Would not fail to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: phillywe
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop off of a business trip and I stayed at the hotel for three nights. The room (36th floor) overlooked the harbour and down to Causeway Bay, could not have been better. From check-in to check-out everything was problem free. The only downside was at breakfast the large numbers of American flight crew who can be quite loud, have a lack of the point that other people also need to have space, they should review their sloppy dress standard when not in uniform. Men in sweaty t-shirts, shorts and flip flops at breakfast is not a good way to start a morning...especially when most guests are in nice clean clothes and have to sit on the same seats. The room and bathroom was of a good size, well decorated and very clean. The towels and robe were the softest I have ever had in any hotel and the evening turndown service may be a little old-fashioned but, who can say that they do not feel good to see a couple of chocs on your pillow? Food was good but again the hotel appears to cater for the American market and serves very large portions - a bit too much for European taste. The staff are polite and helpful, food an drinks are reasonably priced. The ferry to Kowloon is within 5 minutes walk which makes the location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stopover”
Reviews.Author: RogerMorris
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Our first hotel on our honeymoon and the hotel was exeptional. Ideally located to get around Hong Kong Island and very close to the Star ferry to get over to Kowloon. The hotel treated us very well with the service and food being exceptional. A recommendation would be to upgrade to a harbour view with the views being excellent at dawn (especially when your trying to get over the jetlag). Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and amazing views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are large and well appointed, the harbourview rooms have simply breathtaking views and there is a beautiful outdoor swimming pool with amzing harbour views. The location is wonderful (on Hong Kong island nr the Star Ferry terminal. We had a great time here and having booked through our UK travel agent paid less than £70 per night for a harbourview room - you'll struggle to find a better value hotel with such great atrributes anywhere! We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days and can't find anything to complain about. Front desk staff was cheerful and very helpful. Transportation staff outside the hotel could not have been nicer. Room was clean and serviced promptly every day. Check-in and check-out was painless. No noise, pleasant lounge and a great pool area with excellent service and great sandwiches. Location is good for Causeway Bay and Happy Valley and Star Ferry is just a short walk from the hotel. MTR is perhaps a 5 minute walk and there are coffee shops, restaurants and grocery store all within a short walk. All in all a very fine hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaisance for 5 night in May 2006. I am a Marriott Rewards Gold Card memeber and had booked 2 nights in a standard room with points and 3 in a club floor harbour view room that I would pay for . I wanted to make sure the visit went smoothly so I emailed the hotel before my stay to ask if I could keep the same room for the whole visit and pay any upgrade fee. The hotel couldn't confirm this before my visit but said they would make a note of my request. When I arrived one of the guest relations managers checked me in and told me that they had allocated me a harbour view room for the full stay, it wasnt' on the club floor but this actually worked out cheaper than the original rate I had quoted! I could also still use the club lounge anyway with my rewards card. The room was lovely, ok it wasn't massive but I gather this is standard for Hong Kong. The view, however was spectacular! The club lounge was excellent for breakfast, afternoon tea and evening canapes. It is also on the 40th floor and had amazing views. I didn't use te restaurants in the hotel but all the staff we encountered were polite and professional - ensuring every request was dealt with first time. The trip was for our honeymoon and the hotel delivered a cake and bottle of champagne to our room on the first evening of our stay - lovely touch. Fresh fruit and bottled water was also replenished every day. Leisure facilities - great pool on the 14th floor with comfy sunbeds and nice gardens - did get a little crowded as it is shared with the Hyatt but it was a Sunday and v sunny! The location of the hotel is also excellent, particularly if you want to go over to Kowloon as it is right next to the Star Ferry terminal at Wan Chai. Taxi's were also very cheap to get around the island and we used these a lot. All in all, a fantastic hotel, great price and very well looked after. Hoping to go back to Hong Kong soon and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: M0ss
Reviews.Content: We wanted to break our trip home and decided to stay for 2 nights in Hong Kong. I used my Marriott points and expected a mediocre accommodation. The other 2 Marriott hotels were not available at the time I was booking. When we checked in, we requested for a transformer as our cameras and cell phones and other gadgets are 110V. House keeping staff who brought transformer beat us to our room. When we pulled the curtains, the view was spectacular. We had lighting, audio and temperature control on both sides of the bed. Fresh fruits and bottled water were provided every day. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful and service was great. We are planning on visiting Hong Kong again. This hotel is on top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Usually we love this place, but this time...”
Reviews.Author: ZejjaInMelb
Reviews.Content: Usually we love this place. Our family have stayed here for the last five years for all the reasons outlined by other reviewers. we even got to know the staff in our favorite hotel restaurant by name and they remembered us. We have also recommended it to others (who then recommend to others and so on...). This time...my parents stayed there for over one month and were not offered any kind of discount (even though they had been treated well when they stayed there previously at the same time of the year, over Christmas / New Year. My parents travel to HK at least twice a year and always stay at the Renaissance. Halfway during their stay, they were told that the rate of their room (standard) would increase by over 100% (over the new year period and beyond) even though they were not told this on booking the hotel, or at check in. When they asked for an alternative, they were told they could move to an inferior room and only pay a 50% increase. so they moved. while the front desk did apologise, the apology was inadequate. we will not stay there anymore, have told all of our friends, and are looking for alternative accomodation (which is why i am on this website). shame, renaissance, shame!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Jo5
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance in Hong Kong is located close to Victoria Harbour and you can get some amazing views across the bay. We had a room on the 33rd floor and I could have stayed in it for my entire trip just watching the Star Ferry and other boats go by and some amazing birds of prey which fly over the harbour. The rooms are quite small, although they are no smaller than London or NYC hotel rooms and they are cleaned to a high standard. They are quite masculine in design. The staff at the hotel were excellent and there were always enough staff at reception for there to never be a que. The bar serves great cocktails and some good bar snacks/lunch type food. We didn't sample any of the other hotel restaurants but if you do decide to there are some discount vouchers in the rooms. There is a swimming pool. Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great location, amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: RuthSheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the RHV, booked through Trailfinders - due to the length of our stay we received a free upgrade to a Harbour View Room on the 17th floor, and HOW amazing were the views!!! right across the harbour. We could have looked at it all day and night. There was quite a bit of traffic noise as the hotel is on a busy main road, but we were so tired from sightseeing every night that this didn't bother us at all. The hotel staff were brilliantly helpful, friendly and informative. We loved the 11th floor swimming pool with its fantastic waterfall - it was just a shame that on the days we had a swim it wasn't really boiing hot so didn't get to appreciate the full colling effect! We also loved the house band who sang in the lobby every evening - the lead singer had a wonderful voice (almost Karen Carpenter-esque) and the drummer seemed to be able to mimic most well-known singers, including Mark Knopfler! We only ate breakfast in the hotel on our first day, as it was quite pricey (HK $168 each) but definitely worth it just the once. The hotel location couldn't have been better either - just a short walk across the bridge to the Star Ferry, and a 5-10 minute walk to Wan Chai MTR station. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay here again if we went back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January for 3 days on business w/husband. Stayed in a harbour view club room. Loved the extra services of club level room w/breakfast and snacks and drinks throughout day. Their English was pretty good. View spectacular. Loved the heated pool, swam laps in the cool early mornings. Other lap swimmers went down to pool area w/robes and slippers over suit. Pretty casual. Enjoyed work out room as well. View great from the pool deck. Water fall in the pool, pretty. Not many people around in January. We went mid January before festivities of Chinese New Year. Walking distance to Time Square Mall---good sales there. Easy to get to ferry/ also walking distance. Would definitely stay there again. Also stayed at the Excelsior. LIked the Renaissance hotel and location better. No pool at Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: cmqp
Reviews.Content: Had a great 5 days at the Renaissance Harbour View. In terms of location, these are the positives: it's right on the harbour next to the Star Ferry port (the trip from the island, where the hotel is, to the mainland is wonderful, but the trip back is justifiably decribed as "one of the world's great ferry journeys"). The RHV is also above the massive convention centre, if you happen to be visiting for business as I was. The downside: Wan Chai itself is slightly seedy - apparently the former red light district..! It's also difficult to reach because of the 8-10 minute walk to the MTR station, and the appalling road traffic around the hotel due to the hotel's proximity to the endlessly-congested cross-harbour tunnel. If you can live with this inconvenience, you'll love this place. The hotel itself can't be faulted. I'm in the Marriott Rewards scheme, and emailed in advance to say we'd like as nice a room as possible. They didn't disappoint! When we arrived, we were shown up to our room on the 35th floor, which had a breathtaking view of Victoria Harbour. Floor-to-ceiling windows made the most of the postcard scenery that greeted us through the curtains, and the endless activity on the waterway was fascinating. It compensated for a relatively limited TV channel selection, although they had an enormous selection of PPV movies on demand. The room service wasn't too expensive, and the food was generally good. The breakfast buffet especially was enormous and is highly recommended for those who don't have a cholesterol problem. Maybe burn it off in the secluded 11th floor external garden with outdoor swimming pool and tennis courts. It's a great spot to relax or work out, and we hardly saw anyone using it while we were there. Every day, pilots and cabin crew could be seen in the lobby checking in or out. Someone very wisely once told me to stay where the airline workers stay because they always know the best places, and it's certainly true here. Renaissance Harbour View is a really great base from which to explore HK, although perhaps the experience is different if you're in a Garden View Room without the wonderful harbour vistas.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice pool”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Ball2007
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, recommend paying extra for a harbour view room. Has a really nice pool area. Bar is a little boring as are most of the public areas, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, standard facilities but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Sal the Fat Fish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Harbour View for 4 days in August, stretching over a weekend. It was more for business, although I met up with several relatives and old friends there as well. It rained for most of my stay there, so it was not an enjoyable trip. Now, on the hotel itself. I have entertained and dined at the Renaissance HV before several times, in my on-off trips to HK. But this is the first time I am staying in it. I chose it for the convenience of going to the offices in Wan Chai. So for location, it is very good. It is also attached via a rather long, covered overhead walkway (over a building) to the Wan Chai station entrance. So it's convenient for a business traveller wishing to take the MTR as well. Finally, being at Wan Chai itself means the convenience of lots of eateries suited for the taste of an overseas Chinese like me, and some last-minute shopping too, especially for traditional Cantonese snacks. In terms of facilities, this hotel is nothing to shout about. The pool is nice, but as I said, it was raining when I was there, so didn't use it at all. I was at the gym, which was nice but feel a bit dated. The Chinese restaurant, Dynasty, has a nice view over Victoria Harbour, and the quality of food has been consistently good in the past few years I ate there (including this time round). The business centre was average, but pricey. Photocopying costs HKD 8 per page! Elsewhere, the lobby lounge plays some cheesy cover versions by a Filipino band at night, while the design of the check in counter being on the second floor (up an escalator from the taxi drop-off point) was not ideal. Service was so-so, not spectacular but adheres to the Marriot no-nonsense, business-like style. Because of my Marriot Rewards card, I was given a complimentary upgrade to a Harbour View room, which was nice. The room had ceiling to floor glass windows, but you you can't open them to let the breeze in. It overlooks the western part of Victoria Harbour, on the Hong Kong Islandf side. But the poor weather did not give a clear view. I reckon ona clear day, I would be able to see Causeway Bay, North Point and beyond, and also TST West and Kowloon Tong. The room, despite the upgrade, is stil small. But for HK standards, I was not hoping for much. The decor looks tired, while the bed was the soft type (not to my liking). The bathroom did not have a separate shower but overall cleanliness was very good. Just that I feel very 1980s staying in the room, except for the broadband internet connection. There was fax machine, which I did not use. I requested for an extra phone to be placed on the working desk, and the hotel staff readily obliged. Writing my reports and replying emails while overlooking the harbour was a good feeling, marred only by the incessant rains. Overall, I think this is a good place to stay, but only for business. The hotel lacks character and failed to excite. If I'm on holiday, I'd still stick to my upgraded room at the Marco Polo Hong Kong Hotel, which I have also reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel to start our Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Cornish
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Hong Kong end of October for our 2 day stop over to Australia. We arrived at The Renaissance Harbour View and were greeted by friendly and efficient staff. We went up to our room and opened the door - it was the wow factor! The view out to Victoria Harbour and Kowloon was amazing. The room was spacious and clean - no complaints. We had breakfast and dinner in The Coffee Lounge (buffet style) and again no complaints. We only had two days for sight-seeing so it suited us to eat here though we would have liked to had dinner at Dynasty one night, maybe next time! The hotel is 5 mins from the Wan Chai Ferry Pier and quick to get to Kowloon. The pool was also wonderful and we spent a couple of hours chilling after check out and waiting for our shuttle coach to the airport. Would return to this hotel if we ever return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hotel was the last leg of our holiday of a lifetime. We had decided to end our holiday in style in Hong Kong. It is a fantastic hotel, we had a superb view over the harbour. The facilities are amazing, staff very polite and friendly. Would definitly stay here again and strongly advise anyone visiting Hong Kong to stay here. The location is two minutes from the Star Ferry to Kowloon. We stayed from the 17-20th Nov'05.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Harbour View Hotel Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.1 Harbour Road, Hong Kong, China
